The best thing was the bed - one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in; I wanted to take it home with me. A minor irritation was that the flat screen TV was mounted to the side of the bed, not the best position for viewing. The bathroom was clean and had everything we needed. The location of the hotel is excellent- one block from Times Square and about 3 blocks to the subway. Yet 46th Street itself is quiet and noise was not an issue at all. There are several restaurants within one block, along with two deli's. We enjoyed St Andrew's Pub and Restaurant, right across the street. The continental breakfast at the hotel has the usual items, toast and bagels, a couple of cereals, pastries, yogurt, and hard boiled eggs. Everything was fresh and the breakfast attendant kept everything clean and stocked. The only drawback is that the breakfast room could use more tables - I suspect there is simply no room to expand. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: MagsAU
Reviews.Content: Comfort Inn Midtown is a gem! Comfortable beds, with everything you need in the room. But lets face it, who wants to stay in your room when you are in NY. Right off times square this is the perfect location to get anywhere. The area is safe and the staff helpful. A particular mention to the guy that checked me in. Originally from India, he had fun having a go at me about our not so successful aussie cricket team. It was nice to discuss something so familiar. A car was organised by front desk to take me to the airport. $55 tips, tolls everything. Free internet and fitness centre and continental breakfast make it the best place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location, very well appointed, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jsarchibald
Reviews.Content: This was the highlight of our trip. We expected an old room in an old hotel, but found a very modern room, great service and a perfect location. We were within a 2 minute walk to Times Square, and another 2 to the Subway, restaurants galore and dozens of shops. It is very obvious that the hotel had a professional refurbishment not long ago, and it works. The hotel feels old world classy downstairs, and the rooms comfortable and contemporary. We can't recommend this hotel enough, pick this one, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: annabelsmills
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to New York. The location of the hotel allowed us to visit the Opera House, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Cloisters. The hotel is right off Broadway, 2 blocks from Time Square. Travelling by subway was easy thanks to the superb and friendly advice of the personnel at the hotel. They allowed us to store our luggage the day we checked out for several hours and also the following week when we returned from a second part of our trip, when we had a 6 hour stop over in NY. The rooms were very quiet, very clean, nicely decorated and the beds were oh SO comfortable. Thank you Comfort Inn for making my first visit such a wonderful memory!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: artistkay92101
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 4 nights at this hotel while sightseeing with friends. Having been in NYC several times and paying twice the price at other hotels, this was a very pleasant surprise! Great Times Square location! While the rooms are not large, they are adequate and nicely appointed. Everything was very, very clean. The staff was quite friendly & helpful. A basic breakfast was included (that's an additional savings). I was also pleased with the car service they booked for us. It was only $5 more than the cramped cab we rode in from JFK to the hotel. I'll definitely book this hotel for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “By far the most bang for your buck in the area”
Reviews.Author: Lost_N_Translation
Reviews.Content: We paid $135/night during the height of the tourist season for this newly renovated room a block off of Times Square. The rooms are small, but very comfortable. If possible, request an 01 or 02 room - they're on the corner and quite a bit larger. I highly recommend this hotel, and it will be my go-to hotel for all future NYC stays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: vafrica
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in NYC many times and have paid triple for hotels that did not even come close to the value and convenience of the Comfort Inn Midtown. Rooms were spotless, continental breakfast was included (bagels, toast, cereals, yogurt, fruit), the business centre didn't charge for internet access or printing of boarding passes, the location was fantastic especially for seeing theatre, and the staff were helpful and courteous. I asked for a room that didn't face the street so my window was basically facing a brick wall but it was the first time that I have heard absolutely no street noise in a NYC hotel! It was so quiet and great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: sdmikev
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to NYC many times in the last couple decades and this may have been the best deal for a hotel I have seen. It's spotless, located in the center of everything, close to several subway stops and the rooms are sized nice. The staff was also VERY nice. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to someone looking for a great price and a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for people on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: classic_queen
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed her in mid-May 2009 and had a wonderful time. The hotel was in a perfect location (few blocks from Time Square and Rockefeller Center) and provided all the things that we needed. Our room had it's own safe which was very nice to have. The room was relatively quiet with it's location and the general noise from the city. It was nice not to have to walk far for a main subway station. We spent most of our time walking around and the hotel was easy to come back to once we were familiar with the area. We would stay here again the next time we're in NY. The staff was VERY nice and pleasant to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traceter
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night as a Stopover at the end of our vacation to save some money. We were very impressed with the staff they were all so friendly and helpful. The room was small ( we had stayed in another NYC hotel the previous week which was larger but way more expensive) but it was immaculate, very clean, soft towels and comfy bed. The location was a winner for us, the Scottish Bar across the road was pretty nice and we went to The View Bar at the Top of The Marriot Hotel for the cocktails, buffet and to experience a revolving bar/restaurant. Times Square is at the end of the block but we found the hotel to be quiet. Would stay again if on a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a Manhattan stay”
Reviews.Author: KonaRod
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at this hotel for vacation. The room was small for the three of us, but that was expected; otherwise, it was clean and very quiet for NY City. Location is outstanding with theaters and subway stations all very close. Staff was friendly and helpful. Also provided is a free basic continental breakfast (in a small room) and exercise facility. The rate (for Manhattan) was very good and we would definitely consider this hotel for a NY stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel made of friends”
Reviews.Author: MartinsBrazil
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, nice people view, since the bellboys to the boy's breakfast. I recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: sharr53gc08
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed three nights. We were in NY to enjoy the theatre. This hotel is in a perfect location for that (1/2 a block from Times Square). Our room was small (not unexpected), but we had all the space we needed. The room was well-appointed, spotlessly clean and quiet (2nd floor away from the street). The bathroom was also clean and functional. I liked the business center and the continental breakfast was convenient. Wouldn't hesitate to book again. Staff were helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel in excellent location .... will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: marian31265
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a 3 day weekend in mid Sept. It was my first time at this hotel and I was very pleased with my entire stay. The check-in went smoothly and the staff was professional. The rooms are somewhat on the small side ... but I had a king size bed and a big screen tv in the room. My room did not face the street and it was extremely quiet. It is very convenient to Times Square. I go to NY about once a year to see plays and usually stay at other comparably priced hotels in the area (Milford Plaza, Hotel Edison etc.). This was a much nicer hotel and only about a 5 minute walk to Times Square. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back! This is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: CCR227
Reviews.Content: Indeed, this is a great location-a block from Times Square, close to good restaurants and the theater district. The rooms are small, but some more expensive hotels have much smaller rooms. Don't expect many frills or great views, but the staff was friendly and helpful, the beds were comfortable (pillowtop), and room was very clean. We weren't asked to write a review, but we decided this will be our hotel of choice for future trips. It is an unbeatable value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michael_LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the 9/4 - 9/7 weekend. I would say all the hotel staff we encountered were very friendly. The hotel room is not fancy but very clean and comfortable. The location is great, close to Rockfeller Center and Times Square. All subway lines are accessible within two blocks. I would suggest bringing ear plugs when you visit New York in all cases, it really helps you to get a good sleep no matter you get front side or back side rooms. In Midtown New York there is no true "quiet" rooms, beleive me. Breakfast was good too. I really recommend this hotel. Unless you are looking for style, this a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Nice Location - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CodyDC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Labor weekend trip to NYC. Always stayed on New Jersey side before as hotels are cheaper for price and amenities. However, this time wanted to stay in mid-town to be closer to the city excitement. The hotel is in nice location and convenient to subway - the orange line was right around the corner and the different subway lines options a few blocks to 42 and Time Square. The Top of the Rock was 3 minutes walking distance away - same with the top end of Times Square. I was very surprised about how easier it was to get to hotel from JFK airport. I just hopped the Air Train to Jamaica station and then took the LIRR which took about 25 minutes to reach Penn Station. It is about 20 minute walk from Penn Station to hotel or you can just take a taxi or take the subway to Times Square which is one stop north. As for the hotel itself, it is clean and seemed to be remodeled a few years back. The staff was nice and helpful - room was ready upon arrival around 11 am. The only issue is the noise from the street. There are some pubs across the street which get loud at night so I had to run the AC window unit to drown out the street noise. But over all I liked the hotel and would stay again next visit to NYC. And the hotel had free wi-fi in the rooms - so I could use my iPhone to check LIRR and Subway schedules.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisieb
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, our experience was wonderful. Ivonne, at the front desk was so cheerful and welcoming. The gentlemen who assisted us and handled our luggage were great as well. the room was immaculate and breakfast was great. We also enjoyed the fact that we were able to store our luggage after we checked out. we will stay there next time for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant staff - Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RJGutierrez
Reviews.Content: I reserved the room through Apple Core Hotels. While the location is good for theater events and the rooms are decent, customer service is terrible. My room was reserved in my name with my credit card - in my maiden name. My husband was able to check in, no questions asked. When I attempted to check in they refused to give me a key until his return, changed the rate, and proceeded to quote corporate policy - all for a $15 dollar increase. I walked out to wait for my husband and when we both re-entered a woman was talking to the employee. All she was interested in was getting us to initial the $15 increase. I sent an online complaint to their corporate site and the the GM answered my complaint in a manner that indicated where the employee gets his arrogance and ignorance. Guess what...it was the woman. This GM did not bother to introduce herself or ask us any questions that night. All she wanted just our initials. In addition, my husband asked this same employee for directions to the theater. An 'I don't know' would have sufficed. He sent us two avenues and four blocks out of our way. The theater was literally around the corner from the hotel. We lost 20 minutes and had to rush back to make it before the 8:00 PM start. Don't bother! There are plenty of great hotels at a low price in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: novak500
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at his hotel Aug 26-30. We found it clean, comfortable and quiet. As many others have posted, the hotel has a great location. We found all the staff to be helpful and friendley. Would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chagara
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and enjoyed every moment of our stay. Yes the room was very small but it had all we needed. It was clean, comfortable and best of all, super close to everything. Just a short walk to Broadway, Restaurants, Parks and every thing that makes New York the exciting place that it is known for. We were quickly greeted with a friendly, smiling staff upon check in and the smiles continued throughout our entire stay. The breakfast area is small but has enough choices to please everyone. It is a continental breakfast. Again, let me mention that the room is very small but who goes to NYC to hang out in their hotel room? We have absolutely no complaints about this hotel or their staff and will without a doubt stay again. Except that next time, we will stay more nights. I highly recommend this hotel for it's value, comfort, convenience, cleanliness and friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Check In experience!”
Reviews.Author: MosheO
Reviews.Content: When you book a hotel online and arrive with a printed confirmation, do you have confidence that the hotel will honor that? Don't be so sure if you make your reservations via Choice Hotels! I chose this hotel carefully after reading many reviews. It was a special occasion coming to NYC to celebrate my wife's birthday. We arrived at 11 PM exited and even planned a late dinner after check-in in a nice nearby restaurant. However the reception person printed a registration form with rates about $50 higher per night. When I showed him my printed confirmation letter which showed the original rates, he said there's nothing he can do and "either sign the form withe higher rates or you cannot check in". We asked him to first get the room and then sort this out but he refused and even suggested that if we don't like those rates maybe look for another hotel, which I thought was outrageous! He then tried to call Choice Hotels. It took some 20 minutes of waiting to talk to them, and amazingly they declined my rates too! After finally talking with Choice Hotels supervisor, it turned out that my rates were raised "because I called them to ask for a room facing the back-side" to avoid street noise. Needless to say - they never mentioned it would change the rate, and the hotel does not charge any extra for that anyway. It was after midnight when we finally checked in after giving up and agreeing to sign the registration form. We were nervous and frustrated and had to dine in a fast food place since the restaurant already closed. The matter was settled only the following day, when Choice hotels customer service called me, admitted their mistake, reset the rates and said they'll even discount one of the nights to compensate me. It was unbelievable that when we finally checked out, that additional discount was forgotten! (we did not bother to fix that) The hotel management claimed it was all Choice Hotel's fault. I thought that the guy at the reception should have honored our letter, check us in and then sort this out instead of offering us to look elsewhere. Last - the hotel and room was very nice. Too bad it was overshadowed by the Check in experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and pratical choice”
Reviews.Author: ChispitaPanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. It was a wonderful stay, good continental breakfast, clean rooms, and it stays less then a square from Times Square, you can go to many attractions by foot (Central Park, Macys, Rockfeller Center, St. Patrick Cathedral, 5th Av, Park Ave., Apple, Broadway, HB...), but if you preffer there are subway and bus station nearby. We'll certantly be staying here whenever we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel location was convenient and hotel was very clean”
Reviews.Author: callahanjen
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Noon our room was already ready. The hotel was small and the room was tiny but I expected that. For the price the location couldn't be beat. The room and hotel were very clean. Parking was in a garage diagonally across the street and when stamped by the Comfort Inn cost only $23 for 24 hours. I'd highly recommend this hotel. Also, I'm very noise conscious and I found the hotel to be very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gio_poa
Reviews.Content: Room is very good. Great location, half block to main Times Square. Easy access to subway. simple breakfast (1 fruit, cereal, milk, yogurt, bread. that's it)

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Beat This Place”
Reviews.Author: framolamdu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 21 til 25 July. This is the 2nd time I have stayed here since March and it has not disappointed me at all. I originally chose to stay here due to the excellent reviews on this site. I got a great rate of $149.99 falling to $129.99 and with free breakfast and free wi-fi this is such a fantastic price in the most central of locations. I agree with the reviewer who said the speed was above average as I had been in LA just before and the free wi-fi I got there was very slow. While I could not complain about my room last time this time it was even better as it was just set out more to my liking. The tv was facing the bed instead of being to the side of it and I had a shower cubicle instead of a bath/shower combi. They had very modern furnishing and it did appear like it had been newly renovated. It was serviced each day regardless of the time I left the room. Every member of staff I encountered were great and went out of their way. I am so glad I found this hotel as it has made it more affordable to come more often. It may not be the most modern of buildings from the outside but do not let that stop you. The St Andrews Restaurant and Bar opposite serves great food and the service was excellent. Loved the chinese food at John Shanghai just opposite and down slightly. Had a fantastic time and this will be my hotel of choice when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Comfortable, Quiet and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Roadwanderer
Reviews.Content: I rely heavily on TA for my travel plans; and, I will have to say that the positive reviews of this hotel were accurate. This was my first visit to NYC; and, the location is fantastic if you come to NYC to explore. There is a nearby Metro station and bus stops. We crammed alot in a few short days; so, the comfortable, clean, and quiet room we got made sleep instantaneous (I took a TA reviewer's advice and asked for a room in the back of the hotel...our room faced the back of the lovely church next door). Two reasonably priced nearby restaurants I recommend are: "Utsav" (very good Indian food) and "Amarone" (Italian...we went here before going to a Broadway show and loved it).

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisKathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited New York City for the first time at the end of July - I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel. The rooms were not very big was it was more than sufficient seeing that I didn't go to New York City to stay in the room. We were given a room in the back of the hotel - it was very quiet but absolutely no view. Would I stay at this hotel again - definitely yes. It was very close to Time Square and a lot of the attractions were in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TFE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in July 2009. Unlike most NYC hotels, this one was quiet and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room size would have been small anywhere besides Manhattan, but everything was so conveniently arranged that we were very comfortable. Nice bedside reading lamps and iPod compatible radio. Plus the wireless Internet signal was much stronger than most hotels. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and apparently fairly recently refurbished. Nice free breakfast. And you couldn't beat the location if you want to be near Times Square. Plus the price was extremely reasonable. I've already recommended this hotel to several friends. If you stay here, check out O'Briens Irish Pub across the street and Connolly's around the corner on 45th.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 87Fiero
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other posts. This is a great value in an excellent location. Times Square is around the corner. Restaurant Row is a block away on the other side of Times Square. Many theaters are close. NBC and Radio City are two blocks away. This is just a great central location. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was very small but recently renovated. Breakfast was simple, but it was all we needed. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bandlady
Reviews.Content: All of the previous reviews are right - this is a great hotel value on a street right off of Times Square. Rooms are small, as expected in NYC, but they are beautifully furnished - really a notch better than you would expect from a Comfort Inn. Staff is friendly and goes out of their way to help you. The fellow in the breakfast room was especially helpful. And free breakfast in NYC is a great perk! Both the room and the public areas were extremely clean, too. This place is such a bargain for tourists and theatergoers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: twood90
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in, I could tell that this hotel was going to be good. Clean, fresh looking lobby area, friendly staff and an effecient check in process. The negative points: Rooms were a bit dark Elevator is a bit slow The street outside smeels a bit sometimes Shower is loud. Those are the only negative points I can think of, positives: Spacious rooms Free Wifi Great location Nice breakfast 24 hour business centre In room safes Free phone calls within USA Modern furnishings Very comfy beds Good air conditioning Rooms serviced daily- clean towels etc. Overall an excellent hotel that I look forward to staying at again. I really couldn't fault the whole stay apart from a minor incident at check-out but thats not worth mentioning. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT INN lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Cheschirecat
Reviews.Content: We just got back today from NYC and stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from 06/03 -06/08. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were small, but in NYC I was expecting that. We asked for the largest room we could get away from the street and they obliged. I slept well, but did notice you have to be very careful with the doors because they slam easily . There was only 1 elevator, but we only chose to walk down the stairs once and that was only because I was scared I might be late for the Lion King. I wasn't. The staff was excellent and they were always asking us if we needed anything when we came downstairs. The breakfast was great. It was fruit, cold cereals, toast., danish, bagels, toaster waffles, boiled eggs, ect. I wish they had a microwave though. I do not like cold boiled eggs. I loved the whole wheat toast! The breakfast room is small, but I would always go up to a table that had 1 or 2 sitting at it and ask to sit down, so the wait was never long. All and all we will stay here again. It has LOCATION,. LOCATION, LOCATION right in Times Square and close to subway. I am glad we chose it! Staff directed us to Rosie O' Grady's and we ate there twice One of the greatest amenities they offer is that they will homd your suitcase until your room is ready, so we were able to go into Times Square while they readied our room!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Justine28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this property back in March 2009 for total of 5 nights and we were delighted with our stay. No wonder they have so many good reviews - it's truely a great choice of hotel when in Manhattan (Times Sq area). What we didn't like in the hotel was: 1. the rooms are really tiny - especially those not facing the street but this is not unusual in NYC hotels. The window we had was kinda fake cause it was facing the wall of another building, there was almost no daylight in the room due to that and it was very hot, but again it was also quiet. Also, you can't even open the window and have to rely on the airconditioning. 2. The A/C is very noisy and not great - sort of like too powerfull, it was soon very cold and "windy" in the room once it was on. But iit might be a good thing when the summer's hot... 3. Staying there is not the cheapest - but you pay for the area. We also found a great deal on hotels own website - they had a way better deal than all major hotel booking sites so definitely check it out! And now the things we liked and made our stay so pleasant: 1. the rooms & bathrooms are spotless clean, the cleaning staff are doing a great job! 2. we also enjoyed free continental breakfast - again the staff in the breakfast room are very efficient, very nice and helpfull, the place is clean, food is great - good choice (yogurts, juices, tea & coffee, waffles, bagles, pastries, donuts, fresh fruit etc.) & always very fresh & yummy. the tea & coffee is there all day long and you can take a cup to your room in the afternoon etc. 3. location is great - 2 mins from times sq, you can walk everywhere, to all major attractions, shops, sightseeing double-deckers etc. There's also plenty of good and not so expensive restaurants and bars (e.g. 2 Irish bars just opposite hotel), good quality take-aways etc. 4. There's also a tiny business centre (PCs, fax, printers, internet) at the hotel and it's all free of charge - e.g. we always travel with a laptop (free wifi) but we leave the printer at home;) - if you need to print your broadway tickets or other confirmations - you can do it for free in this hotel. very convenient I have to say if you're booking your attractions online and last minute. 5. They also have iPod docking stations in rooms - well done! wasn't expecting this and was delighted:) All in all we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it. In our case there were a lot more advantages than disadvantages - I only mentioned them to give you a fair review:) Would definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “It's All Good!”
Reviews.Author: Trisha4591
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after finding it here on Trip Advisor. It was clean, convenient and well priced. Less than a block from Times Square. Great breakfast; great staff; very clean and great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “You cant beat the location and the staff are great.”
Reviews.Author: Australia07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in May, and it is a great place to stay, just around the corner from Times Square but in a quiet and safe street. Sure, the rooms are small, but they are clean, well appointed and modern. We stayed in king rooms, and I would recommend the rooms facing the street as they are larger and lighter. There is a little noise in the street facing room, mainly early in the morning when the gargage trucks go by, but most of the time it is not a problem. There is a flatscreen TV in the room, coffee and tea making facilities, plenty of drawer space, and the bed is very comfortable. Wifi is free in the rooms and throughout the hotel, and also a computer room with 2 printers for guest use which is great for those travelling without laptops. The breakfast is great, cereal, toast, a range of pastries and bagels, waffles, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, juice and coffee. Coffee and Tea is available in the breakfast room throughout the day. As others have commented, the breakfast room is small, but we never had to wait long for a table and most days didn't have to wait long at all. The staff member working in the breakfast room is very friendly, makes sure the food is replenished regularly and keeps the area clean. We found all the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful, and they will securely store your luggage if you have a late flight etc. The location here is fantastic, and while the rooms may be small, it is New York and value for money this is a great hotel. Highly recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Midtown was a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Cinque44
Reviews.Content: It is a bit risky choosing an inexpensive hotel in a good location in NYC. The Comfort Inn Midtown was a real winner for us. First of all, location was perfect - a half block off of Times Square. Next best thing was the friendly and very helpful staff. How pleasant it was to NOT see signs of frustrated, tired empolyees. They all went out of their way to offer help - especially "Sidibi" the bellhop. The rooms were crisp & clean and nicely furnished. Not all rooms were spacious like ours. We at first were assigned to a rather small room toward the back part of the hotel. We simply asked if there was another room with more space or a window view. They said there was (a handicap room), but that it was not yet ready. We gladly waited (sightseeing on Times Square). We were given room 602 with 2 windows with a view. Four days later 602 was needed for a handicap person and we gladly moved to 802. They actually moved all our things for us to the new room so that we could be on our way . Both rooms were spcaious and comfortable with lots of closet & drawer space. But keep in mind - this is New York where space is at a premium. About the only complaint we had was that the dining area was too small. But the food was good. So yes I would definitely go back to this hotel - and ask for a front room facing the street. We did not have any street noise the whole week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: Vespette
Reviews.Content: At $175/nt using AAA this must be the best bargain in Manhattan! Rooms are tastefully updated, with desk, flat screen TV and nice lighting. We had room 500, view of a brick wall but very quiet. Rest of family had street facing rooms, 501 & 601, that were larger but also had street noise. Nice continental breakfast, fruit, yogurt, bagels, pastries, toaster waffles, juice, and coffee in a small room, but we took our coffee to the nicely appointed lobby. Two computers for internet. The staff are very helpful and courteous. Only 1 block to Times Square, and theater district. Multiple subway stops nearby-get a map from the front desk.Try the Grey Line bus tours when the feet wear out. Lots of restaurant on W. 46th. Try the Havanna Club a few doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: SameerSah
Reviews.Content: Extremly good vbalue for money...good breakfast and very courteous staff

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: livetoski
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 16 months ago. The same lady who worked the front desk last time was still there and remembered me. Also the man who takes care of the continental breakfast area was there from 16 months ago. The fact that both employees were still there speaks well for the hotel in my opinion. Make sure you ask for a room NOT facing the street as it can be very noisy in the middle of the night otherwise. Rooms in the rear of the hotel are quiet though. I would reccommend this hotel for the excellent location and clean comfortable rooms. Rate I booked one month before trip was $189 a night. Two days before I left I checked on-line and the rate had dropped to $149 a night and I called and they adjusted the rate for me no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Great Staff - Location”
Reviews.Author: CarlosViseu_Portugal
Reviews.Content: excellent location, the staff is impeccable, I strongly recommend, when you return to NY I will be in the same hotel, so need to repair the elevator and it does not have air conditioning and e very slow, with regard to the rooms and bathrooms are good and very clean and spotless

Reviews.Title: “Location - Location - Location”
Reviews.Author: PaFrequenttraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned May 2 with teenage son. This was the perfect place. Just as good as hotels that charge 2 or 3x more. Room updated and clean. Bed very comfy. Absolutely no problems. Everything very close within walking distance. When returning to New York will stay at this hotel. Jovannie at the front desk very helpful and pleasant. In fact all staff very friendly. Like someone said before a hidden gem in the middle of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Koolit
Reviews.Content: Just can't beat the location, one a half block from the center of Times Square. Very comfortable older hotel. Breakfast was good, clean and its the spot. I can't say enough about the staff - they were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very kind staff and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: garoZadar
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in hotel. We were surprised how near is Times Square! We had even a breakfast included in price of acommodation, what is not usually for hotels in NYC. The room was very quite. The staff were very helpfull and kind. We would definietly recommend this hotel and we will probably come back one day in the most beautifull town in world, of course in this hotel!!!:-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sam_moore06
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the comfort inn for 6 nights 14th-20th april staff were great rooms cleaned and fresh towels every day close to everything just a few minutes to times square would deff stay here again would recommend to anyone looking for a clean comfortable hotel in the centre of new york

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Missyhaha
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a comfortable, affordable, conveniently located, clean hotel. Comfort Inn Midtown turned out to be all that we had hoped. The location 1 block from Times Square was amazing, but the hotel itself seemed enough off the beaten path to not be hectic or loud. Sure there was some traffic noise, but you're in a big city. The hotel has 70 rooms or so on 9 compact floors -central elevator separates the floor into 2 wings with 5 or 6 rooms per wing. Nice features - clean, comfortable bed, continental breakfast, friendly, helpful staff, access to free wireless in room and printer accessibility in small business center. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, low price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: IgnacioK
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a the Comfort Inn for 4 nights. Last time we were in the Casablanca and we got some serious pampering there, so we were prepared to be slightly disappointed. We were dead wrong. While not at the same level of comfort than the Casablanca, we got: PROS: 1) Top notch Service, always with a smile. Geovanni (not spelled like this, but you know who you are) spent almost an hour solving a problem we had with the airline. Thanks from Ignacio (Argentina). 2) Great, clean and big (for NYC standards) room, the most comfortable bed I've ever experienced at a hotel (and I've stayed at a LOT of them), great LCD TV, clean and decently sized bathroom, hot water at all times. 3) Decent continental buffet breakfast, you get coffee, tea, milk, danish, pastries, bagels, cream cheese, jam, butter, orange and apple juice, 3 types of cereals, yogurts, apples and bananas. 4) Location, location, location, 1 block to broadway, 2 block to Times Sq. Great. 5) Beautiful "old school" lobby. 6) Free local and long distance calls (within the US) from your room. Free Wi-Fi. 7) Some amenities we didn't have the chance to use but were available: 24 hour open gym, clean and with 3-4 new machines (we got plenty of exercise walking around); office center, and very cheap (again, for NYC standards) parking. (MINOR) CONS: 1) The glass door at the bathroom can be a nuisance. 2) The heating system can get noisy at times. 3) Some renovations were undergoing and the entire facade was covered in scaffolds. Guess it will take some weeks for them to come off. 4) Breakfast lounge can be packed and you would have to wait for your turn to sit and have your breakfast. Be there early! All in all, you can't beat it for the price. It gets a thumbs up from me. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I have found my favorite NYC hotel but that bathroom door...”
Reviews.Author: Euradiohead
Reviews.Content: If I ever return to New York City, this is were I will stay! The room was bigger than I imagined, everything was new and it had the best TV I've ever had in a hotel room (though we didn't use it much). I think it was about a size 40" or bigger flat-screen TV. For you iPod owners, the room also has an iHome instead of a cheap clock radio, NICE! There are plenty of electrical plugs everywhere and FREE Wi-Fi. If you wake up early enough (we didn't) there's free continental breakfast provided downstairs and free newspaper. The hotel has a small but FREE gym that provides water and towels. We had a king size bed that I miss to this day, SO comfortable! Service was, for the most part, excellent except for at check-in the Asian guy that helped us had accidentally overcharged our credit card for close to 10 times the amount he was supposed to and didn't tell us. Halfway through our vacation we discovered a few thousand dollars were charged instead of a few hundred and we were in a panic! We thought we were in New York without any money. After talking with the bank all was settled but it was still 30 minutes of stress that could have been avoided. After a deep sigh of relief, all was forgiven and our vacation continued. The bathroom door is as see-through as a foggy window! We didn't mind it except whenever I had to, you know, sit down. I would do this with the lights off to have as much privacy as possible. If you're not comfortable with the people you're staying with this bathroom door is gonna be tough times for you. I also wished the hotel provided conditioner, all they had was shampoo. The room can get pretty warm so expect to run that cooler at night. Location, Location, Location!!!! Located between Times Square and Rockefeller Center it is PERFECT! Right in the middle of the city and close to everything. Across the street is the St. Andrews Pub, we fell in love with this place and we usually went there before bed every night. Conner is the bartender there, he's a nice guy and gives great service. My only complaints were: -the credit card "woops" which I'm sure won't happen again. -the room gets warm -the bathroom door being see-through -the Dasani Water machine in the lobby is tricky -no conditioner -Bathroom sink water.. the Cold is freezing the Hot is clear lava

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable--great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: dogski
Reviews.Content: I concur with previous reviewer. Clean, comfortable room. Great mid-week rates considering location---1/2 block from Times Square. Hotel is not much to look at from exterior, but inside looks fresh. We requested room away from street. No view to speak of but it was quiet. Staff was very courteous. Check booking rates frequently as they fluctuate widely. Parking for guests across the street was also less than many other hotels at $23/day. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super value for very clean comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: canuck_tourist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown last weekend and had a great stay. The check in was quick and friendly, the room was spotless (room 806) with a king size bed, small but efficient and clean modern washroom with shower. The bed and linens were better than I expected, the room was quiet, and the window opened. There was not much of a view, but because the hotel is right beside a church, it was very quiet. The parking was $23/day, which is a great find, and the room was an even better deal. Phoning the hotel directly, with CAA we paid $139/nt right on Times Square! I was worried with such a bargain, but it worked out fabulously(and I am one of those travellers who goes on Tripadvisor and puts the worst reviews first....if I see bugs or hair I'm outta there!). I will guaranteed stay there again. The rooms are not fancy, but they are clean, modern, flat screen tv's and a simple breakfast which gets you through the morning to that great lunch in Greenwich or LIttle Italy! The staff was equally great. No problems wtih check in, no billing issues, and when we had problems with our in room safe, they arranged to put our stuff behind the front desk securely while waiting for the serviceguy to arrive from somewhere in the building. So no delay in our touring! When we returned, it was all fixed and we picked up our things from the front desk with no problems. I highly reccommend the Comfort Inn Midtown!

Reviews.Title: “good value clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: daddywagz
Reviews.Content: great deal rooms clean and efficient--small but who cares in nyc--staff friendly--breakfast very good--computer in lobby---fantastic location and cheap parking--will stay here everytime im in nyc

Reviews.Title: “awesome NYC experience”
Reviews.Author: emitome
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed here for 5 nights and it was our first time in NYC. The location was great. A few minutes from Times Square and just several more to Rockerfella Centre. It was at the heart of it all. We had the room with a King size bed which made the room a bit cramped but that was minor. The bed was comfy, the toilet was clean and newly renovated i think. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast too. For a complimentary meal, the selection was good. The guy taking care of the area is a nice fellow, making sure the food is topped up. He's always there to greet you :) The business centre has free internet and a printer with free printing which came in handy when we needed to print online tickets to attractions etc. We had a nice and enjoyable experience. Thanks Comfort Inn =)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & friendly; great value”
Reviews.Author: keylime
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I have enjoyed a three night stay in February at this hotel for the past three years. We like seeing the same friendly and accomodating staff members year after year. We arrived quite early from the airport (8:30ish) and the desk staff said a room would be ready around 11:00, and offered us breakfast and held our bags till we returned from a walk. (They will hold your bags after check-out, too, until you are ready for transportation to airport.) The room is very comfortable and clean. We shared a king-sized bed, and room size is comfortable for two people. Bedding is nice. Bathroom is clean. Towels were a little scratchy. Complimentary continental breakfast is a real plus; food is good and the service person is very attentive. We love the location-close to theaters, shopping & the subway. We visit in February because the rates are lower; we have lots of fun despite the cold. We feel safe here. It is about 1/2 block down 46th St. from Times Square. Entrance is well lit and there's always someone at the front desk. I would heartily recommend this hotel, and hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jetan
Reviews.Content: Location and VALUE is as good as it gets for those headed to Broadway shows. Short walk away from subway stations, restaurants, Broadway, and Central Park is totally walkable. Staff is super friendly and accomodating, and the rooms though small (of course they are -- it's Manhattan!!) are clean and elegant with all the expected amenities including a nice flat-screen TV. Beds are comfy, bathroom has a full bathtub. Included breakfast is great for a continental breakfast, though you might want to grab coffee down the street. Location is decently quiet, excellent for that area of Manhattan. Definitely, definitely would come back here and highly recommend to all friends. The perfect hotel for couples and groups of friends on tight budgets, but not wanting to sacrifice on comfort or lifestyle. jt

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price for NY”
Reviews.Author: cestella
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom room for 6 nights in February 2009. We were located on the 5th floor. Positives • The location of this hotel is awesome. I think this Comfort Inn should be renamed to the Times Square Comfort Inn instead of Midtown because Time Square was just at the end of our street. • Hotel offered free wireless therefore could connect from your room (given you have your own laptop). The wireless speed was really quick too. They also provided a business centre area available 24hrs and could use their pc’s for internet and printer for printing. • Rooms were cleaned everyday although I don’t think sheets were changed every day. • We had a closet in our room which was a bonus, we utilised this space to store our luggage. • Safe was available in room • An ipod docking station was also available so we could play tunes but we mostly used it to recharge our iphone • Free breakfast was included with stay. Comfort Inn provided different types of breads, pastries and cereal as well as coffee and juices. • There was a small gym area which was accessible 24hrs. There was a treadmill, bike and stepper but their equipment and was old. • There was a group of kids staying next door and were mucking around the hall way knocking on each other’s door. We called and complained to the front desk and believe they resolved issue as noise and children ceased slamming doors soon after. • Room was very quiet could not hear street noise. • Flat screen tv with cable was available • The staff and service we experience was very good. During our stay we also experienced (at different times) a broken smoke alarm which kept beeping every couple of seconds and we managed to block our toilet as well. Each time concierge was more than willing to assist us and resolved the issues seamlessly. • The cost of Comfort Inn Time Square was a lot cheaper than other hotels in the area definitely value for money staying here. Negatives • Rooms are small but everyone who has stayed here and posted past reviews we’ve read has mentioned that so it was no surprised. • Room needs a revamp of modern sleek furniture to utilise the limited space more effectively. We had a big wooden dressing table and a big wooden side table in our room which we didn’t use. Changing linen and curtains wouldn’t hurt either. • Room lighting was a dull probably cause of the colour of the walls and lack of natural lighting available. There was a small window in our room which gave us the view of a brick wall. • Room walls are pretty thin can hear neighbour’s music, but then again we did have teenagers next door who liked to play music at 1am when it should be dead quiet. • Radiator needs updating. When on it makes a whistling noise when it is heating or cooling which would wake my husband up at night. When we turned it up it would be too hot once we turned it down it took forever to a point we would turn on the aircon. • Elevators were slow and could only fit probably 4-5 people at a time I’d stay at Comfort Inn again because of its prime location to Times Square and the competitive cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a mom and daughter getaway”
Reviews.Author: bostonienne
Reviews.Content: I hadn't visited NYC since before having my kids. My oldest was about to turn 13 and had always wanted to try shopping on 5th Avenue so I decided to take the plunge. Was a bit nervous about navigating the city so I chose this hotel, right around the corner from Times Sq and within a 15 min. walk from Penn Station where we would be arriving. We showed up at noon, long before the official check-in time, and the front desk allowed us to go right up to our room. They also stored our bags for a few hours after we checked out on our last day. Everything was clean. The room was a bit cramped with 2 double beds but we were comfortable. All of the staff were friendly and professional. I can't say enough about how convenient the location was. We walked to the Gershwin Theatre to see Wicked, which I highly recommend. Very clever story, fabulous special effects. Also within a few blocks, we went shopping up and down 5th and 6th Avenues, visited St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Rockefeller Center, M&M World, the Plaza Hotel lobby, and more. Plenty of fast food and family style restaurants all around, and lots of foot traffic so I felt safe each time we went out somewhere. This hotel is reliable and a good value. I don't think we could have found a better deal, for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Comfort Inn Midtown!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn on 46th Street for one week last August (2008) and was very happy with my choice! The hotel is PERFECTLY positioned. You are right at Times Square and in walking distance to The Rock, Radio City, Broadway ... and the rest is a few minutes on the subway. The rooms were very clean and the staff were excellent and very helpful from the front desk to the very nice cleaning staff and concierge. My room had it's own air con, which you did need in summer and it wasn't too noisy. A light breakfast is included every morning and it was great to have that handy. They have a small gym (not that you will want to look at it after all the walking you'll do around the city - take comfortable shoes!!!!!!) and they also have computers handy for you to check email/internet, free and that was very handy. I would definitely stay here again. I found them very hard to beat for price and as I was travelling alone, it was nice that they had a 24 hr desk, I felt safe at all times. Highly recommend them for those with a moderate budget that want clean rooms and somewhere well positioned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Giumendonca
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed at the Comfort Inn in the winter of 2009 and it was definitely a good choice. The accommodations are small and simple but very clean and comfortable. The location is great, at the heart of times square and close to several subway stations. The staff is friendly, the complimentary breakfast is quite monotonous but honest and the free wi fi internet works fine. As other reviewer have already written, I didn`t like the glass bathroom door and the heat in the room that made us to turn on the A/C in the middle of winter. I also miss the ice machine at the room floor, since it was only available at the basement. Thanks to the location, price, breakfast and Internet, I totally recommend this hotel. The cost/ benefit for New York City is very good. But don't ask for the Queen bedroom. It is very small!

Reviews.Title: “Handy, friendly, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: weski
Reviews.Content: Girlfriends and I returned for our 3rd year for our Broadway weekend and were not disappointed. Friendly staff put us all on the 9th floor in our various individual and shared rooms. Still clean and up to date. We stumbled down to the breakfast room in the am for coffee, tea, juice, fruit, bagels, yogurt or cereal until about 10 am. Same staff for all 3 years and that is something itself! The newly refurbished building, complete with flat screen TVs, wireless access, 2 communal computers with printer, and fitness room is in good shape. I can never figure out why this is the Comfort Inn Midtown as it is a half block from the TKTS park off Times Square, when the Comfort Inn Times Square is nowhere near Times Square. Easy walk to everywhere from 46th Street between Broadway and 6th Avenue. I walked from Penn Station up 6th in about 20 minutes with my wheelie suitcase. It was also easy to go 2 blocks to the subway at Times Square to take the shuttle over to Grand Central and transfer to the line going up the East Side. Taxis are easy to come by in the neighborhood. My only things to improve would be the heat - so warm we didn't use the blankets as it seemed silly to turn on the AC when it was 10 degrees out. Not crazy about the frosted glass bathroom doors and the oversized bureau in the doubles and the one pokey elevator. But for the price, cleanliness and location, it can't be beat, (and we have tried ) so we keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Chook76
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from 14 nights at the Comfort Inn and we thought it was fabulous. We were very close to Times Square and it was a 5 minute walk to lots of theatres. Being centrally located we walked most places, including Central Park, the Met, Museum of Natural History, Empire State Building Madison Square Garden etc. The bed was comfortable and the room was bigger than you would expect a New York room to be. It was also very clean, with towels changed daily. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. They couldn't do enough for us. The breakfast each morning was good as well. I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: emillene
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has an great location, everyone was really kind to us, the size of the room is not so small as lots of reviews, we have a early check-inn and late check-out with no problem and everyone really tried to give all the help and informations we need.... I strongly recommend this hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: chuckstr
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel using my points with Choice Privileges for one of the coldest weekends of the year ending in 2008 (Zero*), the Hotel was in the PERFECT location in NYC, the room was very comfortable, very warm, and up to date, especially the bathroom for the wife. You will not be disappointed with your stay at this Hotel and yes I will return to this Hotel for further trips to NY City in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSusan
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 others went to New York on December 3rd, and could not believe how close to Time Square our hotel was when we arrived. We had two rooms booked, one was to the side of the hotel and the other was onto the street at the front of the hotel. Our room was very quiet at night but alas the bigger room which was to the front was not, but if you shopped like we did you slept at night regardless. The staff at the hotel where very helpfull and even let us have our room till 1pm on the day of check out. The hotel was clean and there was a breakfast room in the moring where you could have a bagel or cereal and you could get tea or coffee all day here as well. Would have no problem recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandShopper
Reviews.Content: My friends & I have stayed here several times. It is centrally located and very convenient. We were very pleased to find the rooms have recently been renovated. It was very warm in the room, as the front desk controls the heat. No problem - we put on the AC and we got very comfortable. The one and only downfall to the renovations is that they put a glass door on the bathroom. Although it is frosted, you can still see through it. But even worse is that when you are with three other people and you have a whold day planned, someone has to get into the shower very early. As soon as you put the light on in the bathroom the whole room lights up!!! I have to say that was a stupid move on the hotels planning. But that was our only complaint. And I'll guarantee that we'll probably stay there next year. Can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Welshlad15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Inn Midtown at the start of December 2008 having decided to book here after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. When we arrived at the hotel I didnt realise how close we actually were to Times Square but we would never have known it once we were inside the hotel and had checked into our 7th floor room. The staff were great and check-in a breeze, the room was amazingly quiet and had everything we needed, it had a flat screen tv, built-in wardrobe, free safe, tea & coffee making facilities and I loved the heated floor in the bathroom :-) We have both stayed in Hilton hotels in the UK where the rooms didnt even come close to the standard and cleanliness of our room at the Comfort Inn Midtown. We were both more than happy with our accomodation. Also, the location cannot be beaten, you are literally a few steps away from Times Square and all the major tourist sites are within walking distance, Central Park, Madison Sqaure Garden, Empire State Building etc and there is a great Irish Bar opposite the Hotel!! We would both definately stay at this hotel again, thank-you AppleCore Hotels for making our first stay in New York City so memorable for all the right reasons!!

Reviews.Title: “Elevator problems but comfortable hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: KristyWA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Midtown Comfort Inn from 11/29/08 to 12/2/08. Overall, the hotel is clean, comfortable and has a great location. There were two issues that came up during our stay....the elevator and the check-in process. Our room was located on the 4th floor (there are a total of 9 floors) and the elevator was only functional part of the time. For us, this was not a major problem...since we are relatively fit and travel with carry-on size baggage. However, for guests with mobility issues or large luggage, this could be quite a problem..there are a lot of stairs and it is a narrow stairway. Next, The check-in process was time consuming and rather involved. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30pm (knowing that check-in was at 3pm), and asked if it was possible to check-in or else be able to store our bags until we could check in. The man at the desk stated that our room was not ready, but that we could certainly store our luggage in a secure storage room, and that our room would be ready at 3pm. Not a problem. We stored our bags, proceeded to walk around Times Square, and returned to the hotel about 2:45 to get off our feet. Much to our surprise, the lobby was full...all the seats in the lobby were occupied with guests waiting to check-in and the only place to sit was in the adjoining breakfast room. Needless to say, we were told that our room was still not ready....along with all the other people waiting. We sat down and waited until 3pm. Precisely at 3pm, everyone lined up (at least a dozen people) and waited to go through the check-in process. The man who had been at the desk during our intial arrival was there, along with one other gentleman, apparently a reservationist that had just recently started his shift. The original reservationist started to help a guest and seemed totally incapable of helping her...she was apparently checking in using "Rewards Points" and he told the lady that she would have to come back later and see the other reservationist. This original reservationist then proceeded to go in the back room, get his jacket and was leaving because his shift was now over. The remaining reservationist did an admirable job of getting us checked in and was left to deal with all of the guests....by himself. It then became clear to everyone standing in line that the reason the original reservationist (who went off-duty) told everyone their room wasn't ready was because he didn't want to check them in...he wanted to leave it to the reservationist with the next shift. It appeared that he didn't want to do his job - or simply didn't know how. In any case, it was a poor representation for the Comfort Inn. I should point out that it was just this one original reservationist that seemed to do a poor job, he had no aptitude for customer service and genuinely seemed disinterested in the "comfort" of the hotel guests. I sincerely doubt that the rooms weren't ready, because the cleaning staff did an amazing job. They were very thorough and efficient. For example, we had left our room at one point around 10:30am and returned less than a half hour later to retrieve an additional guide book and the room had already been cleaned. Due to the location, clean room, comfortable bed, and wireless internet access, we will likely give this hotel another chance. We travel frequently to the city and have stayed at a variety of locations. We have stayed at the Novotel and had very good experiences - they seem to have a higher level of service, with slightly higher prices. But, if the Comfort Inn Midtown is able to improve the staff (at least the one bad reservationist) and fix the elevator...then we will certainly be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a good price”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravell2008
Reviews.Content: After much searching on Trip Advisor, decided on this one based on price, location and reviews. Although the room was small, it was fully renovated and everything brand new. Amazingly there was no noise, even though this is just 1 block from Times Sq. My room was located at the side-back with no view at all, but the quiet more than made up for that. The complimentary breakfast was adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. Free internet was a much appreciated bonus! Recommend if prices still remain low, for NY standards. I know this review is a year late, but I am looking to return and thought I had already done a review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lapel555
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and nondiscript from the street entrance. The doorman was very helpful, the lobby and rooms are small and clean. The breakfast buffet is limited but well taken care of by the friendly staff, so the area was neat and the food was fresh. There were problems with the heating system while I was there - the NY temp was in the 60's, the hotel heat was on and the AC in the room couldn't cool the temperature. The manager was accomodating and was able to give me a room on a higher floor which was a little cooler. The next day, the heat in the entire hotel was turned off, so it was much more comfortable. Overall, it suited my needs for a room to sleep at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: butterphly01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a relatively inexpensive hotel for one night in the city. It was perfect for us! Clean rooms, friendly staff, free continental breakfast. There was also a computer available for internet use and Wi-Fi access in the room. The room itself was a little small, but fine for one night. I think my only complaint is that you could not open the windows (there were signs on them saying not to open), so it was pretty stuffy. There was an air conditioner, but that didn't help the lack of fresh air. Overall, we plan on staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “We "lived"on Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: seankelbel
Reviews.Content: I've just returned with my wife from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn, Midtown, Manhattan and it was a wonderful experience-helping in no small way to making our first trip to the Big Apple a most enjoyable occasion. In the past we've come back from a city break and reviewed our accomodation together and the consensus would always be it was OK but.......! But there were no "buts" about this hotel. It is literally yards from Times Square and the first comment we got from the taxi driver that brought us from JFK airport was that our hotel was in a very central location. It was spotlessly clean, the room was an adequate size, very comfortable bed, flat screen TV, extremely quiet considering we were so close to Times Square, the staff were warm, friendly and most helpful and welcoming, the buffet breakfast was substantial and really set us up for the days walking and exploring of this wonderful city. To sum up I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to be right in the heart of the action and don't want to spend their time travelling in and out of the city. I was really delighted with my choice. Sean, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - but be careful!”
Reviews.Author: Yasunde
Reviews.Content: The comfort inn midtown is a good hotel, and worked well for our stay in July. The rooms are comfortable and well designed. The location, so long as you want to be slap-bang in the middle of the bright and flashy part of town, is excellent. (If quiet tree-lined avenues are more your thing, look elsewhere - this hotel is right off times square). Do bear in mind that this is a budget hotel meaning that the service is basic, the air conditioner is noisy and though the rooms are excellent, the rest of the hotel decor is a wee bit shabby. That's fine so long as you're happy with budget. One warning - when heading to the airport, the female receptionist may offer to arrange transport for you for $50. We accepted this offer, even though it was $5 more than a yellow cab. However, when we got to the Airport, we were charged $60. A real shame, as we didn't expect to be taken for a ride by the hotel staff. Politely decline and hail a cab instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kat2cute
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I found while in New York. It's prices are comparably cheap; it's location is great and close to the metro and theater district; its rooms are great; it had complimentary breakfast and free baggage checking. I really appreciated all of these things when trying to stay in other hotels that were cheaper but a 1+ hour metro commute or that were not up to the same standards of rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel very pleased”
Reviews.Author: lord_n_lady_weaver
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget hotel, great location, friendly staff, small room (but you get what you pay for and in NY there is so much to do you don't spend much time in your room anyway!) Would def stay there again, its so close to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue etc, its ideal for a short break, ad the beds were very comfy too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Doreen73
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. Great location - right at Times Square in the middle of everything. Friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast every morning. Saved us lots of money. The room seemed to be recently re-done -- everything was clean and attractive - we even had a flat screen t.v. The room however was small - but typical for NYC. Bathroom also quite nice and clean. I can't complain about anything. Excellent value. You really don't need to stay in a big large and expensive hotel. They even have a little gym set up off the lobby, plus internet service in the lobby area. Totally an excellent hotel - just small. I would absolutely stay there again and again. Just be aware of one thing ... when we booked at the front desk our return transportation to Newark Airport .... they over-charged us about 6 dollars each on the shuttle. I guess that's how they make a couple of extra dollars for their service. We should have done it ourselves directly with Supershuttle. Supershuttle charges $19.00, and we paid the hotel $25.00 each. Oh well.. you live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Paul90
Reviews.Content: Went to New York in July 2008, it was my first time in New York and I also got engaged. Everything about the trip was fantastic and this certainly included the hotel. It's the best possible location in Manhatten, very central for everything. The room we had was spotless, roomy and with very efficient air conditioning. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. And compared to the prices of New York hotels it was excellent value. As a bit of a stickler this is unusual for me to say but I really couldn't fault it and when I return to New York it's a no brainer where I'm going to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: anubeginning4us
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this Hotel 10/10/08-10/11/08. We found it last minute (the night before our get away). We went into NYC to see a show for my daughter's 16th birthday (4 females, 2 adults, 2 children on this trip) and as it turned out it was just a hop, skip and jump away from our hotel. We felt very safe at this location. We were so pleasantly pleased with our stay here. Newly renovated hotel, when we walked into our room it was very clean!!! It was like brand new. The only thing I would complain about, was that they didn't offer conditioner with the shampoo, only lotion. Beds were so comfortable. The staff was very friendly and you are close to everything! There is also a continental breakfast offered here too (the area is a little small in that room, but to get a quick eat before you head out was great). There is a parking garage across the street that charges you $23 with validation from the hotel. My car was cared for, no problems at all and I was very nervous about that. We were also nervous about a lot of the hotel reviews that we checked out online, but this met our needs 100%. Really, how much time do you spend in the room anyhow? I recommend this hotel to everyone! I will definitely stay here again on our next overnight/vacation in the city. No need to be nervous, this is definitely a hotel to stay at for the price, we couldn't beat it. I also have to stress, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, it was awesome to be so close to everything. I would have included pictures but my camera wasn't working well. No need to hesitate on booking reservation here. Also, they have a luggage room you could keep your bags in if you have extended stay past the check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: TPSKOC
Reviews.Content: Our first New York experience was made memorable by the attentive staff at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Jovanne was most accommodating when we checked in and was a welcome face on our 5-day stay. The room and general condition of the property was excellent and the morning breakfast was more than adequate to get you moving in the morning. Above all the location was fantastic. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but mighty!”
Reviews.Author: win54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel in September 2008. The staff was very friendly (especially Jovanni) and efficient. We paid about $250 a night - much better than most other hotels in the area. The room was very nicely decorated and clean. It is small. Our room had a queen size bed, night table, small desk and dresser with just enough room to walk around the bed. Window air conditioner was adequate for the time of year we were there. No view from our room. Small bathroom with shower only. Nice flat screen TV, clock radio with Ipod docking, free wifi internet and business centre, free US phone calls. Free breakfast was a plus. Fruit, coffee, cappucino, juice, yogurt, cereals, pastries, toast, boiled eggs. The breakfast room is small but we were always able to get a table. Hotel is one block from Times Square so location is excellent. If you go be sure to have a meal at Virgil's BBQ on 44th St. - terrific pulled pork sandwiches and fries! Also recommend doing "Top of the Rock" day and night time. As mentioned in a previous post the hotel gives guests the TripAdvisor web address so reviews can be posted. I have no problem with this. Other hotels should do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbfamilyDubai
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for anyone wanting to stay in the heart of New York as it is situated a couple of minutes walk from Time Square. Because the hotel is quite small, the staff were really friendly and the service better than most 5 star hotels I have stayed in. The rooms looked like they had been recently refurbished and were clean and well maintained and continental breakfast was included in the rate. This really is a great base to explore New York for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rouxster
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at this hotel with 3 friends. We had two rooms, both of which were very clean, quiet, recently decorated and very comfortable. As expected in New York, room sizes are not huge but they are perfectly adequate and have all the facilities you may want. Location is superb - we walked most of the time during the day and had no trouble hailing taxis outside at night. Buffet breakfast is plentiful, and sets you up for a good day shopping, sight seeing etc. The best thing of all however is the staff - they could not do enough to help and earned their tips many times over. Would definitely go back and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but good value”
Reviews.Author: Gezzerboy
Reviews.Content: Currently staying there and thought I would write a quick review. Location - Superb its just off 46th and 7th next to Rosie o Gradys so nice and close to all the action Value - $230 a night so good Rooms - TINY but clean and shower is fine. You will be hard pushed to swing a cat but hey your not in NY to do that. Beds nice and comfy Noise Level - Superb, Its on 46th so not a main road hence the normal NY dinn doesnt come in the "tiny" windows

Reviews.Title: “Good For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Cookieburns
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading the other reviews, and found them to be pretty accurate. As for a review that claimed it was good for singles, I would have to disagree. My husband and I both stayed in a queen size room and found it to be quite adequate. We did not have a problem with space and were able to move around freely. We requested a room with a view other than the brick wall posted in other reviews, at check-in were pleased to see that our request was granted! Staff were friendly and accommodating. It was also nice to have the continental breakfast available, this is not common in NYC. Again, our room was spacious (by NYC standards), updated, and clean. We also did not have any issues with the elevator as some of the other quests have mentioned. The only negative that we had was the window air conditioner, it did have a bad odor to it, maybe it is time to clean the filters! Would recommend this hotel to anyone that needs a reasonably priced clean room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: PatandTim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently. The service from the staff was exceptional! We checked out on the day of a major festival which closed off the street in front of the hotel and for many surrounding streets as well. We needed a cab to the airport but none could reach the hotel. The manager on duty - Giovanni - made some calls, arranged a ride for us and then the bellman transported our luggage through the crowds (several thousands of people) to Broadway which was nearby and got us in our ride. This was exceptional service which only capped a completely enjoyable stay at this hotel. We will not hesitate to stay here gain.

Reviews.Title: “Another Happy Camper”
Reviews.Author: Warmwinds
Reviews.Content: I was also just there as a solo from August 25-29. I got extremely lucky (I think I may have gotten the last room available when I checked in), but even though I was a solo they gave me a room with 2 double beds - which the bellman said was one of the "big" rooms. This greatly added to my personal space to have the extra bed to pile my stuff, but the room was still a very tight squeeze - the foot of the bed is so close to the tv desk that you have to scoot sideways to get by. I'm sure the double room I reserved would have been unbelievably small. I had also requested a quiet room, and the room overlooked the back alley and the backs of other buildings. I heard almost no street noise. The only noise was some bells that clanged every morning at 7:30 am, which to me was the perfect time to get up anyway (I think they were from the church next door). That said, my experience was fantastic. The staff is great - everyone greets you with a smile and hello, answers any questions, is very helpful. The whole place is very clean. Breakfast is adequate. And the location is beyond compare - half a block to Times Square in one direction, close to several different subway lines. I felt safe at all times. Now, some people I think have been disappointed because they see all these 5 star ratings so they think it is a 5 star hotel - it is not - but it IS a 5 star VALUE...the 5 stars here on TA come from answering the question "Rate your overall experience" - and to most of us, it was 5 star. I will also post one of the few negatives here - my a/c unit was very noisy, so I couldn't run it all the time. I would turn it on for a short period, it cooled off the room quickly, and then I would shut it off. It might be a problem if the weather is very hot for your entire stay, for me it was not. And one great positive that I didn't expect and didn't know about until I checked in - free US phone calls! Anywhere! I called my husband and daughter on the west coast several times a day, made and cancelled many local reservations, and was charged not one cent for telephone charges! What a great bonus that was! Someone a few posts down said they were asked to write a good review on TA, and therefore the ratings are skewed. NO ONE asked me make mention of the hotel to anyone, this review is written purely based on my personal experience. I know this hotel can be more expensive at different times of the year (I was lucky and got a $197 AAA rate in August), but New York is a very expensive hotel city. I was completely happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Single Traveler!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaveOrlando23
