Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The location on W46th at Broadway was an amazing location to everything in midtown. The beds were clean and comfortable, with an Ipod docking station and flat screen TV. The room, however, is small and may cause challenges for two people in the room. But for one person, I loved the compactness of the room. No tub in the bathroom, only a shower. Nice size closet, but had to pull the curtains out of the way to open the door. Like I said, compact, but sufficient. Good breakfast room with cereal, fruit and yogurt, bagels which is great with me. The staff was friendly and helpful and seemed really concerned about my needs. I would definitely stay here again if traveling alone to NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful :)”
Reviews.Author: Veronica322
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed with my mom at the hotel for a few days and we had a very plesant stay. The hotel rooms were extremly clean. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean as well and the shower was not one of those overpowering showers that hurt when they blast the water. Anything you need or any questions you have can be answered by the friendly staff (especially Ivonne!). There is a great breakfast every morning with: bagels, doughnuts, cereal, yougurt, etc. and coffe and tea are available all day long. The location is perfect everything is just a step out the door!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights to attend a Broadway play on each night. Hotel was very clean and staff was courteous and helpful. Room was small but comfortable and quiet. The location was excellent for those who like to sightsee. Times Square at one end of the block and Madison Avenue on the other. There is an excellent little deli to the right as you exit the hotel. Majority of what we came to see was within walking distance. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a room at a reasonable price convenient to Broadway and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: KaySC_8
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip in NY and my 10 year old daughter and I tagged along. We were sight seeing most of the days by ourselves and the location of this hotel could not have been better! The staff was very helpful and the hotel room was quiet. We never felt uncomfortable in any way and were very close to the shows we went to see. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: gmbennett
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews we picked this hotel. We didn't want to spend a fortune since we wouldn't be in the hotel a lot, but we wanted a hotel close to Times Square. We just returned from New York today, and I felt I needed to write a review to add to the already positive comments. I would definitely stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown again. It is only a block off of Times Square. It was very clean and updated. It has a daily continental breakfast. It is much cheaper than the other hotels in the area. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The rooms are small, but we spent very little time in the room. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Liked It”
Reviews.Author: dspMd
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and close to Times Square. Some walking distance to Penn Station though I would stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Theatres and Times Square But...”
Reviews.Author: VancouverJulia
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I enjoyed our stay in New York but probably would not stay here again. If you want to save money and want to be close to the theatres and crowds at Times Square and only need a place to sleep and eat breakfast then consider this hotel. The room was nicely decorated and reasonably clean with the exception of the windows. Absolutely filthy on the outside. I guess with all the pigeons there must not seem much point? There wasn't much to see but still not very nice. Plumbing upstairs makes noise which was tolerable when we were awake but at 4:46am was a bit much. Since the rooms are quite small you sleep near the door and can hear people talking in the hallways. Light sleepers should run the a/c as it helps mask the other sounds. Staff were generally polite; however, one desk clerk wasn't very friendly and when a street person (several sleep next door at the church) followed me in asking for $ he didn't even ask him to leave! Continental breakfast was pretty good and we never had to wait long for a seat. Don't bother taking the elevator down unless you absolutely have to; usually much faster to walk, even from the ninth floor. Two free computers in the lobby were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Comfort Inn Midtown”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSassy
Reviews.Content: Loved Comfort Inn - Midtown!! My husband and I just returned from New York City for our first visit there. After much research on TripAdvisor and recommendations from co-workers I decided to reserve here. Everyone is correct in what they write. The front staff and doorman are are very helpful, courteous. We arrived at 8:00 a.m. and they were kind enough to let us change and store our luggage until our room was available. They even invited us to go into the continental breakfast room!!! The food in this room is great and the man in charge is so helpful and friendly. Our room was just the right size, the bathroom perfect for a couple and a flatscreen TV - but hey - how long do you stay in your room when in NYC! The room was very very clean. One day we had a problem with the air conditioner and a very nice Polish man came up and fixed it during the day - he even popped by around 5:00 before he left for the day to make sure it was working! I could not believe how close we were to Times Square and Broadway!!! Night and day everything was within walking distance. If I ever went back to New York again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Berec
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on our first trip to New York and really enjoyed it. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to a King room on arrival and although space was limited the room had everything we needed including a large flat screen TV. One oddity with the room was that we stayed here in January so it was obviously very cold outside, however our room was always very hot - meaning we needed the air conditioner on everytime we were in it. The free breakfast at the hotel was a plus and included bagels, doughnuts and cereals. The location is probably the best thing about this hotel as it is about 100 metres from Time Square and convenient for most of the big attractions. I also liked that we were able to walk here from Penn Station after getting the train from Newark airport. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel as it offered excellent value for money in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value”
Reviews.Author: mm003007
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New York and this hotel was great. Great location in Times Square and Broadway, but was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpfull and the price much less than other hotels. We highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!5 stars”
Reviews.Author: habsrule
Reviews.Content: we just got back from NY jul 20 2008. This place was great. Right when we arrived Amir took our bags and showed me the parking garage across the street. He took my wife and our stuff upstairs and got us settled. The desk staff were helpfull about telling us where to go and get thngs. Anthoni in the breakfast room keeps things clean and tidy as well as keeping all the food filled up. As soon as someone is leaving he is right there cleaning the table for the next person. breakfast had juices, cereals, bagels,toast, yogurt, coffee. everything you need to start your day. the location was about 100 meters from Times Square so you could wander down there in 2 minutes to see it every night. Basically i would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone.. great place to stay. jd mississauga, ontario

Reviews.Title: “not the greatest place”
Reviews.Author: miriamlg
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would warn fellow travelers to take the reviews with a grain of salt, since guests at this hotel are requested to submit favorable reviews of the hotel to tripadvisor. (The hotel hands out hotel info sheets and the suggestion to submit a favorable review to trip advisor is included on the sheet.) So I feel there really is some bias here. If you JUST want a place to sleep for the night, this place fits the bill fine, but I found there were a lot of little things that bothered me. First, the room was tiny. Just enough room to walk around the bed and the desk. The bathroom was small too (had a shower stall, but no tub), but manageable for one person. The window faced a brick wall (literally a few inches away) and therefore got virtually no natural sunlight in the morning. Made it hard to wake up! The hallways outside the rooms were very narrow. There was an air conditioner in the room, and it went as cold as 64 degrees, but that was barely cold enough. It would have been nice to get it colder when I was working out. They provide shampoo, but not conditioner. Again, not a huge deal (it's easy enough to stop by Duane Reed), but when you realize this in the morning when getting up, it's not great.

Reviews.Title: “What more is there to say!!!”
Reviews.Author: blondeegal
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what I can say that has not already been said! You just can not imagine the feeling I had, coming into New York City after being in the air and airports for over 12 hours, on a dark rainy night for the first time. Planning a 7 day stay, with reservations at a place with a rate almost too good to be true, I just had a sinking feeling. I was so pleased when the gentleman at the front desk was so helpful, and then the bell man who took our bags to our room was equally as pleasant. (By then it was midnight, and we were 4 hours late.) I just held my breath when he opened the door to our room, I was really expecting the worst, and telling myself to be satisfied as long as there are no bugs! And then! The room was small as noted in some of the previous reviews, but we had everything we needed in just the right place. And to top it off the room had been completely re-done from the shower to the very comfortable bed, and had what appeared to be new linens, carpet, paint, even a flat screen television. I felt the breakfast was more than adequate, and the gentleman in charge there was equally as pleasant. Each morning was a selection of cereals, fruits, donuts, bagels, toast, yogurts, juices, coffee, and even Cappuccino. Our room was cleaned everyday whatever time we seemed to get back to our room, almost like someone was watching us leave and then got right down to the business of getting it ready for our next night. The location could not have been better as we realized the first morning when we started to find our way around. It is close to everything from Times Square to Rockefeller Center, We even walked to Central Park and the Empire State Building. And, I also think there is something to be said about management who cares enough to watch the comments on TripAdvisor, and reply to any problems there may have been during a stay. I just hope we are able to visit this hotel again in the near future, and find it the way it was on our first trip. With the caring attitude we saw, I really think we will. Now the rate, that may be another issue!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: Wally54
Reviews.Content: We've just spent four nights in the Comfort Inn Midtown. We chose this location based on the favorable reviews in TripAdvisor; we were not disappointed. We found the hotel to be an excellent location - one block to Times Square, two blocks to Rockefeller Center, easy walking distance to the subway and theaters. The hotel is on a semi-quiet street just off of of Time Square. Our room included a very comfortable king sized bed and a flat screen TV; the room was smallish but how much time do you spend in your room? The bathroom was nice sized. We enjoyed the complmentary breakfast (cereals, fruits, juices, rolls); the breakfast room was cramped but ,hey, its a free meal! We've read that the one elevator was slow - that seems to be true; we had a room on the 2nd floor and just used the stairs. The hotel does not have a concierge, so, bring your own maps and visitors information. The desk staff did arrange a town car for transportation to Newark Airport. We were very satisfied with our stay and will use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just how tripadvisor reviewers said”
Reviews.Author: RueCler
Reviews.Content: Great location; extremely convenient near Times Square; rooms where cozy, clean, and pretty nice for NYC. The staff was professional. The breakfast food was no better; no worse then you'd find anywhere in the US. There was some street noise but I guess that comes with the territory. Subway was close. So long as they don't up their rates; this is the good deal. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, Non Nonsense hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vittorio_69
Reviews.Content: Booked via [--] - they appeared to have the best Internet rates. Availability and prices changes regularly on their website so check in regularly. Room was smaller than I expected - just enough to lay 2 medium size suitacase on the floor next to TV and still walk around the bed single file - bit was clean. Free continental breakfast in smaller room and wireless Internet provided. We were a bit spoilt having stayed at much bigger and luxurious Grand Hyatt and Westin Times Square the previous 7 nights - however, if you want somewhere to sleep and save monies for shopping, then Comfort Inn Midtown provides clean and safe option. Location was good in "Little Brazil" street (46th) just off Broadway and in quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Irelandtourgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recenty stayed here for the 2nd time and I really feel like we've found our NY "home away from home". Our room was spotless and you can tell had been updated recently, with a nice flat screen tv. There was enough room and it was quiet. We used the safe in the room and we also enjoy the continental breakfast with cereal, pasteries, fruit, coffee, tea,, juice, yogurt, etc. Also, the location cannot be beat! Everyone at the desk was helpful. We just really feel at home here and love that it is so clean, good location and breakfast. The price cannot be beat in Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: dss1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 2008 and I really liked it. Of course the location is fabulous. It's a block from Times Square and around the corner from Rockefeller Square. If you don't know your way around the city, the location of the hotel makes it easy to see some of the biggest tour attractions without having to figure out the subway system. I don't know if it was just because it was in NYC, but it was a lot fancier than any Comfort Inn I'd ever stayed in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They literally carried in our bags the moment we stepped out of the cab and the desk clerk even allowed us to check in 4 hours early. The room was clean and not as small as I expected after reading some reviews here on Trip Advisor. I shared a room with a girlfriend and we were both able to move around comfortably. The bed was large and comfortable. I only had two complaints and I wouldn't even call them complaints. There is only one elevator and it's really slow. Also, the room we were in had a weird bathroom door. The middle of the bathroom door was frosted glass so whenever one of us had to use the bathroom, the other person would have to move to the other side of the room to give them some privacy. Those are minor issues, though and didn't affect my stay or feelings about the hotel. Overall, I had a pleasant experience and will be staying at this hotel again when I return to NYC in August.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/location”
Reviews.Author: English_Setter
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. Relatively (!) quiet street very near Times Square. Helpful staff and pleasant and nicely sized room. Much nicer than your average Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommemd to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Oly9568
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Comfort Inn Midtown over Memorial Day weekend. As it was our first visit to NYC we didnt really know to expect. I must say we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. We arrived well before the 3:00 pm check in time expecting to have to wait to check in, but our room was ready and they let us in. The staff was friendly and helpful, everything was new and modern, tastefully decorated, comfortable bed, nice sized dresser and closet (with a safe), flat screen TV, plus numerous other "little things" that made it very comfortable. The rooms are cozy , we used the dresser for our clothes and tucked our suitcases away in a corner leaving plenty of room for 2 people. The wall mounted A/C worked good we just ran it all day so when we returned at night the room was nice a cool and it stayed that way all night. Only 1 elevator that can be a little slow, but we were on the 3rd floor so we used the stairs most of time anyway. The location is awesome, turn right out of the entrance and Times Square is about a 100 yard walk. Just a great place all around, with great rates to go along with it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Midtown Experience”
Reviews.Author: mstally
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd year staying at this hotel. The renovations are complete and the hotel and staff are marvelous. We are so not from NYC, but love the atmosphere and this hotel really caters to our needs for directions, customer service, and a relaxful stay. I cant wait to return next year. The basic amenities that come with the room like free interent, gym, and continential breakfast also are key reasons why I continue to book this hotel when I go to NYC. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Miiri
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - room was modern, comfortable and absolutely spotless. The location is excellent, literally 30 seconds from Time Square and I found the staff helpful and friendly at all times. The room was a decent size and was plenty enough space for 2 people. Free and fast wireless connection with a business center on the ground floor which you could use for printing. Very good attention to detail :) I would have no hesitation in returning or recommending. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: kgirl_luv2trvl
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking our hotel, both on AAA and Trip Advisor. I cannot say enough about this hotel! We paid just over $200 a night. I would suggest you book as far in advance as possible because one lady we met at breakfast paid $300 a night for the same room! The front desk was very friendly and helpful. When they found out we were on our honeymoon, they upgraded us to a king-size room at no additional charge! They gave us a great map of the city and offered to give advice on restaurants, places to see, etc... We took them up on their offer and went to a delicious little coffee/sandwhich shop a block away. The room was extremely clean, the bed and pillows were nice and soft (not like the cardboard beds I've slept on in some hotels), and you could tell it had been remodeled recently. We just had one bag, but there wasn't a lot of extra room to spread it out and have the ironing board set up. It wasn't a big deal because we really weren't in the room that much. The breakfast had a great selection - from bagels and cream cheese, to donuts and cappucino, to granola and yogurt. They also have a small area with two computers and free internet, so we were able to check into our flight online before going to the airport. The location could not have been more perfect or centrally located. We were able to walk nearly everywhere, Central Park, Greenwich Village, and Madison Square Park to name a few. The best part was that we were only one block away from the theater where we went to see a Broadway play. If we ever return to NYC (and I'm sure we will!), we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very close to Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelers08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. Just around the corner from Times Square. The street is more on the quiet side later in the evening, not many cars, if any, that came through. Across the street is an Irish Pub, next door is a church, and down the street towards Broadway is a Brazilian restaurant. There were also a couple of souvenir shops a few doors down, also towards Broadway. The hotel was clean, the hotel staff were friendly, the Continental breakfast was ok. We were surprised that there was a tip basket though. We've never had to tip for Continental breakfasts before. The free internet was great although at times we had to wait to use the internet as there was only two computers. There is also a fitness room, which looked nice, but we never used it. Complimentary newspapers were put out in the morning. The elevator does go all the way up to the 9th floor despite another guest reviewer that stated it only went up to the 8th floor. Our room was extremely small, but if you don't mind getting a little cozy with your loved one then it’s no problem! The bed was really comfortable and there was also a large flat screen TV in the room. The only negative things I would say was that the room was BOILING hot. The heater was never on but somehow the room was BOILING hot all the time. It appeared that in the walls was where the heat was coming from. When we touched the bathroom wall it was very warm. At night we would have to turn the a/c on even if it was cold outside so that we would be able to sleep comfortably. Another negative thing was that the phone, only worked by pushing the speaker button. Apparently it was a new phone and the hotel staff did not know how it worked through the hand set. Despite all this, the hotel was well worth the stay and we will definitely be staying here again should we ever come back to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Hundreds of Hotels in NYC....this is the one you want!”
Reviews.Author: SamandAneta12tree
Reviews.Content: There are literally hundreds and hundreds of hotel options to choose from in NYC. Different star ratings, different locations, different customer service and very different pricing. So how does the Comfort Inn rate in these categories? Absolutely superb in all of them. My wife and I recently stayed 5 x nights and apon check-in were told that we had been upgraded to a king size just renovated room....sweet! Ipod docking, flat screen, good size bathroom with strong hot running water, free wireless (very fast), desk, wardrobe and a humongous king size bed. Luggage space was perhaps a little bit tight, but not a problem. Decent views. It was 802 if anyone wants to reserve it. The location is excellent...down a reasonably quiet street just seconds away from the utter madness of Times Square. There are plenty of restaurants on the street such as Chinese, Italian and a great deli so no probs for quick food options. Many of the main attractions are accessible by foot. Some can take up to 30/40 mins walking, but because theres so much going on around you, you dont even realise you've walked for that long. The underground is easy to use and takes you everywhere. The staff must be commended for there customer service, friendliness and professionalism. From front desk, housekeeping and the porters, all the staff made us feel welcome at all times, something that is most welcomed from big days out touring the city. For a small hotel, with good service, good values and good prices, this is an absolute winner for New York City. We toured at least 8 hours a day checking out the sights, and feel we barley touched the sides of NYC! A big shout out for Sidibi the bellman, Anthony the breakfast guy and Ivonne the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikos
Reviews.Content: Two of us spent one week at the hotel, 1/2 a block from Times Square and the Theatre district. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was small but adequate, clean and met our needs. We booked ahead online and got great rates. This hotel has everything one needs - and is small and cozy. Free email, hot showers, breakfast, good advice and directions. We will try to use this as our Hotel in NewYork in the future. It's location is perfect! Well done! Thankyou for a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Believe All the Great Reviews”
Reviews.Author: BettaSmetta
Reviews.Content: I was a late addition to a multi-party trip to NYC, and the private hotel where everyone else was staying was booked. So I went on google and searched for hotels nearby and then hit TripAdvisor for the reviews. Comfort Inn Midtown was the only hotel I could not find a single bad review for. Even among the $600+ per night hotels, they all had at least one or two recent bad reviews. Not Comfort Inn Midtown. So I rolled the dice. This was my first trip to NYC, and I was more than a little nervous. I could not have been more pleased. The room was fantastic. Had PLENTY OF SPACE! Hot water for every shower. Almost no noise from the street. No sounds from other rooms. The continental b'fast in the morning is great. Free business center where I was able to make copies of a white paper for meetings and print my boarding passses for return trip home (all FREE). The front desk arranged a $25 shuttle to return to the airport (It cost me $60 to get into town from the airport (Laguardia) WITHOUT the asst. of the hotel.) The hotel is at 6th Ave. and 46th. This is 2 quick blocks from Times Square and a half block from the (summer) Saturday street vendor fair on 6th Ave. It was just a few walking blocks from 30 Rockefeller Plaza (think NBC). Great little English pub across the street. Walking distance to MOMA and Bryant Park and so much more! Very safe, very clean, professional courteous staff. I can't say enough, except I will definitely go back to this hotel. If I had to reach for a negative, I would say that from around 8:30 a.m. to noon, the FREE wireless internet in the room had spotty reception. Other than that, I can't think of a single complaint. Book this hotel! You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location ...”
Reviews.Author: RoseTaylor08
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel from 10-15 May 2008. Excellent location - hotel is small, comfortable (brilliant bed), well refurbished bedroom and bathroom (good shower), very clean, staff friendly, approachable and helpful (especialy Sandip on Reception). Continental breakfast very good (cereals, fruit, yoghurt, juices, tea, coffees, toast, waffles, pastries and gorgeous iced doughnuts!) included in booking. Theatres are a few minutes' walk away, as is ticket booth for shows (half price tickets), Times Sq a minute away yet street is quite quiet. Macys, Rockerfella Centre, 5th Ave all within walking distance. We would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will go back”
Reviews.Author: LowProfileTour
Reviews.Content: Went to the city with 2 other couples for a Broadway show. Arrived a the hotel before check-in, but rooms were ready for us. Daytime desk clerk extremely accommodating, friendly & very helpful (night-time clerk quite the opposite). Rooms were extremely clean, comfortable beds, looks recently renovated. You absolutely cannot beat the location - easy access anything you need (food, transportation, shopping, theater). Will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: fourdarlings1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in April. It was a fantastic stay! The rooms are small, but certainly big enough for 2 with cozy bedding and a modern clean bathroom. Our room faced the street and there was some noise as well as that of water running from above when folks were showering. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable although they could have used more than 1 person at check in time on the front desk. The breakfast was more than adequate. The hotel and the rooms were very clean and the location is unbeatable for the price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location: 30 Yards From Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Fayettenam
Reviews.Content: WONDERFUL LOCATION. Great Price, literally you are about 30 yards down the street from all of the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Very close to all of the places that you want to see and go to in downtown New York City. The room is small, but so is every other room in New York. Why pay hundreds more for a room that you are not going to be in. The room is small, bed, nightstand, TV cabinet, bathroom. That is about it, but what else do you need. We were not in our room we were out in the city, we would leave early in the morning and come in late at night. The hotel did have a very nice continental breakfast, and as everything is expensive in NYC, it was nice to not have to pay for breakfast. Next trip back to NYC, we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Applecore (owner) Made a Believer”
Reviews.Author: RoderickofTexas
Reviews.Content: I searched the internet for several hours. The reviews for this hotel were very good and the price was competitive, so I crossed my fingers and made reservations. First, the location could not be better. We were a half block from Times Square, 2 1/2 blocks from our theater (Phantom of the Opera), and in the middle of all the places we wanted to go. When we arrived we found the desk personnel very pleasant, but even more importantly competent, professional and helpful. The lobby is small but quite adequate and clean. Upon entering our room, king-size bed, we were further pleased. While the room was small it was very functionally laid out. The decor from bedspread to paint on the walls was pleasant. Flat screen TV. Great shower with lots of hot water. Very importantly, everything was clean, clean, clean. We used the two computers and printer just off the lobby for which there was no charge. The breakfast was included and was more than adequate and the service personnel were again helpful and pleasant. etc, etc, etc. . . we would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Keep it a secret!”
Reviews.Author: Floridayaya
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very nice stay at this hotel. I have never been steered wrong from any hotel I have checked on Trip Advisor, and once again was not let down. When we checked in, without asking, I was told we were upgraded from a queen bed to king. Our room was on the 5th floor - we looked directly out of the front of the hotel. We were there on a Saturday and Sunday night and never heard a sound. The breakfast room is immaculately kept up with a large variety of items - our room felt brand new - very updated. I was alone traveling with my teen and we felt totally safe in this location. We will definately be returning this summer, hopefully word won't get out too fast and there will still be bargains to be had here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, and was *very* impressed. I will certainly stay here again on future trips to New York. Location is superb, being just half a block away from Times Square, while being down one of the quieter cross-streets, so you're certainly not getting Times Square levels of noise. Reception area was modern, bright, gleamingly clean, and manned by friendly and professional staff. Just off the reception was a small fitness room with some gym equipment, and a business centre with two internet computers and a printer, all of which you could use for free. Complimentary continental breakfast was also included, and there was also a drinks vending machine and a flight check-in kiosk for printing boarding passes for airlines based on the USA. There's an elevator to all floors. The room was compact, but it certainly didn't feel cramped and I felt quite at home there. The bed was *very* comfortable; the TV looked brand new and had a wide range of cable channels; a writing desk, chair, coffee maker and air-con / heater were provided; and the bathroom was small but functional and clean with a very good shower. And, to top it all off, the price was excellent for central Manhattan. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly tourists looking for an affordable, central base for exploring NYC. It may not be the fanciest luxury hotel in Manhattan, but for the price it's unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for the location, comfort and PRICE (NYC price)”
Reviews.Author: naptrip
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation with the other Comofort Inn "Times Square" which was misnomer: long blocks away from Times Square and at rather deserted area between construction and shabby establishments. So, when I saw this Comfort Inn, I just walked in and check the availability and price. I am glad I did. Other Comfort Inn was as clean as this one. But this one's location was unbeatable and LESS EXPENSIVE (Why??). Staffs are helpful. The rooms were smallish but ,like others said, clean and well furnished. As we had inside rooms, there was no noise ( but no sun either though. We had nice view of brick wall 3 feet away.) Minor issues: our bathroom door did not close properly. All the doors to the rooms slam loudly if you let it close by itself. They had a contracted garage in front of the hotel at $23/day rather than $40/day. Over all we are very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: I have a cheap boss who says things like "find a room for $200 or less in Manhattan." I grudgingly booked a room at the Comfort Inn Midtown Manhattan (from which I am writing this review). The facade outside is plain but not offensive, and the lobby is a little dingy with a scary-looking breakfast room. But the elevator works fine (much faster than the Marriott Marquis across the street, and the room is surprisingly nice. It's small but very liveable, recently renovated, has a 26" LG plasma TV, ample lighting, a small but useable desk, a full-length mirror and a larger-than-expected bathroom (with a good-sized shower, curved shower rod, and granite counter + a small window). The a/c is a window unit, which might be bad in summer. The bedding is acceptable and the dark wood furniture is appealingly updated. There's a nice valence above the curtains. There's no view, but I asked for a room at the back of the hotel based on reviews read at TripAdvisor. So far, it's quiet. There's even a (very small) exercise room on the first floor with a treadmill and bike. So far, I am really amazingly impressed with this room given the bargain basement price.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 3_chihuahuas_mama
Reviews.Content: I hestitate to write a review as I'd love to keep this place a secret! The staff are very friendly and helpful. We would phone them from the streets of New York to get advice and information. The rooms are extremely clean, and very quiet - must be well insulated as we weren't disturbed by any outside noises. Although the rooms are a bit small, there's enough room to store your baggage and move around with no problem. Free Continental breakfast and internet access is indeed a plus. Only one elevator, but we never waited for more than one minute for the elevator and we were on the top (9th floor) and the hotel was completely booked. Perfect location. Just down the street from Times Square and Broadway theatres. Room rate we received was very reasonable and one of the cheapest I found when looking for a NYC hotel .... and I checked rates and reviews of hundreds of hotels. The secret is out! This is the place to stay and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellrae1973
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in on Feb 29th and stayed for two nights. The room was modern and very clean. We were pleasantly surprised as this is a "2star" hotel. The room was small but not nearly as small as I had anticipated. The staff were friendly and nice. The free continental breakfast was great, nothing over the top, just pastries, cereal, bread, bagels etc. There was no restaurant in the hotel but this was not a problem for us as we really didn't spend anytime in the hotel. The location was excellent less than 1 block from times square. The outside noise was a little loud at night but we were in NY so we didn't expect it to be like home. If we are ever back in NY we will definately stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: eek_19
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a great stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. I've stayed in a number of hotels in this price range and location, and the Comfort Inn was easily the best. Clean, comfortable and convenient, with working air conditioning (even in February, hotel rooms in New York are always hot), a great location (between Broadway and 6th Avenue, right in the theater district), and free continental breakfast and wireless internet. My room was quiet and comfortable, and the location couldn't have been more convenient. I'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal on a nice room”
Reviews.Author: AL_Retired
Reviews.Content: I am just finishing a 5 day stay here and, while I have stayed in nicer hotels and bigger rooms, it's been years since I've had a better location, with a brand new room, super clean, comfortable, with free WiFi and breakfast, plus free coffee 24/7 in the lobby, plus a coffeemaker in my room for this price. The wired internet is even faster, with plugs right on the desk. Yes, the bathroom is tight but perfectly workable. My queen bed looked and felt brand new. I was on the 46th street side (at the front of the hotel), so I got a little street noise but this IS Manhattan--it's part of the "charm." Nothing ever woke me up. I stayed both on weekend and weeknights; the weekend was much more expensive, but the weeknights were among the lowest price I found.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonable place to stay near theatres in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LSC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night weekend at the Midtown Comfort Inn on 46th Street. The accomodations are very clean and nice (small but this is NYC) the front desk staff were very helpful and friendly, and for NYC it was quite reasonable (under $200 a night). The hotel is 1/2 block off Broadway at Times Square, so if you are going for theater you can't do better. They even have a few rooms with two double beds (for a small family). We recommend strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: JAMMills5
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a very busy location. Staying on 46th Street during Christmas week is not for the faint of heart, but the hotel proved to be a quiet spot of sanity in the middle of it all. We took friends who'd never been to NYC before, and they enjoyed the stay as well. The staff was friendly and courteous, and the rooms were very clean and typical size (small for all of you not familiar) for NYC. The rooms were also quiet, and the beds were comfortable, which is a bonus for the location. We had breakfast in the lounge of bagels and other pastires, fruit, etc. which was convenient and spared us the overcrowded spots in the vicinity, All in all we were very pleased with our stay and we'll be back next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: asiatage
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation through the hotel chains website. This hotel has a 24 hr cancellation policy which I fully understand. Until my flight was cancelled due to the weather in NY on the day of my arrival. I immediately called the hotel to notify them of this dilemma and asked if I'd still be charged. I was told yes, so I asked to speak to the manager. I believe ethically this is wrong, considering I don't have control over the weather. I had to leave her a voicemail and after 24 hrs and no response I tried to contact her again. This time I was successful, only to hear her say in an extremely rude attitude that she would not make any exceptions, and that I would still be charged. Which I was. She then proceeded to tell me that after looking at my previous stays with the Applecore chain, that "I didn't look so much like a valued customer to her".

Reviews.Title: “Was perfectly happy with it!”
Reviews.Author: wonderlust_8
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints at all about the hotel. I was a little nervous coming in as a lone female traveller after an 18 hour flight, but all was fine. I had a renovated room on 2nd level- facing the back, so no view, but no issues with noise either. There was *just* enough space for me but i'm 5 foot 2, and there was only me- a couple would have found the room very tiny. Bathroom was very clean- great work!- but again, bigger-sized travellers would find the shower tight. Location was good- near enough the main road to feel safe, but not so near that the babble in TIme Square would intrude. I liked that i could walk to Broadway for some action and plays, and then to 6th/5th avenue to look for decent food in a quieter place. All in all, more than adequate for my needs. I felt compelled to write as i use TripAdvisor alot in decided my hotel- so hope this review helps someone else!

Reviews.Title: “5th time, can't be that bad !”
Reviews.Author: iainb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 5th time last December. You know what your getting before you go and as for location, well you couldn't ask for more. Firstly the downside, of which there aren't many. If you get a room to the rear of the hotrel the odds are that your 'view' will consist of a brick wall. That said you ae very rarely in your room during daylight hours and the rear rooms are quieter than those at the front on West 35th Street. The rooms aren't cheap, in monetary terms, a 5 night stay cost us around £900. Although there is a continental breafast thrown in ! Pluses are many. Desk staff are very helpful, the hotel is in a great location, the rooms are fairly well appointed, if a little dark. There are numerous eating and drinking locations all around you and the shops and sights are virtually on your dooor step. Don't expect the Ritz, if you want that go pay Ritz prices but for the centre of New York city we feel tat it is a fair price for a clean room and bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location but Bring Ear Plugs!”
Reviews.Author: Lauricha
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel for our first ever trip to NY Dec 07. It was a late minute booking, as we had found fantastic rates for flights only a few week before we were due to leave! Comfort Inn Midtown was the cheapest hotel we found and included a continental breakfast which was perfect. I was a little scared at what we would find after reading some reviews on here, but we had none of the problems others' found, save for the noise issue, which I'll go into later. • The Hotel The hotel is located less then half a block away from Times Square. From our window we could see Times Square's TGI Friday and all the lights and billboards. It is also very close to train and bus links and we never had a long wait hailing a taxi. If you are coming to NY for the first time, or just want to stay where the atmosphere and livliness is, then I'd definately reccommend this hotel. As it was booked as a suprise for our anniversary I contacted the hotel and asked if something special could be done for our stay, like a complimanary bottle of wine or similar. I was in contact with an amazing member of staff called Anu. He was so helpful with all my questions about the hotel, it was more like 5 star service! When we arrived, it turned out we had be upgraded to a brand new HUGE room! The downstairs features a small gym, the breakfast room, a toilet, luggage hold (which is free) and a computer room (again, free) • The Room We stayed in room 902, overlooking the street and the Muse Hotel. Again, the room was amazing. We had plently of room for our suitcases and the bathroom was huge and well appointed, with a shower, bath, loo and sink. The hairdryer was loctaed in the bathroom in it's own unit. I'd heard rooms in NY were teeny, but this was bigger than some rooms I've stayed in in the UK by far. As for the main bedroom, we had two huge windows which let in a lot of light despite the massive buildings outside. The fire escape on the outside of the building looked amazing (a small point I know, but at least it fit in with the character of the room and building!) The bed was huge. WE have a superking size bed at home, and this bed was a little smaller, not by much though. There is also a flat panel TV with about thirty channels (Check out the adverts... so unbelieveably strange!), a dest with powerpoints for your laptop and a chest of drawers to keep clothes in. The coffee make was on top of the chest of drawers. Next to the entrance was a cupboard with the iron and ironing board, a rail with hangers to hang clothes, and a shelf (we didn't use it, but it could be great to keep the suitcase in) It was clean (all except under the bed, don't look under there if you're a clean freak like me!) and tidy and didn't smell at all! • Service We found all the staff to be welcoming and helpful. Check-in was quick and easy, and only took around five minutes. We were always greeted with a smile and a 'Morning!' or 'Afternoon!' which was a pleasant change form the NY'ers brashness! • Breakfast Breakfast was served from 7am til 10:30am. We mainly ate around 8ish. There was a wide variety of food. Cereal: Corn Flakes, Alpen-like nutty cereal and I think Rice Krispies. Bagels in every flavour were available, as well as Dunkin Doughnuts (which was a treat!) There was also toast and waffles too. Coffee, cappucino, tea and herbal teas were on offer, as well as OJ, AJ, Coke and Redbull (perfect for a much needed engery boost!) Everything was well stocked early morning, however on the few days we got up later (about 9ish) it was much harder to find exactly what you wanted, or a place to sit. Papers were available free of charge. • The Noise When I booked this hotel, I was a little anxious about it being loud. I have problems sleeping, acute insomnia means it takes me at least an hour (in silent conditions) to fall asleep, and being a light sleeper means the slightest noise will wake me bolt upright. A little annoying. Bearing the fact we were staying so close to Times Square in mind, I took earplugs and hoped for the best. The first night we were so jet lagged we fell asleep about 7pm (and woke up at 4am) No problems at all. The only thing that woke me was the next room coming in about 9pm after a meal and letting the door slam shut. The doors are quite noisey. The rest of the holiday the only noise we heard from the hotel was the occasional door slam (from the highly inconsiderate neighbours next door). Outside, there was a lorry-loading area which was the main problem. It started about 4am and didn't stop for an hour. Basically, they load metal pipes and things onto the lorries which then drive off. Reversing beeps, the noise of the carriers being loaded and the drivers and workers swearing and laughing at each other kept me awake, however with ear-plugs this wasn't a problem, and I slept like a baby! We also found the window wasn't quite shut properly (despite the fact they shouldn't have been opened) so once we closed it properly that muted the sounds a little. I would definately reccommend earplugs if you're a light sleeper. My bloke is a heavy sleeper and didn't hear a thing! • Pros and Cons PRO's Fantastic location Great staff Amazing room Breakfast choice was brilliant Cheap for the location! Any problems we had (Like the next room smoking which made ours smell disgusting) were quickly attended to. CON's Noise (only if you're a very light sleeper)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place by low price!!”
Reviews.Author: Mocreu
Reviews.Content: My first visit in New York, we didn't know where to stay, then, by walk, we found this exceptional hotel: clean, no noisy on the apartment in the back, low price and a friendly staff....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: bluebell25
Reviews.Content: I finally chose the Comfot Inn Midtown after extensive searching and reading many reviews on Tripadvisor and other websites. I had previously had a great stay at the Comfort Inn Manhattan but was put off by recent reviews. So the Comfort Inn Midtown. The hotel is being renovated which did not personally cause me any problems, but could be inconvenient to others. I think most of the renovation is finished now anyway. The staff are very helpful, the breakfast is good and a real plus point: bagels, donuts, toast, waffles, pastries yes, but also, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juice, eggs and hot drinks. There are two PC's for internet use, and apat from once when one guest selfishly used the PC for ages, there was always a free PC. The hotel is in an excellent location, literally around the corner from Times Square. This however means that if you have a room at the front of the hotel it is very noisy. If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room in the back. The noise from the street was incredible and constant. This is the only negative aspect. We had room 602, which was a very good size, the bathroom was big and the room was nice and comfy. I think all the rooms ending in 01 / 02 are quite big, but they are at the front. If you call ahead to request, they should be able to accommodate you.

Reviews.Title: “small and noisy, but clean”
Reviews.Author: jennjennCleveland
Reviews.Content: The only positive comment I have about this hotel is that it was clean. The rooms were very small, I was actually very surprised at how small they were. The pictures on the website were not very accurate as far as that goes. We got a room with one queen bed and that was all that fit in the room, literally. You really had to squeeze your way around the bed, between it and the desk/chair, to get around. And the other problem was the noise, from loud water pipes in the walls every time a toilet was flushed or shower started, to room doors loudly slamming, to people scrubbing down and painting the hallway walls at 8:00 in the morning. I thought it was very rude that they would do that so early in the morning. I would have much rather spent an extra $100 or so just to get a good night's sleep. I would recommend you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: tlgs8
Reviews.Content: Small room, but according to other reviews of comparable hotels, the room size was OK. I was still a little shocked though. Very near to Time Square, about a block away. Appears safe, even though it was located on somewhat of a dark street. Hotel staff was never off the phone, so it was hard to talk to them about much. Room was in good condition...just remodeled. Great value for a place next to Time Square for such a good price. Continental breakfast in the morning was good as well. I don't think you'll be disappointed since the price is so low!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just off Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: NYwannabees
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from staying here for 4 nights, and everything about the hotel was great. Excellent service, nothing was too much trouble, the breakfast was a great way to start the day and all the staff were very welcoming, it was like a home from home. The hotel is in an excellent location, literally 2 mins walk from Times Square, and also handy for Macey's (10min walk) and many other attractions within a short distance. The hotel inside is very clean, and modernly decorated. The room had all the amenities.. hairdryer, Iron, tea / coffee making facilities, nice big comfortable bed and big LCD TV. The smaller touches, such as complimentary internet access and free newspapers in reception were also available. Next time we go to New York we will definately stay here again.. We'd like to thank all the hotel staff for making our stay as enjoyable and comfortable as it was. Hope to see them all again next year (money permitting!!).

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Booies
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 5 nights, during a very hot May! It was located in a fantasic place, couldn't ask to be nearer to anything! 3 - 5min walk to Macy's and round the corner to the Empire State. Every night we walked about 10-15mins up Broadway to Time Square - it was easy and so safe. The rooms, yes are a little dated, but as it is just a base at the end of the day, we weren't too bothered! Big room with small ensuite. TV with cable, hairdyer etc - what you would expect. I advise anyone to plan ahead before going to New York. We pre-booked our tickets for the Statue of Liberty Ferry at home before we left, and therefore didn't have to queue! We did go early in the morning however! Also I advise you to be at the Empire State for 8am - as the queues become huge and I'm sure you don't want to spend half your holiday stuck in one! We also pre-booked a helicopter flight across the city - which was fantastic! Yes, you can take your own cameras - dispite some reviews! The breakfast at the hotel was typically 'American' and sugary! But hey, it was lovely! Different selection of doughnuts, bagels with cream cheese, various cereals, juice, eggs. This was an added bonus, as most NYC hotels don't include breakfast in their tariff. We only had one quibble with the hotel....on our last night we had just come back from Bubba Gump Restaurant on TImes Square (highly reccommend it) and as we entered the room a mouse ran across the floor - understandable in these older buildings. But I was not going to sleep in a room where the mouse had run under the bed!!! We asked at reception to be moved they were fine about it. However the first room they moved us to was a smoking room (it stank) and the beds were unmade. SO they moved us to another room. Still a bit smokey though. It was our last night so we didn't care. Another things was the VERY RUDE bell boy! We encountered him within the 1st 10minutes of or stay - he grabs your bags like a leach! We knew tipping was a big thing in NY, but we only had a dollar bill and a 50! So I gave him the dollar bill....He responded, not wth a kind thankyou - but....I wouldn't even give a Mexcian that!! I thought..How rude and racist! I should have taken it back off him, he was lucky to get anything! We're not stingy, but we didn't think we'd be rudely put upon within our first 10 minutes!! We stayed away form him on our way home, we carried our own bags! Rude Man!! However, I would recommend the hotel, due to its location and value for money. Staff were friendly on the counter, but stay away from the bell boy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: schnozx
Reviews.Content: The price was right. Everything was small but that didn't matter since it was just a place to sleep. We requested a queen size bed and got a king size. The staff was very friendly. The biggest problem was the elevator: small, slow, and sometimes broken. And there was only one for service and patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Times Square Location”
Reviews.Author: Kim_OK
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the reasonable price during high season after reading the many reviews here. We were only in NY for one night and had theater tickets and chose to stay in TS. Overall, we were pleased with our experience. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Thank you! My only complaint, and it's a big one for me, was that even though the hotel is a non-smoking one our room had a strong smoke smell. The non-smoking aspect is a major one when I book any hotel. This hotel was booked so we were stuck. Also, coincidently, in our "wing" ours was the only door that didn't have a non-smoking sign on the outside. The room was small but we expected that. The carpet was not too clean, worn in parts, and had cigarette burns. The bathroom was nice & roomy and clean. Extra large sink was a nice touch. The bed was okay to sleep in. The hotel was extremely quiet which is also a plus. There was a coffee maker, iron & ironing board. Closet was very short which worked ok for us but from the rod to floor was only about 4 feet. The free continental breakfast is an added benefit. For a longer stay, I would not have been comfortable here but for our short stay, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: Thrifty_Traveller_7
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel located just off Times Square. Some rooms are currently been renovated but all are too a good standard (considering some floors were being renovated you never heard any noise!). Some rooms are small but if you are like us you will only be in them when going to sleep! The hotel is on a quiet road off Times Square, it seems it is not one of the main access streets so the traffic was quite quiet. There is continental breakfast available till 10am which meant we could fill up on food before heading out for the day. Rooms are cleaned every day & towels are replaced. All the staff were friendly & there was tea & coffee, internet access and a small gym available free of charge all day. If you are looking for a clean, well maintained hotel not far from the action this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure Just Off Broadway”
Reviews.Author: brchodzin
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Comfort Inn was from Sept 30- Oct 4, 2007. I was not expecting luxury as it is one of a few reasonably priced ($240/night) near Times Square, but now that I’ve returned, I would have been so disappointed if I’d missed this gem! To say the location is perfect is an understatement. The hotel is ½ block from Broadway and 1 ½ blocks from Times Square, one block from a subway, and two blocks from “restaurant row.” There is also a stop for the “hop on/hop off” bus tours and city buses at the corner (less than one minute walk). You are within a five minute walk to many of the major attractions (MTV studios, NBC, Rockefeller, all Broadway theatres, 42nd Street, etc). With that said, the hotel is actually very quiet and secluded (though I always felt safe, no matter what time of the day or night), tucked away from the hustle and bustle half a block away. The hotel itself was very nice. The staff is so friendly and helpful, and always greets you with kindness when you enter the lobby. My room (and my companion's room as well) was immaculately clean, spacious by New York standards, nicely decorated with kind of “funky” prints, and it has in-room coffee and tea (such a plus, and one lacking from the rooms at other hotels in the immediate area with rates upwards of $600/night). The bed and linens were very clean, and though the mattress was too hard for my personal taste, my travelling companion thought it was perfect. Continental breakfast is also served from 7-10 am and is included in the price of your room. The Comfort Inn was a perfect home base for all my travels in New York, and I hope to stay there each time I return. Please feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for Times Square Stay”
Reviews.Author: habincanada
Reviews.Content: This place is only 1 block from Times Square, Rockefeller and several subway lines. Staff were very professional, and many were same staff from our stay 2 years before-they must like it too! Breakfast was included and was an excellent start to the day. Room is small, as most NYC rooms are, but has been redone since our last stay and is very nice, and still very clean. And the mature rate price was unbeatable for Times Square location.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: argo19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort In Midtown from Sep. 21st to Sep. 23. We arrived with no problem or lineup at the hotel. we were able to go to our room immediately. The front desk clerk (Jevanni) (not sure of the spelling) was excellen and efficient. We were on the 8th floor in room 800. The elevator is small....actually the entire hotel is small in stature. It's very narrow and tall. Our room was small but well appointed. It had a queen bed with one end table and a desk. There was a tv, a window w/ AC and a bathroom. There was an ironing board and iron and a hairdryer. The room was exceptionally clean! The bed was very comfortable. I have never slept so well in a hotel before. I don't think it was all the bed I think it also had something to do with the amount of walking we did on Friday and Saturday! The view we had was of a brick wall but other than the initial first few minutes of being in the room we never really needed to look out side because we were...well....outside ourselves. The bathroom was spotless and once we let the water run a bit in the a.m. the hot water was plentiful. If you are undecided about staying at this hotel and you need a few reasons to tip the scale in favour of it then here are some: 1-Continental breakfast!!!! Do not underestimate the value of not having to think about the first meal of the day. This was such a nice feature, you get up and eat and you're off to see NYC. The bagels were really really fresh and delicious too. 2-Staff, they were very friendly and helpful! 3-Proximity to Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Broadway Shows are literally on your doorstep. 4-Cleanliness 5-Efficient If you are there for a weekend definetly use the hop on/off tours by grayline. You can't miss them there are ticket sellers on every corner in Times Square. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-priced hotel in prime Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: brainman73
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in Manhattan (last summer), I stayed in Econo Lodge Times Square (W 47th St.). It was an excellent value at under $150 per night. I planned to stay there again this year; however, when I checked the price for this year's trip, I was astounded to see that the price had doubled, so I looked at other options. I ended up staying at Comfort Inn Midtown, which was just a couple of blocks away and was now practically the same price as the Econo Lodge. (I paid $240-$270 for each of the 3 nights I stayed--Saturday, Sunday, Monday.) I was pleasantly surprised because Comfort Inn's bedrooms were twice as large, as was the bathroom. In addition, unlike the Econo Lodge, the Comfort Inn had an exercise room and an office with 2 computers; it also had a larger lobby and more soda machines. The breakfast was also a bit better. It included cereal, donuts, bagles, bananas, apples, mixed nuts, dried cranberries and white raisins, frozen waffles, yogurt, boiled eggs, coffee, juice, cappuccino, and even Red Bull (regular and sugar free). The location is ideal, as it is just a few blocks from the main activities in Midtown Manhattan, including Broadway, Times Square, 42nd Steet, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave, and the Museum of Modern Art. Although it is just a few hundred feet from the busiest part of Manhattan (the real core of the Big Apple), it is not excessively loud, because it is half a block off of the main strip. The view is not great. In fact, the only window in our room overlooked a tiny enclosed court; the only thing you could see were the windows of other people's rooms. The staff was generally friendly and helpful. I forgot to bring shaving cream. I inquired at the front desk if they had any. The woman at first said they had none. But, as I was walking away, she took the extra step of asking the man who is apparently in charge of supplies (he supplies the breakfast area, for example) if he knew of any. He not only found me a travel-sized shaving cream but even a couple of razors (which I didn't even ask for). They also went out of their way to help me arrange the receipts for a complicated payment arrangement that I had. Granted, this is not the Marriott Marquis (which is literally right across the street), but, then again, it costs only about half as much as the Marriott. Unless you are planning to spend a lot of time in your room while in Manhattan (who does that anyway?), choose this hotel as a great mid-level hotel. If you are on a tight budget, check the rates at the Econo Lodge first, but, unless it is substantially cheaper (at least $50-$100 cheaper), go ahead and book at the Comfort Inn because it is much roomier and has many more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Silvermannen
Reviews.Content: Great location, good and clean hotel. I can warmly recommend this hotel, it hosts all the essentials and nothing else Take care and safe travel! Behind the digital goose pen, /Chris

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TimmyB1957
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to NYC where we used this hotel. Once again, we come away strongly recommending the Comfort Inn. We arrived for a two night stay in late July. We had booked the room at least six months in advance for $166 per night using the Choice Hotels website, under the "internet users" special rate. We were placed in one of the newly refurbished rooms on the 9th floor. The good: LOCATION(!), clean, new furnishings, great size (for a NYC hotel room), quiet (with regard to other hotel guests.) The bad: since we were on the front of the hotel, the noise from the garbage trucks seemed to go on all night long, the window air conditioner was quite loud (although, it does help drown out the garbage trucks!), the elevator is (still) quite slow, which was not a real big problem because the hotel was not anywhere near 100% occupied for our two nights. The staff, as before, was fabulous. What amazed me is that I remembered most of the staff from my visit here two years earlier. I did not expect that the same people would be working the front desk, the bellman positions, etc. This is the kind of stability that says something about a little hotel such as this. As before, is it the Marriot Marquis? No, that's one block to the West! It's also $400 bucks a night. I would much rather use the extra $200 per night and go out and DO something in NYC with that money. Please feel free to contact me with any questions you have about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Prices have gone through the roof!”
Reviews.Author: LisBri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for years for its location and earlier affordibility. Last time we went, we were pleasantly surpised to see the upgrades and were told they were also replacing the furniture. Prices had increased a bit, but it was still reasonable. We came home and I was just about to plan our next trip. Much to our DISAPPOINTMENT, we now find that the prices have DOUBLED! We won't be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Comfort”
Reviews.Author: CMT59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Comfort Inn and we were very pleased with it. It is in a great location....Right in Times Square. However it was very quiet. No street noises. The rooms were on the small side but nicely kept and very clean. The free breakfast was great and we appreciated the 24 hour access to coffee, tea , a microwave and the internet with a printer. Most appreciated was the very helpful and extremely nice staff . The General Manager,the people on the front desk , housekeeping, the bellmen were all friendly . They made our stay very nice. Also for a New York hotel in that area the rate was very reasonable. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and right in midtown”
Reviews.Author: jtdriver
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after going to a baseball game at Yankee Stadium and before heading on a longer trip. The hotel is very close to Times Square, so it is right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Our room was clean and comfortable. It was small, but considering the location and price, no complaints there. The wireless Internet was easy, fast, and reliable. The only downsides we had were with checkin. We drove in and needed to unload and park. We found the hotel, but the unloading area was full and there's no other parking on the street. We called the front desk to see if we could just park and they said to come to the front to unload anyway. After going around the block (which is a 15-20 minute undertaking in NYC), we were able to park in front. We then found that the hotel was short staffed and rooms were just being cleaned. They said 15 minutes, so I decided we'd park in the garage with the hotel rate and check in after that. Of course, the entrance to the garage was just a bit in the wrong direction on 46th. So around the block again for 20 minutes to the garage. When we got back to the front desk, the room was still not ready (he said 15 minutes again) but offered to take our bags so we could go look around. But before we got a chance to leave, good news, the room was ready so we went up. So really, my only complaint is that the desk should have told us in the first place where to park to avoid the two trips around the block. But beyond all of that, we had a great experience and would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: StAlbansUK
Reviews.Content: Hi I'm from the UK and visited NY as a tourist for a week. I liked the Comfort Inn Midtown because the location is excellent. Its half a block away from the middle of Times Square, you can see the neon signs from the front door of the hotel, so you are already in the heart of the tourist area and subway links. The hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. There are a couple of computers on the ground floor with free internet access which was ace and there is a tiny gym room with a couple of treadmills too which is a nice touch. Though I didn't see anyone using the gym, not surprising with downtown NY just outside. There was free breakfast in mornings in the little dining room off the lobby. I ate so much that I wouldn't get hungry again until about 3pm, and no one cared which is great. OK the view from my room was rubbish, my key card kept failing and there is only one lift for the entire hotel but for the price its pretty cool. I'd definately go back and I recommend it to others. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Becktravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in March for a professional conference because I couldn't afford the conference hotel (Hilton) without a roommate. The rooms at Comfort Inn are small, but perfect for one person or for a couple. The best part about this hotel is its location. You look outside the front lobby and you are literally looking right at Times Square less than a block away. It's also within easy walking distance of the north part of Midtown like Rockefeller Center. My first experience upon check-in was not positive, but the experience improved significantly. The TV in my first room did not receive CBS and March Madness was in full swing. They changed me to another room and the air conditioner did not work. It was March and chilly, but I need air to sleep. The maintenance man was ready to send me to another hotel but the manager took care of me. Third time's the charm and the third room was great. Aside from the small room size, the only other drawbacks were that the shower was extremely small -- not to be disrespectful, but an overweight person could not use the shower -- and the hotel seems older with old carpet, etc. But everything did seem clean, which is more important to me than new. The positives far outweight the negatives. The staff seemed friendly (especially by New York standards) and willing to help. The breakfast room offered a free continental breakfast. Two days I sat down and had toast, yogurt, fruit, etc., and two days I grabbed a muffin and coffee and headed out the door. Both ways saved me at least $10 to $15 a day. The other nice freebie is Internet service. There are two computers and a printer. I was able to check my e-mail every day and print my boarding pass for my departing flight. People were friendly and willing to share -- no one hogged a computer for hours. We did our business and moved on. There was also a treadmill but I was too lazy to use it. Overall, you CANNOT GO WRONG with this hotel if you want to be close to the action but not close to the price of most New York hotels. I absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: genav811
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the Times Square area, so everything is walking distance, lots of restaurants available but would recommend to venture out of midtown to get a better bargain for your money. The street it wsa on is called Litle Brazil, so lots of Spanish style restaurants which were good. Hotel itself was okay for our budget, rooms just about fit the queen size bed. Bathroom was very clean. My only inconvenience was airconditioning, it was not adequate, it was old and obsolete. It did not cool the room enough and was very noisy. It was cooler in the lobby than the room.Thank goodness we only stayed for one night. The staff was friendly. Hotel provided continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby & Soiled!”
Reviews.Author: debrasgoods
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! This well located Midtown Manhattan Comfort Inn had a nice facade - clean lobby, breakfast area, nice computer room and small exercise room. But once off the lobby area it all went downhill fast. The room we stayed in on the 5th floor was very small and cramped. The TV armoir was so close to the beds and bathroom door it made manuvering around it at night a hazard. The standard mini coffee maker was located in the bathroom - above the toilet no less! Talk about an unappetizing and unsanitary place to be making coffee - by the john. The rug was so stained and soiled I wore my socks or shoes the entire time we were there. The bedspreads were worn to the point of being almost threadbare. The sheets were standard white, with the added bonus of a few ink or who knows what stains on them that had not come out in the wash. As I was in the manager's office complaining, I realized that her office was just as bad! The carpet was stained, her desk a mess and she offered no remedy or compensation. She did say that the upper floors of the hotel were undergoing renovations and that the 5th floor and below really needed it too. Other than the location and pleasant front desk staff, we were not pleased with this Comfort Inn. I would not recommend staying there. By the way, the cost of this room for one night, on a Monday mid May was well over 200 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: LondonLady30
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about how the hotel would be but im glad i listened to all the positive reviews. It was absolutely fine! For one of the cheaper hotels in NY, we felt it had everything we needed and the location was perfect for seeing everything and a few minutes walk to the restaurants/shows in Times Square. Our Queen room on the 2nd floor was clean and spacious, with tea/coffee facilities, iron, hairdryer, and a good size bathroom. Air conditioning was a bit loud but it worked! Having free breakfast (if we wanted it) and free internet access was great! And the reception staff were very helpful and friendly (and happy to change peoples rooms if they wanted to). Couldnt really fault the place! Would definitely reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Big for a NY hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: sundogcomm
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - just blocks from Broadway shows, Times Square. Quite reasonable for the location. Room was clean and larger than most NY hotel rooms. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, good location near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Globo4368
Reviews.Content: A block off Times Square, this is a great location for theatre goers. Plenty going on in the neighborhood. Lobby was not bad, with breakfast area, free internet and printer, exercise room. As a business traveler I was given a small bag with generous sample sizes of toiletries and snacks. Rooms were New York city small, with a small closet although a decent sized bathroom. Room had coffee maker, clock radio, and a TV that needed some adjustment. The air conditioning is supplied by a room unit that can be noisy for some, but the outflow was blocked by the drapes which were tricky to close. The staff were friendly, knowledgable. Reports of noise in other reviews did not materialize except for some door slamming. With prices sky high in Manhattan the Comfort Inn offers a reasonably priced stay although in other cities $250 would get you five star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SillyTrix
Reviews.Content: I won't repeat what others have said about this hotel, but I highly recommend it for anyone who would like to stay near Times Square. It is a short 5 min walk from the closest subway station (both the Times Square one and the 42nd blue line which is a straight connect to the AirTrain Jamaica station). Although not a glamourous hotel, it met our basic needs. Clean room, clean bathroom, and a free continental breakfast. Really, you don't need much more when you're mostly wandering in NYC. Definitely will come back to this hotel the next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Review from Ireland”
Reviews.Author: johnnymono
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in March 2007 and had a most pleasant experience. We have stayed in many Comfort Inns across the States and although the rooms here are smaller the double room we got was perfectly adequate, bed was comfortable and everything was spotless. Nice touch is the goody bag on arrival. Staff most pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was excellent with a good choice and plentiful. Also very nice clientelle. Approximately 100 yds. from Times Square-you won't get better location. Also felt very safe although could say this for anywhere we visited. For a nice drink Rosie O'Gradys is two doors away and open late. It's friendly and accommodating. O'Briens across the road is much smaller, wasn't to our taste and the drink prices were steep by comparison with most bars we visited. O'Flahertys on East 46th. Street is more of an old style bar, has music every night and is worth a visit if you don't mind a bit of a walk. For good food at reasonable prices, lunch specials and very reasonable drink prices (pint of Bud for $3) try McAnnas to the left as you exit the hotel- about two blocks. Excellent fish and chips for $7.95. We absolutely loved New York and and can't wait to visit again. Would have no hesitation in staying at the Comfort again and would recommend to anyone in particular first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl23
Reviews.Content: This is seriously THE BEST location that money can buy in Midtown Manhattan. We paid around $170 per night for the hotel. They also will give you a AAA discount (10% off). The Comfort Inn Midtown is less than 1/2 block from the center of Times Square. Granted, it's not a luxury hotel, but it is a clean, decent place to sleep at night.
