And besides, that's what a hotel is for anyways. You don't spend that much time there. The room was small, as is expected for NY. The bed is decent. There was no view, but this is also expected since Manhattan is full of skyscrapers to block the views. The plus is that there's free continental breakfast in the morning and free internet. The front desk staff was very curtious and polite. The 1/2 price ticket booth (for musicals and plays) is 1/2 block away. The hotel is also about 1 block from 5th Avenue (with all the famous shopping). Manhattan has a great subway system. The subway stop is less than 1 block away from the hotel. It's within walking distance to most of the theaters, Rockefeller Center, Macy's, We saw Doubt (a play) and it was excellent. We took the subway everywhere and saw just about everything there was to see in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “I Suggest You Reconsider”
Reviews.Author: Kelly617
Reviews.Content: Myself and my three friends decided to go for four nights and five days to New York City for spring break. As University students, we don't exactly have a lot of cash to spend on accomodations or transportation, so we decided to stay somewhere affordable and close to Times Square. Those two aspects of this hotel is pretty much where the positives end. I may be a little bit biased as I am used to travelling with my family, and we tend to stay at luxury hotels when we go away. However, I have stayed with friends at Comfort Inns before, several times actually, and I have never been as unpleasantly surprised as I was with this particular one. The room was small. When I say it was small, I mean small even by New York City standards. The two double beds were practically touching and I couldn't even pull my suitcase from one side of the room to the other. The bathroom was a tub and a sink, and it was freezing cold. The heater was a very noisy window unit and the temperature did not stay consistent. The main hallway was nice, but it is decieving. We stayed on the fourth floor, and the rooms were so close to each other that we could hear everything that was going on in the room next to us VERY clearly. On the last two nights that we were there there was a couple across the hall that seemed to be filming rather innapropriate amateur movies quite unabashadly, and with the door to their room wide open. We called the front desk, but no one did anything and the nonsense went on until about 3AM, when they finally shut their door. Room service was fine. The pillows were quite lumpy, the beds were hard and the sheets were clean, but very old and faded. We didn't have any problems with our maid service. Due to our familiarity with luxury hotels, we often lef cash sitting on the desk and bedside tables by accident, but it was always there when we returned at night. Breakfast was wonderful. it was actually oddly out of place in the otherwise budget hotel. There was fresh coffee, a cappuccino machine, bagels, muffins, several types of cereal, waffles, a toaster and fresh fruit. They also provided Red Bull free of charge every morning, which I found quite nice. I'm not a breakfast eater, but I did find myself waking up specifically so I could go down for some in the mornings. I probably would have returned to stay if I hadn't been so insulted by the manager when we checked out. The staff had, up until this point been very very friendly. The breakfast attendant did not speak any english, but he was always smiling, the maids were friendly and very accomodating, the front desk attendant was very nice and I had a good chat with him almost every night. However, the manager, a woman whose name I can't remember, was very rude. When we were checking out we noticed that there was a long distance phone call on our bill for $10. We looked up the area code and it was a call to Quebec. None of us had made a phonecall from the room, we all used our cell phones. At one point we tried to order pizza, but couldn't even get the room phone to work. Despite our best efforts, we couldn't even get the manager to care or check into it. She just kept shrugging it off and telling us we had to pay. I mean, it was only $10. We insisted on talking to someone else, but she told us there simply was no one else, and then announced that she had to go home as her shift was over. If you want something cheap and in a good location and you don't mind cramped rooms, loud noises and pornographers, you should be fine. I recommend the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: kmd74
Reviews.Content: I will be eternally grateful to the Comfort Inn Midtown for rescuing us from the horror of the Murray Hill Inn (where we had originally booked for five nights but left after two for various reasons - refer my review for that hotel). So, maybe I was wearing rose-coloured glasses but the CIM seemed like an oasis to us! Less than one minute's walk from Times Square, and just a couple of blocks from Fifth Avenue, the location is fantastic. The complimentary breakfast is basic but fresh (bagels, juice, tea/coffee/red bull, yoghurt, cereals), and it's great to have free access to the internet. The staff on the front desk take some prompting to get their attention. Our room was very spacious by NYC standards also with a large bathroom including a bath. All very clean and tidy. The lift is small, slow and there's just one, but better than none at all. (Murray Hill Inn take note.) Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort inn review”
Reviews.Author: smmjh11
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for 5 nights in a 2 double bedded room. The room was clean and fresh towels provided everyday. The room was fairly small for 4 people but was more than sufficient considering it was only used as a base. The bathroom was fairly cold but you only use it for a short time so no real problem once the shower was used. The breakfast was more than adequate with a selection of bagels, pastries, yogurts, cereal, fruit e.t.c The location is great and if you want a drink in the evening there was a bar (rosie o'grady) just along the road that had no problem with our 2 sons being allowed in (ages 16 and 13) So all in all a decent room for the fairly inexpensive rate and i would use them again if I ever returned to NYC

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, nice people”
Reviews.Author: VeritaMexicocity
Reviews.Content: Well, It was my first time not only in New York but in the USA and I have to say that the location of the hotel is great. Me and my boyfriend had a nice experience in this place; Its clean and the employees were really kind. We didnt had a room with a nice view, but a very quiet room (except by the heater, seems little old) We were little concerned about security, but nothing happened at the end. Basic breakfast its like that: basic, and its served in a small saloon, anyway it was clean and enough to start our walks throw New York. If I have to repeat, I will do it without doubts. The price related to the quality of the place its more than fair.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Loud & Louder”
Reviews.Author: CalicoGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel which was in a wonderful location and reasonably priced. I would never stay there again because of the noise though. The room doors are heavy and close loud and hard. I tried to respect my neighbors, but they didn't do the same for me. I was awakened constantly during the night. I stayed up until 12:30 a.m., but others around me were up later and every time someone closed their door it woke me up and shook the room. The noise would start up again around 6:30 a.m. as people left their rooms. I have never heard hotel room doors close so loudly. Waking up constantly because of this ruined this hotel for me. There were other negatives such as the room phone that worked the first day, but not the other two days. The weather was very cold while I was there, and at night I about froze in the bed. The blankets were tissue thin. I slept with a sweater over my pajamas. Unless I couldn't find it, I don't think there was any way to control the heat in the room. There was a window air conditioner, but for heat I was at the hotel's mercy. The room seemed clean until I pulled the bedsheets back at midnight on the first night and saw a semen stain. Despite all of this, I have to admit that the location was terrific and the staff that I encountered were delightful. They were all pleasant and very friendly. The bathroom was large and the water pressure great with plenty of hot water. I really liked the people that worked there, but I just wouldn't go back primarily because of the loud room doors.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Clean and Convenient!!”
Reviews.Author: claudiasmom
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 days last week. I was a little concerned about safety, but my mind was put at ease by the other reviews. The staff was so nice to us and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We were even given a "goody bag" upon arrival, which was the coolest thing for my daughter! Our room was on the small side, but was large enough for 2 twin beds, a desk, entertainment center and our luggage. The bathroom was clean and even had a hair dryer, coffee maker and window shelf for all of things. The BEST thing about this hotel is the location. You are literally steps away from Times Square! We walked everywhere (Today Show, shopping on Fifth Ave. and all Broadway shows). For the price, you can not go wrong here. If you are going to New York to sit in a big expensive hotel room, then you are going for the wrong reasons!! We will stay at this location on all of our future trips and will highly recommend it to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy value and location.”
Reviews.Author: luvtwotvl
Reviews.Content: Four of us went to Manhattan in Dec of 2006. I checked Trip Advisor for reviews, and the ratings given were very reliable. The location of this hotel is perfect for Time Square area. The room was not overly small considering size of most NYC rooms. I felt that it was more than adequate for 2 people. Hotel Staff very helpful and courteous. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a room on the 7th floor front view. The other couple with us had a side room. Both rooms OK, but I believe the room with the front view had a little more room than the side room. Only one elevator in hotel, but it really was not a major problem. Breakfast room a little small, but my advice is don't be in a hurry, give yourself enough time, wait your turn for a seat and you will enjoy a typical continental breakfast for free. I have been in many hotels in NYC including Hilton New York, Rennaissance Time Square, Millenium Broadway, and rate this hotel as one I would definetely stay at again, because of value pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Our Camera was stolen - Management Unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: SafeTGal
Reviews.Content: Based on the price we knew this would not be a luxury hotel but was just looking for something clean and safe. The room was very basic but clean. The day after we checked in my camera was stolen out of my suit case and my daughters coat pockets were gone through as well. We reported this to the manager who indicated our maid was only employed with them one week. The manager did not follow up with us as promised. We spoke with another occupant who had 2 cameras stolen from their room the same day. When they asked the hotel if any other cameras had been reported missing they were told no, which was not true. We were not advised to fill out an incident report and were discouraged from contacting the police. So for the rest of our stay we had no maid service because of concern about additional items being stolen. There is 1 ice machine and it was broken half the time we were there. Several of the hotel employees were very friendly and nice, unfortunately the theft and lack of candor and appropriate followup with the management really tainted our stay. I would not recommend staying here. The cost savings with this hotel will be spent to replace my camera that was stolen out of my suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Just A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosean3434
Reviews.Content: LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION! This is so important, but when it is coupled with great staff and excellent cleanliness it means so much more. Good continental selectional for breakfast. Our room on the 3rd floor faced a brick wall but we just kept the shades drawn , no problem as we were out all day!! Only 2 doors away from Rosie O Gradys, good food and craic (oh, by the way thats Irish for great conversation and laughter) Forgot to mention on arrival you get a welcome bag per person with lots of little goodies included, how many hotels do this??. If you book tickets for the Greyline bus at reception you get $3 off per person Will definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, very comfortable professional staff”
Reviews.Author: mmctrip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the last 2 months. Five nights in October and four nights in November and was very impressed with this hotel. It is in a great location (steps to Times Square) and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The beds are very comfortable and the breakfast is excellent. The price and location are difficult to beat. The rooms are very clean. The staff also bend over backwards to arrange shuttles to the airport and to provide tourist information. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Handy place for a visiting Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine2907
Reviews.Content: I really liked the place, abit dated in decor but it feels warm and doesnt have the sterile feel like alot of chain hotels have. The room service was good with comfy beds. Be warned of the Receptionist though, He's an anglophile - and loves all things British, constant refrences to the BBC's "keeping up apperences" made me laugh..... i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tarra
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay at this hotel and while I was a little concerned whether it would be too basic, how wrong I was, yeah it is in need of some painting and modernisation but for that price and location you can;t go wrong. The staff were sooo nice and helpful, breakfast was plentiful, room was clean as was bathroom and of a fair size, the only concern I had was I overheard a few other guests complaining about the radiators in their room being noisy, we had no such problems thankfully. But what do you want for that price? Would stay again definitely if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Davewight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel from the 21st Oct to 26th we were on the 6th floor and had no problems with the lift. The rooms were clean the staff helpfull and what a great location only a few yards from Times Square and lots of bars and restaurants to choose from. I would certainly stay there again and cant wait to return to NY.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: Loulabelle44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simple. It provided an excellent location for sightseeing, just a few paces from Times Square. The room was small, and don't expect a view. But if all you want is a clean, safe place to sleep at night, it is an excellent choice for the budget-concious traveller. The breakfast was well-stocked, with the usual selection of cereal, fruit, bread and bagels, pastries and donughts, juice, tea and coffee. Free copies of USA Today and the NY Post were available by 7am every morning. The staff were friendly and helpful without being "over the top". A great place to stay in a great location. Book it with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Times Square A must stay at!!!”
Reviews.Author: dplnortheast
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place and i would stay there again for sure, the elevator is broken alot and as long as you ask for a room on the highest floors available you will be able to see past the comfort inn sign they have on the from of the building!!!! also, ask for a room on the front of the hotel not the back, the back looks out onnto a alley and tltho not bad, its not fun to look out to a brick wall when you are in the CITY!!!! all the rooms on the front tho are one bed so our boys slept on the CLEAN NIC KEPT FLOOR!!! the hotel even offered us free extra blankets and pillows for us!!!! along with the room is a clean bath bigger then i planned on being in the city and all and the room was basic but great great location only 1/2 block from times square!!! check in is not overly friendly but you dont pay for that since the prices are pretty low for you where you are staying!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Princess78
Reviews.Content: Myself, my mother and my sister stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while on a shopping trip. It is in an excellent location and terrific value for money. Everything is within walking distance, broadway, 5th Av, Macys, Port Authority etc... Breakfast was included in the price which included bagels, cereal, pastries etc.. and the guy looking after the breakfast was great and don't forget to tip him! There was free computer and internet access...very handy. The room and ensuite were clean and tidy, and cleaned every day!!! Great choice for a trip to NY, have stayed in other hotels on other trips and none of them come close....will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jimers
Reviews.Content: New York City: Comfort Inn Midtown Date: Sept. 26 - 30, 2006 Reviewer: Trip Advisor Member, Burlington,Canada This hotel provides very good value for the money. The room was $162 per night. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was plenty large enough for 2 people. We did not spend a lot of time in the room. Most of our waking hours were spent sight seeing. The room was very clean. The only drawback was that the room faced 46th street and thus was quite noisey. My wife and I are fairly sound sleepers so this did not really bother us that much. Other rooms may be much quieter. The breakfast provided was typical of many hotels. We ate shotly after the breakfast room opened (7:00 am) and found everything satisfactory. The breakfast was as advertised. There was only on small elevator. We did not experience any long waits. We were on the 3rd floor and often walked down the stairs. The location is great. There are many restaurants nearby. Times Square is less than a block away. You can walk to many attractions such as Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, many theaters, Times Square and the bus tours (hop on/ hop off). This is a great place to stay. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a room with no view :)”
Reviews.Author: Yankee11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 5 nights 9/26-10/1. We stayed here because we were on a budget and it was $179/night and the best we could find in the location. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel for the price. The hotel staff were very friendly. The continental breakfast was nice as well as the business center where we were able to check our emails and print our boarding passes for NO CHARGE! The room was pretty small but we were only there long enough to sleep so that didnt bother me. I also requsted a room away from the street so we didnt have any problems with noise. I did hear the slamming doors once in awhile but not enough to disrupt my sleep. Luckily we were on the 2nd floor, so we used the stairs the whole time. I did notice the elevator was very slow so I am glad we were on the 2nd floor. Overall, it was a fine hotel for the price and I would definitely stay here again. The location is excellent and you are close to subway stops.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, this is a very good option”
Reviews.Author: Mayer_AGU
Reviews.Content: Hi! When I was planning my first-ever trip to New York City I really did not know where to stay and I admit the reviews that I read in Trip Advisor where the key element in order to choose the Comfort Inn Midtown. After a four-night stay my conclusion is that I agree to previous reviews in the sense that this hotel is a very good option in New York City. I do not have new things to add to the many reviews posted here, but I would like to comment my agreement on the following advantages of the Comfort Inn Midtown: Price.- Very affordable considering the hotel is closely located to Times Square. Room/bathroom cleanliness.- They were spotless in my experience. Room amenities.- No luxuries here but you find adequate space for clothes (corner closet), iron, ironing board, hairdryer, coffee maker, radio alarm & TV. Hotel amenities.- I found the free Internet access (two computers in a “business room”), complimentary breakfast, and free daily newspaper as a plus. There is also a fitness room but I did not use it; it seemed small but adequate. Location.- As it has been repeatedly noted, the hotel is close to Times Square and the Rockefeller subway station; the convenient location gives you the chance to walk and be part of many activities or to take the subway or a bus wherever you want to go. Staff.- In my experience, the maid and the breakfast room attendant were even friendlier than the front desk staff, but in general terms all of the employees are kind and attentive. On the other hand, some travelers have noticed weaknesses and noted them here; I have an opinion on the following: Slamming doors.- Yes, doors do slam, then it is a good idea to be careful when closing them. Elevator.- It is old and small indeed but no big deal; my room was in the sixth floor so I usually took the elevator and its service was functional enough. Room size.- I do not know other New York hotel’s room size, thus I lack a point of comparison; the room seemed small (I got a queen-size bed) but I do not need more space. Perhaps the rooms are too small if you travel with your family, but I did not have the chance to see a two-bed room to have an opinion on that. Temperature.- Other reviews complained of rooms being too hot… no problem in my stay, since tropical storm “Ernesto” brought rainy days to the city. As a side note, throughout the almost 250 TripAdvisor Traveler Reviews about the Comfort Inn Midtown, there are some descriptions that are actually referring to the Comfort Inn Manhattan, which is located in 35th St and has a total of 12 floors; the Comfort Inn Midtown is a smaller hotel, with a total of 9 floors (new readers of these reviews, please take this into account… any descriptions of a 12-floor hotel and two elevators are actually not referring to the Comfort Inn Midtown). Overall, I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Gruff but later helpful staff, Great value”
Reviews.Author: vwsswv
Reviews.Content: I booked a night here based on the reviews here. This one really rose to the top as the best hotel under $200/night. I wanted a clean room for a night after a red-eye and didn't want to pay the $300/night that most name brand hotels were charging. Upon arrival, they weren't able to give us a room. Understandable since it was 8am. We returned after breakfast at a local diner and were again told that we couldn't get a room until 12 or 1. This is better than the standard 3-4 pm check in times, but we figured that they'd have an early check out and be able to get us in sometime sooner. We ended up killing a little time in the lobby and our patience paid off. Probably 15 minutes after 9, they were able to get us a clean room that more than met our expectations. Sure the room was small, but not unreasonably small. I'd say comparable to rooms in San Francisco or Europe. I'd stay there again and definitely feel it's worth the $100 in savings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a NYC Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Caltobello
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel on September 3, 2006. Yes, the rooms are small, but when you are in NYC how much time do you actually stay in the room? The bathroom was small as well, but again, how much room do you really need in the bathroom. Both the room, bathroom, and lobby were CLEAN. The air conditioner was a window unit that provided adequate cooling power (we like our room cool). Room ammenities included: iron and ironing board, hairdryer, and coffee pot. The location is great because it is between time square and 6th avenue. The only suggestion I would make for a person who is staying at this hotel, is to call the hotel and ask if there are any festivals going on that would block the street. We happened to be arriving during Brazil day, and could not access the street by car which required us to park 7 blocks away instead of the parking garage across the street from the hotel. OVERALL: We would def. stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: DiscoStick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown in the middle of July. We had read the reviews posted here and were fairly certain it would be a nice place. Turns out everyone was right! The Comfort Inn is located 1/2 a block from Times Square so the location couldn't be any better. We were right in the middle of the action! Being in the middle of all this you'd expect a lot of noise but our room was perfectly quiet - slamming doors were a little loud as some had mentioned before but not enough to wake us up. The room was small but that was fine with us because who wants to spend a lot of time in the hotel anyway... The room was also very clean and the staff was always extremely nice and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to experience NY! Also, there's a subway station pretty close so getting around the city is no problem.

Reviews.Title: “building work!”
Reviews.Author: john7glen
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, at this price. First room offered was a single (that claimed to be a double). I could not see two 200lb people getiing into the bed. They changed our room for a better one. Main problem was the buiding work going on inside the hotel. They had completed the restyling of first four or five floors, but the work was still going on as we could see every day. Men carrying plaster board in the lifts and old units out meaning that only one of the two lifts was available most of the time. Place was dusty desoite the constant effort of the staff. Should be OK soon, I hope,

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 10-17, 2006. We had booked a room with a King bed and sofabed in November 2005. Due to the other comments on this site I rang the day I was checking in to be told byu the hotel they do not have king size beds with a sofabed in the same room. This made for a very uncomfortable stay for my husband, our eight year old and me in one bed. My brother-in-law slept in the other bed. We have not yet had an apology from the hotel, although we booked through Choice Hotels. Anyway, we had a room on the twelth floor and had fantastic views of both the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. We walked the stairs most of the time, and it was great to walk the various staircases and to see the old building, including watching the mail go down the chute. Our room was always clean. The breakfast was very good each morning and the location was great for subways and walking. I would stay here again, but you need to ensure you are getting what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “I agree heartily - this is a great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieTourist
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 7 nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown, New York City. I would agree that the location is one of the main selling points of this establishment. The Inn is situated a mere couple of minutes walk from Times Square and there are lots of local eateries (at various food prices and choices.) As well, it is close to the Hop On - Hop Off buses at Times Square and within walking distance to many of New York's vast sights and subway stations. The room my husband and I were allocated was very small, as was the bathroom (shower stall/toilet/washbasin). The room was clean - but do NOT expect 5 star accommodation. I rate this hotel as 2 1/2 to 3 stars. However, the hotel staff were very friendly and obliging. The room price included breakfast which was sufficient to start the day's activities (tea/coffee/juice + cereals/pastries etc/fruits). We enjoyed a great live theatre matinee show after waiting a relaltive short time for TDKT tickets (2 for the price of 1 !) The ticket selling booth was located closeby Times Square. Value for money, I think this was a most favourable hotel and we have stayed in this city 5 or 6 times previously. P.S. We showed our Australian Automobile Club Membership Card and got 10% off the daily rate. I booked the hotel over the web at hotels-and-discounts.com

Reviews.Title: “good spot for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this midtown location, on west 36th streeet, on june 9th. The location was pretty good, about a 5-10 minute walk to the subway. The cab ride home from the theater was $5 or$6. Our room was very small, with a single and a double bed, small armoire, desk and a standard comfort inn bathroom. It was all really clean, and the breakfast was better than expected. They served a few kinds of juice, coffee, cereals, toast, bagels, and fruit(apples, bananas, oranges).The staff was hard working and generally pleasant. I paid $179, for a thursday night, which seemed like a decent value, considering new york hotel prices!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BarbinWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Read all reviews before staying at this hotel. Was still reluctant because the room rate was so reasonable. We stayed for three nights. Would I return? Yes I would. The room was clean, small (it's New York!), location was great, breakfast was more than adequate, and the staff is very friendly. Thank you Comfort Inn for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: kellielc7
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! It's small and nothing fancy but what do you expect for the price? No view from the windows but within less than 100 steps out the front door you're in the center of Times Square! The air condtioner was loud which was nice bc we heard no one else around. So glad we found this place. We will ablsolutely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you are a light sleeper...”
Reviews.Author: Foudevoyage
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a long week-end in NYC. I agree with everybody. Almost everything was perfect about this hotel (location, cleanliness, friendly staff, small but workable room, decent breakfast, storage room). We got there at lunch time and our room was ready. Perfect! The only, but very important, problem is that I could hardly sleep in our room. The cause: the rooms are not soundproofed at all. We could hear the TV and the children speak in the room next to ours and everything that was going on in the hallway (a family was sharing multiple rooms and was constantly going from one room to the others, screaming, laughing and slamming doors; it was awful…). In addition, it’s New York City; people were coming in and out at all hours, slamming doors and screaming in the small hallway. I had problems falling asleep because of all the noise and was constantly waken up afterwards. In the middle of the night, after 3 or 4, I was finally able to sleep. If you are like me a light sleeper, you better select another hotel. Since we are more experienced with the subway system now, next time we plan to stay away from Times Square. For about the same price, we will get a much better hotel. We may even be ready to pay a bit more to get a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: atlanta
Reviews.Content: Just returned from staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 5 nights. Total price per night including taxes was $200. We usually stay at 3 or 4 star hotels but tried out a 2-star for a change (and price was much better). The hotel was small (in size and number of rooms) which was nice for a change. The elevator was big enough for about 8 people (or 3 with luggage). Warning - watch out for the elevator door! It slams FAST and HARD and I still have the bruise on my hand to prove it. The halls were very narrow. Our room was the smallest I have ever stayed in but was adequate. I called it a "one-way room" because only one person could walk around at a time! The window air conditioner was great and not loud at all - just a quiet hum. We were on the back facing the church next door and heard the church bells a lot which was nice. Actually, that was the only noise we heard the whole trip from our room. The bathroom was larger than I had expected. It even had a large frosted window in it and a large ledge to sit your stuff on. We only had the breakfast 2 mornings and it was fine - bagels, toast, boiled eggs, cereal, donuts, fruit, coffee, orange and apple juice, cappucino, coffee and tea. One person said there were only 4 tables in there, but there were 8 (I think). We did have to wait a couple of minutes one day. I think it would have been nice if the people who were finished would have left and given up their table instead of sitting there planning the day's itinerary while we stood there. The computer room (2 computers, free internet) was a nice plus because we could check on a few things while we were there. All the employees were friendly. One other thing - the doors really do SLAM when you leave your room. They usually started around 7 a.m. All you have to do is keep your hand on the handle and pull it shut and it won't slam. We couldn't figure out why people let them slam so much. Rude, I guess. Anyway, bottom line is this hotel was great for the money and location, I would highly recommend it if you wanted a nice place to sleep and shower, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in the midst of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: A frequent traveler
Reviews.Content: What a gem! We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. Given its Times Square location and its relatively inexpensive price, I was a bit apprehensive about what we would get. Our room, however, much surpassed our expectations. Although small, it was nicely furnished and the bathroom was clean and relatively spacious. In fact, the hotel looks as if it was recently refurbished. The entire staff were very accommodating and pleasant to boot! Parking is also a real bargain - just across the street and only $20 per 24 hours, about half of what the other hotels charge. The continental breakfast included bagels, doughnuts, coffee and milk, which is all one really needs. If you're adventurous and want something more for breakfast, try the Cuban restaurant immediately across the street - cheap eats and very good. A real experience. If heading back to midtown, we will stay there in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: howie603
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviewers say this hotel is in a great location, so close to Times Square and of course the subway in Times Square. When we arrived we asked to see the room before we took the luggage up, our room was a good size, from what people had told me about NY hotels I thought we might get a shoe box but this wasn't the case. The room was at the front of the hotel and on the top floor, it was still noisy (street noise) but fine if you can use earplugs. Beds were very comfortable, room and bathroom clean, we always had a good supply of hot water for baths and showers. Breakfast was a plus, you get bagels, doughnuts, cereal, toast, fruit, orange juice, tea and coffee - you basically help yourself grab a table. We got a cab from the hotel to the airport and you pre-pay at reception and it cost $55.00.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Comfort In Mid Town NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mid Town Comfort Inn for three nights and enjoyed it tremendously. A luxury hotel it is not, but it was more than adequate and the price was the least expensive that I could find. $170.00 per night with $20.00 per night validated parking fee at a nearby (across the street) parking garage. There is an added savings in the complimentary breakfast. The rooms are small, but adequate. The bed was comfortable and clean. The bath had a combination tub shower. Everything was very clean and was refreshed each day while we were out. The front desk was very cordial and helpful with any questions. I purchased the tickets for the "Red Bus" (Greylines) from the front desk clerk and was told that they could give me a discount. Another savings! I requested and received a room away from 46th St. side of the motel and did not experience any excessive outside noise.The Comfort Inn Mid Town's location should over ride the small room reports.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, helpful staff, terrific price.”
Reviews.Author: picturelinda
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed three nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown and we were very happy with everything about the hotel. It was my first visit to NYC and I chose this hotel because of reviews on TripAdvisor. I was a little nervous about it because there were a few negative comments in some of the reviews, but our experience was very positive. The staff went out of their way to be helpful to us and our room was very clean and comfortable. We were on the 5th floor and we asked for the front because we wanted the view. It was a bit noisy at times, but we just considered it " the music of the city". It has great, authentic New York City atmosphere, and staying there was an important part of our experience of the city. The location and price make it a terrific deal. I will stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown anytime I can get back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 12th floor on this hotel in April 2006. We were not expecting much as the cost of the 4 person room was competitive. We were pleasantly surprised!! A comfortable room, excellent location, free coffee (from the reception area), complimentary newspapers and a satisfactory buffet breakfast. Added to these were freindly, competent staff and free luggage storage after checking out. I would not however book private transfers on the return to your airport (as recommended by the hotel) - I would go with a yellow cab, just as easy and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Midtown Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LynwoodH
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is less than a block from Times Square and within 4 blocks from Radio City Music Hall and Rockefeller Center. The rooms are basic but very clean. The thing that we liked about the room was that it was very quiet..no street noise at all..and we had a beautiful view. The deluxe continential breakfast was very nice and since it is included, it is a great value...We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eneka
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, location! We were a bit concerned about our New York stay as many hotels had had terrible reviews on Trip Advisor. We turned up at the Comfort Inn Midtown and we were really surprised with the hotel. The location is fantasic, bathrooms clean, staff friendly, good breakfast and it was a great stay overall. The location is excellent - a stones throw to Times Square, subway, Macy's, Emipre State etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location”
Reviews.Author: GoofysDad
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the web for a 1 night stopover on my way back from CT. The location is awesome! Just a block from Times Square, 1/2 block from the Rockefeller Center subway station. The staff was very friendly, both at check in and later when I checked out. A Continental breakfast is offered and was very convenient. The hotel was very clean, even the basement where the ice machine is located. The room itself was very clean, had a coffee pot (which was nice) and.... well that's about all the good I can say about the room. I have never stayed in a room that small. Now don't get me wrong, for a quick one night or just 1 person, it was fine. I couldn't imagine spending a few days in the room with my wife. There just isn't enough room, especially the bathroom. The bathroom was nice and it seems to be recently redone so it is not one of those 30 year old NY bathrooms. The good part is you can do everything by standing in one place :) I could touch all the walls from standing in the middle of the bathroom. Cruise ships have bigger cabins and showers, no kidding. As others have mentioned, the room was very hot even while it was cool outside. The have signs saying do not open the window so I turned on the window AC and it never got the room cold. The view was of a brick wall 2 feet away :) My friends were staying at the Pennsylvania on 34th street and I went down to meet them. Compared to the Comfort Inn the hotel was very dirty. The hallways were drab and in need of repair as was the room. I would never stay there. I take that back, I might stay there, but not with my wife. I can put up with a lot, including dirty, but she would have problems with it. The the room was twice the size of the room at the Comfort Inn but the room at the Comfort Inn wins hands down! I added this in just for comparison. Oh yea, the line to check in was about 30 minutes. The longest line I saw at the Comfort Inn was 1 person. Would I stay there again, you bet! If I was going by myself or with my wife for just 1 or 2 nights it would be perfect. The location, the cleanliness and the friendly staff make it a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one-half a block from time square.The staff are great,rooms were clean,the beakfast was good. Rooms on the small side but well maintained. Would return next trip. Canada loves New York City

Reviews.Title: “no comfort but great location”
Reviews.Author: Sherman7971
Reviews.Content: For the theater district, the location is great. Our room was extremely tiny and uncomfortable, even by New York standards, and there was no means of circulating air. No fan or AC and the windows were right up against another building so they provided no relief (actually, we weren't supposed to open them but we had no choice). The heat was uncontrollable, making it impossible to sleep. They told us there was no other room available. Quite the disappointment after having booked months in advance. Rooms like ours are the type they should have saved till the very end for last minute walk-ins. Check your room first!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: WestVirginiaSash
Reviews.Content: While not the swankiest hotel in the midtown area the Comfort Inn Midtown was reasonably priced (for NYC), with reasonably sized rooms (for NYC ) with friendly staff. The rooms and lobby were clean and the breakfast was adequate. However, the room was never at the right temperature and the air conditioner was very loud. Overall it was a positive stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ChunkyLola
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, after staying at the Muse Hotel the previous year and being impressed by the reviews and the obvious better-value rates. We were very impressed, much better value than the over-rated hotel across the street. Although this is not a boutique hotel, it is perfect for what we are looking for in a new york hotel - excellent location, good value, clean rooms and friendly staff. I was somewhat surprised to read a previous review, stating that the breakfast guy was a 'jobsworth'. The man could not do enough for you in the morning, he also works through the rest of the day in the hotel, so he has is work cut out for him. I wouldn't want to pick up bread if someone is sticking their hands in the container - that's what the tongs are there for!! Overall, probably the best value hotel around Times Square. This was our second visit to NYC and although we loved this hotel, we will probably stay around the Village on our next visit, as Times Square is just far too touristy after a first vist. If you want to stay in Times Square - book this hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the area”
Reviews.Author: CARMINO
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay especially for the fair price, the convinence and close to Time Square, one block away. Continental breakfast a good plus. The room may be small but no problem. Staff courteous and very helpful. Only diassatisfaction was with my poor hearing close caption was not available on the TV. I do though highly recommend this hotel and I travel frequently with my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reporter
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in New York in March prior to a cruise and I was SO glad I had chosen the Comfort Inn Midtown. It was extremely cold and windy while we were there and we were glad we could go to wonderful restaurants close by and a short walk to the Broadway shows. Also when we had to leave very early in the morning before the breakfast room opened to attend Regis and Kelly, we found the McDonald's right around the corner very convenient for a quick, hot breakfast before the ordeal of waiting outside the studio in the cold. If you want a beautiful view and various amenities, be prepared to spend about $400 to $500 a night in New York. If you're looking for a spotlessly clean, comfortable hotel in an excellent location, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Look For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations at the Comfort Inn after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. Believe the reviews - we were very pleased with this hotel. It met all of my travel requirements: CLEAN - one of the cleanest rooms I've stayed in, definitely the cleanest I've encountered in NYC. CONVENIENT - you really couldn'd ask for a better location for doing all the tourist-y stuff. It was a great "home base". AFFORDABLE - our rate was $149 a night. Wow. Other notes: the shower pressure was great (hard to find in a hotel sometimes) and we always had hot water. The hotel was generally quiet, although we could hear water pipes at work through the walls at times. The room was a bit small, but I expect that in a large city in an affordable hotel. Our room was on the 2nd floor, so we were able to use the stairs and avoid waiting on the elevator. We definitely plan to stay at the Comfort Inn on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Leyland123
Reviews.Content: Location for Times Square you cannot beat. Hotel room was large enough and cleaned on a daily basis. Limited breakfast with a "jobsworth" attendant very curt and somewhat rude when people didnt use the bread tongues, and place holders in the correct place. To be honest we got some amusement watching his face when this happened. The hotel lift is very small so be aware when taking suitcases upto your room. Dont let these picky remarks put you off as we are going back again for New Year. Location is ideal, rooms clean and large enough. 3 Star hotel in a 5 Star location.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a Letdown...But”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews on this website, me and my boyfriend booked this hotel for a 4 night stay in New York. We stayed at the Milford Plaza 2 years ago and found it OK, but just decided to try somewhere different. However, we were slightly disappointed with this one. Yes it was clean and you really can't fault it for it's excellent location - literally just steps away from practically everything. So in that respect, the value for money was really good. And I'm not one of those people who whinges about ridiculous things like the air con being too loud, but I just found this hotel a bit shoddy. The staff weren't all that helpful and if you wanted something booking then you had to go and ring them yourself which was unusual for a hotel (after visiting hundreds) and little things like that just help you with your trip. The rooms were also unbearably hot and the only way to cool yourself was to use the fan which when we turned it on smelt like a mens urinal (and I'm really not exaggerating) so it made it uncomfortable to sleep (which is all we did in the room). The fabulous breakfast included that everyone talks about is just average - if that. You eat off of paper plates and with plastic knives and forks, which again I know may sound snobby but it just felt shabby. The man in the tiny breakfast room, which we had to wait outside for space at least 2 mornings (it only seated 4 tables) was good and kept the area clean though. All in all we had a good stay but it's nice to feel a bit special when visitng somewhere as great as New York, and this hotel just didn't do that. We travelled on a budget and never stay in posh hotels - as long as they're clean and in a good location I'm pleased enough. However, the strange bellman at this hotel didn't even help with our bags and when you pass all those lovely hotels and see what goes on in them it just makes you see how the Comfort Inn is a bit run down and needs better mannered staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain with the comfort inn”
Reviews.Author: bedelicious
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be rated excellent for the following reasons; . So cheap especially if you book online, myself n my sis stayed for 5 days for £313 between us .The location is unbelievble, in the centre of times square .almost everything is in walking distance (we got the sub twice, to the statue of liberty, and central park) . No need to pay for taxis .its right next to the times square info centre so buy ur tickets there for the statue of liberty n u save queing time .The staff are so friendly and helpful, they let our friend (from brooklyn) stay for free and brought us blankets, without us even asking can she stay . the free continental breakfast is beautiful with, toast, bagels, cereal, dognuts, juice, tea n coffee, and the guy who serves it keeps offering you more .the rooms are very clean but basic, it has cable tv to in ur room, the maid is lovely very trustworthy I want to go back next year and will deffo be staying here again. If you want a cheap stay in new york definatley stay here you'll save a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, too much heat”
Reviews.Author: RMBEE
Reviews.Content: Our room was located on the seventh floor facing a building. The gentleman that checked us in told us that he was going to put us on the quiet side of the hotel. Quiet meant facing a brick wall, which really didn't bother my husband and I. The main problem was the temperature of the room. It was uncomfortably warm and there was no way to turn the heat down. We voiced our concerns at the desk and the said that they would look intoit. Obviously there was ot much that anyone could do, since the heating system seems to be automatic. Even though there was a sign that said not to open the window, we did anyway. Unfortunately this did not help the temperature of the room. I'm not sure what the answer to the problem was. The morning breakfast was quite adequate and the location could not be beat. Maybe if it is cold outside itwould not be a problem. I should have tried plugging in the air conditioning unit to see if that would have cooled off the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok.. now i've stayed in hotels all over the world (from $$$ to $) and I must say for the price you pay, this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Stayed there my 1st & 2nd times in NYC (both being a single female traveler). Hotel is a 1/2 block from Times Square & Theatre District and 2 blocks from Rockerfella Center, NBC Studios, 5th Avenue Shopping. ALL hotel staff was more than helpful and extremely friendly. Hotel was very clean, and was not a bad size for a NY hotel room. Featured on a quiet side street with no traffic noise at night. Very secure & safe… would recommend it to any one! Hotel windows didn't have the best view, because you are on a side street, but who wants to stay in the hotel all day? Especially when you're so close to the action!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal”
Reviews.Author: rjfmkt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated and is the bargain of the century. For about $100 you stay on 46th St close to Times Square, free contintental breakfast and a clean room with pleasant staff. What more could you ask for? If you're looking for luxury this is not the place. If you want comfortable accomodations at a reasonable price it is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Still A Bargain”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying two nights at this hotel in the past eight months. I got a great midweek rate with my Auto Club discount, $98.99. I arrived about 2 1/2 hours prior to check-in but was given a room anyway. Check-in was lengthy because I arrived on March 1st, the day a new computer system was introduced, so there were some glitches with it, but that was to be expected and I didn't mind, since I was early anyway. The room I had this time, while still a queen-size, was a bit larger than the last time I stayed there, as was the bathroom. However, it seemed a bit more worn down than before: the bedspread had seen better days, the carpet was shredded where it met the bathroom, the telephone cord was frayed, the phone books were outdated, and there was a strange dent in the wall. I was on the sixth floor on the church side (the hotel is adjacent to a Catholic Church) so I did hear the church bells regularly. The room was very hot. When I asked the cleaning lady how to adjust the heat she simply opened the window, in the middle of a snowstorm! And there's still the problem with the doors that close themselves and slam loudly while doing so. If you're a business traveler and needing to get up in the morning this might not bother you, but I was there on pleasure and didn't enjoy the slams at 6:30 in the morning. Overall, however, this is still a good deal and the location can't be beat. You're right between subway stops at Times Square and Rockefeller Center, and my favorite Cuban restaurant, Havana Central, is just down the street. (Check out their dulce de leche martinis.) In fact, just about anything you could possibly need is within walking distance, the staff is pleasant and helpful, and the free continental breakfast will save you a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: aseltzrteo
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel in NY was harder than I expected, I didn't realize that just staying for one night was expensive almost everywhere I looked until I found the Comfort Inn Midtown. If you use your triple A card you recieve a discount of $99 a night (we stayed on a Sunday night). Yes the room was small, but for two people it was all we needed. Very clean, staff was very nice and there was free continental breakfast which was good. There is a deli only a few buildings down for a great lunch or snack. I would definetely reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBoston-7
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. I arrived 3 hours before check-in but was given a room right away. Everybody at this hotel was helpful and pleasant. The room was small, but it was spotless, quiet, and featured all the amenities. And, as everbody says, the location can't be beat. I will definitely stay here again. It is a budget hotel in price only - a real New York City jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Check in at night”
Reviews.Author: cruisin-the-world
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a great deal- especially when you book far in advance. Unfortunately, don't expect your room to be there if you are coming in late at night. We arrived at 11:30pm and were told that they had given our 2 rooms away because they couldn't charge our card. 2 hours later and on the phone with credit card company who was telling us that we had been charged for the rooms that night, we had the night desk person offer us 2 rooms at 3 times the rate we booked. We had to walk around times square and find a small hotel for the night and had to come back the next day to deal with the manager. Not a good way to start your trip! Once the manager cleared everything up and apologized (we were still out an extra $300), things seemed to be looking up. On our 2nd night there, my friend caught one of the desk people going into our room to look for "tape"- we had not been told or called and so he went in and watched them while they moved a couple of things around and left. As much as it was a great deal initially, sometimes it's true that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous about this hotel, but had read the reviews and reckoned it was worth a chance. The location is great - Times Square at the end of the road. The staff were friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was a bonus. The room was a little cramped - but who cares? It was nice and warm and very clean. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel, and even the pillows were great. I am recommending this to everyone I know - it is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Gem!”
Reviews.Author: chrism1966
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of midtown. Great value and ok sized rooms. Continental breakfast in the best ive had in a budget inn! Look for Antonio doing breakfast, he will look after you. All in all a great place to stay in NYC. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buy as Well as Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This small hotel just off Time Square is just what it is advertised plus you get a staff that genuinely makes you feel you are welcome. From instructions how to ride the subway to getting half price tickets for some shows, Ivonne and CDB were a wealth of information and also eager for out-of-towners, new to the city to enjoy themselves. Rooms are small but newly remodeled, clean, and very realistically priced. We will stay there again. S. Schenck - New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Another Successful Stay / Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading several favourable reviews of this property, we stayed there for the 2nd time in the last 8 months. Once again, the rooms were clean and of ample size (especially for NYC). The location near Times Square is ideal to walk to many locations or to access the nearby subway lines. Staff are great to deal with and very helpful. We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better value”
Reviews.Author: wxgirl21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for two nights, and our stay couldn't have been better! For us the LOCATION of this hotel, along with the fair price, sold us. The staff was also very helpful and pleasant. We arrived 3 hours before check-in, and they did allow us to check in early. We were on the 9th floor... room 903. It was small, but not as small as I thought it would be! The room was spotless, and the bathroom was fine. While there is no counter, there is a large windowsill that you can put your toiletries on. Our view looked out to another building, but we could also see some NY sights! This hotel is IN the theatre district, and is in walking distance to MANY attractions. You can get to the airport via a $28 cab ride, or take the train and bus, which only costs $4 per person. Overall, I don't think we'd stay anywhere else in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The location was perfect and the staff from the front desk to the bellhop was friendly and nice. I felt welcome and the staff often went out of their way to accomodate. I was offered coffee so many times when walking thru the lobby. Great experience. An excellent place to spend my MLK weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Last-minute reservation, first-rate stay!”
Reviews.Author: Oronian
Reviews.Content: When my son and I had an opportunity to stay an extra night in NY but hadn't made a hotel reservation, I read in the NY Times Guide to NY that the Comfort Inn Midtown was a reasonable choice for budget travelers like us. I called at the last minute and got a double room for $100, and I couldn't believe the value! The room was small, but clean and modern. No view to speak of, but very quiet on the back side of the hotel. Everything worked, beds were comfortable, and a fairly good continental breakfast was available beginning at 7 a.m. The location was extremely convenient, near theaters, subway, Midtown attractions. I am recommending this place to everyone I know and plan to stay there the next time we are visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location - walk down the street and you are in the middle of Times Square - you can't fault that! The room was an ok size - a long time since it has been renovated though - we had to change rooms from a room at the front of the building - garbage trucks all night! But our room towards the back of the hotel was much better - the hotel has a very ancient lift - still works but feels very rickety - free breakfast included - basically donuts, toast, coffee and tea and juice - not much else - If you could pay the same rate and be in as good a location then I would look for somewhere else a bit more modern - but if it is all you can afford, and want to be in the middle of the manhattan action and do not have high expectations then this is the place for you - nothing wrong with it - just is very basic.

Reviews.Title: “No comfort at the Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: AlexBeezer
Reviews.Content: My girldfriend and I (both in our early 20's) stayed at the Comfort Inn for 2 nights (January 1st and 2nd). We arrived at 1h30 PM on January the 1st and were told that no room were ready since everyone went to bed late the night before bla bla bla (room maid began their shift at 9h30 AM so...) by the rude receptionnist who told us that check-in was at 3h PM and not before. Coming from the Barclay Intercontinental where we had a room at 8H30AM, we felt kinda mad, but still, waited. We got our room at 2h45 PM. The room was on the 5th floor which was obviously on the small side. The AC unit wasn't working and the heating system was way to hot, so we had to sleep with the window open all night (but it wasn't that bad, not that noisy outside...well, that's before 7h AM when the nearby church rings it's bells.) The bathroom was discusting, hair (and pubic hair) rolling all over the floor. The location and the price however cannot be beat! The good thing about having a crappy room is that you definitly don't want to stay inside. Therefore, you spend more time in NY than in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--no extra beds!!”
Reviews.Author: akanakagawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a terrific location--midway between Rockefeller Center and Broadway. Room was generous in size with a queen bed but no opportunity for a rollaway for an additional person, despite being assured that this was possible through Hotels.com. Price was very reasonable for date (Christmas week) and location. Climate control was not so great--room seemed warm and hard to turn the heat down and 1 towel looked to have hair on it (though appeared not to have been used). Positives include location, location, location, free use of computer with printer in lobby, small exercise facility and free generous breakfast including good bagels, donuts, cold cereal, coffee, juice, fresh apples and bananas and firm mattress. All in all a good value for the price and a discount of 10% if over age 50.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ClarkGriswald
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a pleasant weekend trip to New York where we stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Can’t say enough good things about a clean and attractive, reasonably priced hotel, conveniently located in the Times Square-Theater District. Our 6th floor room was recently renovated along with new furnishings.Although on the smaller side, the room was more than comfortable and accommodated a Queen size bed. The location couldn’t be better with major attractions, such as Times Square, Empire State Building, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Macy’s , Rockefeller Center, Radio City and Central Park, within easy walking distance. The hotel staff were all extremely pleasant and in the mornings, guests were provided a complimentary breakfast of pastries, bagels, fruit, coffee and juices. Definitely planning to stay here again on return visits to New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DavidM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, from November 30 through December 5. I booked it because of all the good reviews on Tripadvisor, AND because it was probably the least expensive hotel in the area. What a gem it turned out to be. It is one half block from Times Square, yet our room was very quiet. Though small, the room was very clean and comfortable. We were on the 7th floor with a view of the roof of the church next door. (By the way, one of the other recent reviews here said that you can have a view of the Empire State Building: not true, they must have confused this Comfort Inn with a different one). One peculiarity was that it seemed that the radiator-type heat was always on, which is good because it was very cold in NYC, but the only way to reduce the heat to a comfortable level was to turn on the air conditioner. It worked, so no problem. The people at the front desk were extremely helpful and attentive. They found deals for us to various attractions, and booked a sedan for us back to the airport, as well as let us store our luggage until we left in the afternoon. When we return to New York City we will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After searching for a "reasonably-priced" place to stay in Midtown Manhattan, this is what we settled on. (There really is no such thing as a clean, nice place to stay that is truly reasonable in NYC.) At any rate, we were very pleasantly surprised. If you close the curtains (thereby eliminating the view of the brick wall) you might imagine yourself in a quaint country inn. The room was a bit small, but it was cozy, clean and really quite lovely. We didn't spend much time in the room, but that was not the point of this vacation. We would stay there again in a New York minute. :-)

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: missdruidsglen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for five nights in November. It may not be the ritz but it is a very comfortable, clean hotel in a fantastic location (times square is one block away). The staff are very friendly and helpful - I wanted to change rooms after the first night as it was unseasonably warm in New York and the room was unbearably hot - we were given a new room no problem. All this with a free breakfast! I searched for weeks to find the perfect hotel but having read the reviews on tripadvisor I opted for a reasonably priced comfortable hotel and found a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: eline75
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the comfort inn midtown from 2 sep-9sep. We got a great rate at 149 dollars pr night and the location was just the best,espesially for us travelling to New York for the first time. The housekeeper kept it clean and we got fresh towels every day. And what a quiet hotel...i can´t belive that i stayed a half block from times square. Minus for small room and our window facing a brick wall. Remember to tip the man in the breakfast room,he was so helpful and nice. He is also the man who`s vacuing the hallways,so he is working for his bucks :o). It`s in a such a great location that we didn`t take a taxi once...used the subway for long distances but walked almost everywhere. We had a great time and would defenetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Midtown: Not Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hey, for under $200 bucks (since my husband is considered a "mature traveler" at age 51--we got a 10% discount)--this place isn't half bad. Here's what was good: The price, the adequate free breakast, and close to theaters & shopping--we walked everywhere!! For under $200--the rooms were mildly spacious. We were four blocks from Jersey Boys (great show!! I highly recommend it), and the hotel arranged for a shuttle to take us back to the airport (23 bucks each)... The not so good: Two not so plush towels (asked for more, but never got them); no view; rather noisy all over, and not so good toiletries or lighting in the bathroom. I'd stay there again--not fancy, but bearable!

Reviews.Title: “excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: sailsail
Reviews.Content: Great location and clean with wireless internet, coffeemaker, tv, iron and a one computer-printer business center. Linens seemed fresh and of decent quality. The room was tiny and had no view but was still a bargain. As to a former comment about loud door noise, my door wouldn't lock unless you slammed it. I mean that's what the staff told me to do to get my door to lock -- and didn't understand when I tried to explain that it would disturb the neighbors. They could work on that issue for sure....

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, Pleasant Staff, Good Location for Theaters, But..”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown earlier this month. We arrived in NYC very early in the AM and they stored our luggage until our room was ready - shortly after 10:30 AM - hours before official check-in time! Throughout our 3 night stay we found staff to be very helpful and pleasant. This Comfort Inn is in a great location for attending the theater and not bad for exploring the city. And the price is certainly resonable for Manhattan. The room was clean, the bathroom was small but attractive, the shower had good water pressure and plenty of hot water. The room was very small, however, and the mattress on our bed had seen better days - saggy in the middle. The bedspread was clean but very tired. The biggest problem was the noise from the hallway. Any time someone closed a door on the hall it reverberated in our room loudly enough to startle you out of a deep sleep. We turned on the AC fan to try and drown out the noise but it was not enough. The view from our window was of a brick wall about a foot away. This made the room dark and the lighting was not adequate enough to compensate for this. I would stay here again IF there was a room where the closing doors on the hall did not make me jump and the mattress was not sagging.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Claire3373
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from 23 - 25 September and couldn't have been happier. Before arrival I contacted the hotel to request a particular room and they couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was spacious, clean and looked like it had been recently refurbished. Yes, it was a little noisy at night but what do you expect when you are just a stones throw from Times Square! At least if you stay up late in Times Square you only have a couple of minutes walk back to your hotel! We are already planning a return trip to New York (which in my opinion is the best city in the world!) and will not hesitate in rebooking the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For New York, a great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort is in an outstanding location if you like action and convenience. The hotel itself is about what you would expect in a budget accommodation. The hotel is located a block and a half from the Rockefeller Center subway station and is easily accessed. We were in 2 different rooms. We had a street facing room for the first night..a little more noisy since the trash pickups show up at 5 am in the front. We requested a room in the back and the staff was able to oblige. Unlike other reviews, we had no problem with the staff. Both rooms, particularly the first, needed to be remodeled....carpet worn and dirty looking....but the rest of the decor was fine and the bathrooms clean. The bottom line is that prices are outrageous in NYC and this is one of the better in the budget category

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to a family situation I had to cancel my reservation. The manager, Rajni Rikh, refused to give me a cancellation number. Even after I expressed concerns about having proof of cancellation, she became very irritated. I called the main Comfort Inn number and they too refused to provide a cancellation number. If you have to cancel at this hotel monitor your credit card carefully since you won't have proof you cancelled.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: birdsong
Reviews.Content: The reason I give this hotel 5 circles is because of value. I only spent one night at the Comfort Inn Midtown for business. I was able to get a AAA rate that was very good for midtown Manhattan. The room was clean and the bed relatively comfortable. Location, location, location ... if you want a midtown address without the high rates, this is the choice. Service was good too.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: LorMo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two sons stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from August 22-25. I used this website and relied upon others' reviews when making the booking, as we had never been to NYC before. Everyone was basically right on in their reviews. I thought that since I had used this website to make my decision, I would contribute to it as well to help others. The hotel is not new, nor is it "The Ritz", but it is very clean and the location is perfect. Times Square is such an exciting place to be, and we were steps away from it. We basically walked everywhere, as the hotel is centrally located. The room was small, but we were gone right after breakfast and didn't return until late in the evening, so it wasn't a big deal. The lighting in the room could have been better, the fan in the bathroom wasn't working, we couldn't open a window, and the air conditioner could have been quieter, but these weren't major things. The continental breakfast was okay - nothing spectacular - but it started us off in the morning and allowed us to get on with our day without first having to find a place to eat. There are some good restaurants in the area - we recommended Bubba Gump Shrimp (named for the movie Forrest Gump). Staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown allowed us to make NYC an affordable holiday. It is perfect if you are looking for something clean, well located and affordable at the same time. We loved NYC and had a terrific time. Hope you will, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: iloveny0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is less than a block from Times Square and nearby everything a tourist would want to do. We got there early in the morning, and although we were not able to check in, we were able to drop our luggage off and they stored it in a locked room. The room was relatively small, but I was only there to sleep and shower. It was very clean and had an iron, ironing board, and extra pillows in the small closet. There was a window air conditioner in the room, which was relatively quite, and quickly cooled the room down, which was a relief being it was nearly 100 degrees and very humid in New York! The bathroom was a decent size and stocked w/ amenities. It also had a small coffee maker. My only complaint about the bathroom was the lack of water pressure in the shower. The staff was very freindly and helpful. We had gone to NYC to go to a Yankees game. We knew that we could easily take the subway into the Bronx, but not sure which one to go on. The lady at the front desk was very helpful in advising us what train to get on and told us exactly where the subway station was (about a block away). When we checked out, we had several hours before we had to be at the airport and again they held our luggage for us as we explored more of the city.The bellhop, was a very nice gentleman who offered to get us a car service to the airport for a flat rate. We took him up on this, as it was about the same price as the cab fare getting there was and we did not have to worry about hailing our own cab. I didn't have the free breakfast they offered, but it looked like there was plenty of food, bagels, danish, coffee etc. There are numerous restaurants right on the same block as the hotel, there is a very reasonably priced deli nearby, that had a phenomenal breakfast. I would definelty stay in this hotel again. It is in a great location. And the price can not be beat. For a 2 night stay, in a room with 2 twin beds for a weekend it only cost $360. I have been to NYC a few times before and have stayed at more expensive places, and I can tell you from experience the more expensive places, although they are bigger and have a more elegant lobby, this place can definetly compete with them. So, if you are going to NYC to have fun and explore the city and just need a clean and comfortable place to sleep and shower, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “check the view from our room!! never we had such a view.”
Reviews.Author: dutchladies
Reviews.Content: We did try to make a reservation directly to the hotel, but the man was very unfriendly and said the hotel was full for this period. When we did call choicehotels we made the reservation with no trouble. The location is good for broadway and theatervisits. The breakfast is simple but oke, only the breakfastroom has only about 5 little tables and the hotel has many rooms and there is a sign not to take breakfast items to your room - sometimes you just have to wait to sit down for breakfast. The view from the room was realy something else, I donot want to think what will happen if there is a fire - It will be impossible to get out through this window!! Also see the picture taken in the bathtub, yak -it is realy dirty -We only used the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: leafgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown in mid-June. It was our first time in NYC and we wanted to be centrally located without having to pay through the nose for a room we'd hardly be in. We got there early in the morning and were able to check in right away. The staff were all friendly - the porter was especially nice. Our room was larger than I expected (based on comments on this site). It was very bright and clean. We had a street view, but at night we didn't hear any noise since we had the A/C on - it was so hot when we were there. Breakfast was basic but hit the spot - bagels, cereal, fuit, yougurt, juice.
