We didn't use the gym since we were walking 12 hours a day, but it had a stationary bike, treadmill, etc. There is a computer if you need to check your home e-mail or your fave website. And the biggest bonus - it's 100% smoke-free. Beautiful!! The only thing that could concern some people would be the elevator. There is only one and sometimes, it could be busy. We were on the 8th floor, so a few times we took the stairs. Not a problem for us, but some may find it annoying. There is a little screen by the button, so you can see where the elevator is and which way it is going. Would we stay there again? Yes, if the price isn't more than what we paid, which was $169/night. We were pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take the time to write on here about this hotel considering I read alot of reviews and based my stay upon them - so I thought I better add my two cents in as well! I stayed here for a week - we were greeted by a very UNFRIENDLY woman at the front desk, our toliet overflowed the second last day and flooded the bathroom, and while we were out they fixed it, but left a huge hair ball in the tub and a pile of 20 or so wet towels in the bathroom (I called front desk and they delt with this asap). The man who I assume in the bellhop - was friendly and super nice and offered much help. We never stayed for breakfast, but it looked like there were alot of food. More importantly, I would stay in this hotel again without hesitation because of the amazing location!!!!!!!!! It is so worth the tiny cramped rooms - your not there for the room and view anyways - atleast I wasnt - you are 1 min walk from times square and a 3 min walk from 5th ave. What more could a girl ask for!?!? Stay here if the price doesnt jump over $250.00 US - If it does you might be able to find a nicer looking hotel for the same price - but JUMP on it if its any cheaper - WELL WORTH IT! =)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Manhattan!!”
Reviews.Author: Zampo
Reviews.Content: We have remained to this comfortable Hotel for about 10 days in the first days of the new year. We had asked at reservation's time, to reserve one room up the sixth floor, couse we had read here that so was better. So, we had one excellent room with sunlight and sight of the skyline too! The room was large and cleaned up everyday, the airy bathroom with a comfortable tube and always changed cloths. The breakfast was really good and various, and the desk's people very kind! The location is ideal in order to move easy in Manhattan, just a block from Times Square, with all the metropolitan's line. If you want a truly comfortable place to a reasonable price, this is the perfect hotel! I definitively recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: projectbil
Reviews.Content: For the money this is the business The location 1/2 block from Times Square is where you want to be Whilst the rooms are small everytning else is excellent even down to the breakfast The 3 Open Top Bus Tours from Times Sq for $49 over 2 days is a great way to see the city

Reviews.Title: “You know how to take the reservation, but not how to hold the reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Long review, but worth reading before you make your reservation... Back in April (2 1/2 months before our arrival date), we reserved two double rooms at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 3 adults and 3 children (reserved on ChoiceHotels). When we arrived at the hotel in July, we were told that there were no double rooms available because the hotel was undergoing renovations. (We didn't see any signs of renovations during our stay.) The front desk clerk offered to put us into two rooms, each with one Queen bed and a cot. We said this would be OK, but only if we were charged the rate that was advertised the previous evening on ChoiceHotels for this room type and date ($55 less per room than the rate we were quoted for our double rooms). He said he could only offer us a 10% discount ($14 less per room). He offered to walk us down the street to another hotel if we didn't want these rooms. We said this was unacceptable since we had to get ready to go see a show in a couple of hours. We then called Choice Hotels Customer Service (CHCS) using the front desk phone. I told the CHCS clerk about what had happened. He asked me if the hotel had offered to pay for our rooms at the other hotel. I told him that they hadn't. He then put my call on hold and contacted the hotel to get more information. The office manager told him that they had one double room available and that they had told us this. When the CHCS clerk came back to my call, he told me this and I informed him that this was not true. I told him I was fine with having only one double room, but only if the single room was at the same discounted rate as listed on the web site the previous evening. He put me on hold and contacted the hotel again and discussed this with the office manager. She spoke loudly and sounded very agitated. After their call, my call with the CHCS clerk was cut off. The office manager said it didn't matter, since the CHCS clerk would just tell me that there was only one double room available and the other room would be only $14 less. Again, I said this was unacceptable and asked her to reconnect me to CHCS. She then told me that they had two double rooms available. She said that we would need to pay $12 extra per person though. We said that we would not pay any extra charges than those on the printed copy of our reservation. She did not seem happy this response, but proceeded to check us in. She said something like "I thought you would have been more understanding, but I guess you don't want to work with me". I thought it was very unprofessional for an office manager to behave this way while other customers were in the lobby, overhearing this entire fiasco. Because our check-in process was so disastrous (about 20 minutes), none of us enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We would definitely warn others not to stay at this hotel, based on our experience, plus other reviews we've read since then. Make sure to check out other reviews with low ratings. Several of them describe very similar stories. There are several other nice hotels in the same area and price range, so make sure to choose your hotel wisely. When we filed a formal complaint with CHCS, we were told that someone in upper management of the hotel would contact us within 7 days. It has been 2 weeks now and we still haven't received a call from anyone at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Recommend to eveyone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the comfort inn midtown, with my boyfriend. Being students we didn't have a great deal to spend on a hotel so we thought that the Comfort Inn sounded reasonable. I wasn't sure what to expect, but as we entered our room we were really pleased with what we saw. The room was sparkling and was cleaned everyday. The staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough to help. The situation of the hotel couldn't be better. Just a stones throw from Times Square, Empire State Building, Macy's and 5th Avenue all within short walking distance. Once we left I realised I had left my wash bag at the hotel, full of brand new and unused Clinique products and MAC makeup, which I never thought I would see again. The next day my cousin went to the hotel on my behalf to enquire about my bag, to our surprise had been handed in by the maid, containing the full contents. This alone is a reason to stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. It really put the icing on the cake for my boyfriend and I and made our trip to the city a happy memory.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel for the value and service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the front desk female attendant in the evening was talking on the phone with her friend while checking me into a room, the rest of the staff were very friendly particular the bell men. They were very helpful. In addition the maid and housekeeping were also attentive. The value of the room was also impressive. Marble bathroom floors, decorative furniture, right price, excellent locationa and a friendly staff...what else could you ask for. I will come back again to stay in this fine Hotel.A+++++++++

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: gemini37
Reviews.Content: My stay was for 2 nights--17th/18th March 2005. My room was clean with two single beds--booking was only for one person. Check in was quick, and a room was ready--even at 11 AM. The location is GREAT--so close to everywhere. The "homely" little breakfast room--just off the lobby--was nice, with plenty of everything, to start your day off well. If, this Australian traveller--ever gets back to New York City, again. I would NOT hesitate to book at the Comfort Inn, again. D.T. Brisbane Australia

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: TwoDRs
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay here. I chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site and write-ups in a couple of travel books. Everyone's comments proved to be very accurate. The hotel is 1/2 block east of Times Square directly across the street from the very hip looking Muse Hotel. The street is quiet and we did not have any problems with security. In short, the location can't be beat. Great access to several subway stations gets you wherever you want to go in minutes, theater district is just a few blocks away, Radio City right around the corner, MOMA a couple of blocks past that. Many restaurants are within walking distance. You could walk to Grand Central if you weren't lugging bags. The hotel is very clean, the staff quite pleasant. The wi-fi worked perfectly. Breakfast is included, served in a small room off the lobby, and it is simple (bagels, doughnuts, dry cereals, fruit), but plenty to get you on your way in the morning. This is a small homey-type hotel, the photos on the web site make it look larger than it is. There is a small sitting area and window seat in the lobby, the front desk, a small exercise room, computer room and meeting room. The lobby is very clean and nicely renovated. I believe there are only 8 guest floors, with maybe 12 or so rooms on each floor. There is only one elevator, but we did not experience the excessively long waits that other reviewers have described. Our room was on the 5th floor, and it was an easy walk to take the stairs instead if we wanted. The room itself was quite small, maybe 10x12 feet? with a Queen bed, nightstand, small desk, small armoire with TV. The view out the window was of the brick wall of the next building, it would probably be nicer to choose one of the front rooms if you can. Each room has a window-mounted A/C unit - and this was our biggest complaint, it was very loud when on hi speed, somewhat less noisy when on its lowest setting. The bathroom was relatively large considering the bedroom size, and very nice, tiled all around with a pedestal sink, toilet, tub/shower. The towels are rather thin. Soap and shampoo/conditioner combo are provided, other than that, you'll need to bring your own toiletries. At the end of our stay, we checked out in the morning and checked our bags with the doorman until we were ready to leave later in the afternoon. When we returned to collect the bags, one of the people at the front desk called to me and told me I had left something in my room. I was very pleasantly surprised that she knew me by sight and room number as she handed my camera charger to me. I am normally a more luxury-oriented traveler, so I was concerned about choosing a "value" hotel. If you're the same way, but are willing to forego some of the amenities, this is a great choice. When it came right down to it, we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The breakfast was a nice bonus, the location was fantastic and you can't beat the price -- we were able to happily spend our money instead on fun things like show tickets, etc. -- all in all, it worked great for us. P.S. If you are a AAA member, show your card when you check in. We were given $10 additional off the rate I had already booked with a AAA discount.

Reviews.Title: “Fit all of our needs for a NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 7 nights in June based on tripadvisor and couldn't be more pleased that we did. We were a little concerned that an inexpensive Manhattan hotel ($143 plus tax) might not be clean or well maintained but our concerns were swept away. The bathroom was spacious and modernized with a great shower/tub with good pressure, tile floors, upgraded faucets, hair dryer, and cleaned immaculately every day with fresh towels, soap, etc. The queen bed was comfortable, sheets changed daily, had a large TV but no time to watch, and an effective air conditioner. Large walkin closet and ample drawers. Small quibble-only one side of bed had a reading lamp. Window looked out onto a wall which was OK because who goes to NY to look out hotel window? Advantage as it also meant very quiet. I am a light sleeper but had no trouble having full night's sleep every night. Included breakfast featured bagels, donuts, two cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, two juices, toast, coffee, tea and even machine brewed espresso. This saved time and money finding a breakfast restaurant in expensive NYC. I thought I would use the small exercise room (treadmills, exercise bicycle), but because of the central location, we walked most places and didn't need the extra exercise. Highly recommended for budget travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TamnDave
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a week in June after reading other reviews on this site. It was exactly as we expected, and we were very satisfied. Not the Ritz, but who wants to pay for that when you're out sightseeing all day anyway? Would stay there again. Pros: -Perfect Location (close to: Times Sq., theatre dist, Rockefeller Ctr, metro stops) -Comfortable rooms (small, but adequate) -Very clean -Great customer service -Free continental breakfast was very good -Did I mention the location? Cons: (If you can call them that, they were *not* a big deal) -No onsite bar or restaurant (Lounge at hotel across the street is cool) -Slow elevator (So, take the stairs) -A/C a bit loud (At least there is air conditioning!) -No view (Only in the room at night to sleep anyway)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can easily rate the Comfort Inn as excellent on all fronts, however I know there is another level of Hotels in NYC, so I will stop at 4 stars. If the prices are in your budget, stay there. Service was great, the people were really nice. We arrived at 11:00 and got the room straight away, which was small, but very comfortable with a great bathroom (room 600). They helped with directions and some bandaids when we needed them. When we left they let us stay until 13:15 as our flights were not 'till 15:00. Works for me. You will be 1 block from Time Square and right in the middle of Manhatten so if you want to get uptown or downtown, you are half way there. If you need a good cheap lunch, turn left out of the hotel and it is five or six down on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverBoston
Reviews.Content: What a find! In researching a hotel for a group attending a conference in Times Square, it was my mission to get the "best bang for the buck". I went directly to tripadvisor & locked into the Comfort Inn Midtown immediately. The location is excellent (1/2 block out of Times Square), the rooms are small...but spotless. The bedding was great, the bathroom was clean and well kept, and the noise (except for the air conditioner) was minimal. Breakfast room was clean, well stocked and had a nice variety of goodies. Listen, for $150/night in NYC - this hotel is a gem!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps away from all the action of Time Square. To my convience this hotel is two blocks from the Belasco Theater. I paid about $179.00 a night, which is a wonderful deal for Midtown. The hotel rooms are very clean. The rooms are also very small; the rooms are big enough to fit a queen size bed, a nice size entertainment system, and a table with chair. Each room has a private bathroom with shower and tub. The room also had a head dryer, coffe maker, air, iron and ironing board; which is great for those that like to pack lite. There's nine floors to this hotel with only one elevator. I didn't fid this to be a problem at all, because the hotel is pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MAGS1960
Reviews.Content: Myself and 25year old son stayed at the comfort Inn on Jan 2005 for six nights. This hotel was excellent its in a great location just a short walk on to Times Square and handy for site seeing in New York. I asked for a queit room which l got no view looking onto a gable wall but l didnt care as long as you got a nights sleep and it was a queit room. Very clean and towels changed every day. Breakfast was a bonus too which was a good start to the day. Reasonablly priced for New York hotels. Would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: calidude
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for 5 days in June. I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site and I'm happy that I did. This hotel is the best kept secret in Manhattan. The location is perfect as it's on a side street away from the hustle & bustle of Times Square but close enough and within walking distance to everything. If you're traveling alone or with a partner this is a great hotel to stay. However, if you're traveling with children or large groups I would recommend staying at a hotel with much bigger rooms as the rooms are small here and they do not offer rollaways. The front desk staff were courteous and friendly and the bellman was terrific. Although there is only one elevator I never had to wait long. My room had a queen size bed and bath/shower so I must have lucked out and got one of the bigger rooms. The room was always neat and tidy. Although breakfast is offered between 7-10 if you miss it there are plenty of eateries close to the hotel. If you're arriving from JFK I would recommend taking one of the shuttles to the hotel this way you can see a little of NY and will only cost $17 instead of the $45 for a taxicab ride. Also, when I left for the airport I used the car service that the hotel provides. For about the same amount of money to take a cab I opted for the ride to JFK in a nice A/C luxury vehicle and it was worth every cent. Just ask the bellman or the front desk and they will set it up for you. I have to say my stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown was the best and I would highly recommend this to family and friends. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor is right on the money!”
Reviews.Author: Juna
Reviews.Content: Read reviews here before choosing Comfort Inn Midtown, and I am glad I did! We had a wonderful stay! The location and price cannot be beat! It is right across from the Muse Hotel, which I understand is pricier! Room we had was nice, clean and quiet. Room was smaller and narrower than what I'm accustomed to...so were the hallways and stairway, but I was mentally prepared for that. All the staff were very friendly....who said New Yorkers were rude? You are right on W46th which is called Little Brazil...and on the other side of Broadway, it's Restaurant Row! W 47th is Diamond Row, and all the theaters are all within nice walking distance. You can also walk to 5th Avenue from here and shop till you drop, and have access to other major tourist attractions (Grand Central station, Rockefeller center, etc.) You are also next to a church...and those church bells in the morning are actually quite comforting! Check out the little Cuban restaurant across the street! Oh, and there's a manicure/pedicure place a couple of doors down for a quick makeover before a show. Don't expect wide open spaces, swimming pools, etc. This is a nice place to come home to after a full day of exploring NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelcj
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Comfort Inn (June 4-11) and I was very pleased. The hotel is clean, staff members are friendly and helpful, free high-speed internet is provided in the lobby, and the continental breakfast was excellent and food plentiful. In addition, the hotel is conveniently located about 1/2 block from Times Square. The room was rather small and plain, but very clean and well-maintained. I have stayed in "budget" hotels before in New York, and this one has been, by far, the best. For $139/night, I cannot think of a better bargain for your dollar. I will definitely stay at this hotel again the next time I am in New York.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending weeks on this site searching for good hotels for my first visit to NYC, I chose the Comfort Inn Midtown. I stayed here on 5/31 through 6/2. Yeah it's small, but it's quaint and cozy with Times Square just footsteps away. The room was very clean with no blemishes on the towels, carpeting or room/bathroom fixtures. I had a great time here and will definitely stay here again for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job!”
Reviews.Author: KenBarns
Reviews.Content: When travelling on a budget, particularly to somewhere like Manhattan, it is very easy to find most of your precious dollars swallowed up by accommodation. By staying at the Comfort Inn, my wife and I had more money in our pocket to go out and enjoy the city - which after all, is what it is all about! Our 7-night stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown in May, while having no outstanding features, was comfortable and trouble-free; in other words, it did the job we wanted of it, and it did it admirably! Our expectations of the hotel - and our reasons for choosing it - were based on the reviews here. I guess we expected something a little run-down (but not too much), somewhat noisy at the front, perhaps occasional problems with the cleanliness of the bathrooms or linen. A few reviews suggested that some people found staff to be a little unfriendly or brusque, and that the breakfast provided "ran out" if you weren't there early enough. So we figured that at worst the hotel may be a little unpleasant, but for $130 a night we could live with that. It was a pleasant surprise then, when even our minor apprehensions were proven to be dead wrong. The room was clean and seemed quite new. Despite the fact that we had a 5th floor room at the front (after a check-in request for "something quieter" than the 2nd floor room at the front we were booked in to), we slept soundly through each night without any problems. The towels and bathroom were clean and fresh each day. The breakfast, while a little bland by the 7th morning, was plentiful (though glazed doughnuts for breakfast?!) And most importantly, the staff were out-going and helpful at all times. Best Points: * THE PRICE! * The location - although given the efficiency of the subway, next time I'd be tempted to take an even-cheaper outer boroughs hotel that was next to a subway station. * Room size was much larger than expected - a good 80cm on either side of the queen bed, and at least 1.5m between the foot of the bed and the TV cabinet. * Free internet access - a nice bonus. * Free newspapers at breakfast (if early enough) Not so good points: * No fridge in the room - I guess we assumed there would be one, and had plans to get groceries for lunch and some of our dinners. A fridge can be arranged, but costs an extra $10 per night. No thanks: we ate out. * Slow lift - unless the lift was already at our floor, the only time we waited for it was for luggage. When going down 4 floors, the steps were often faster than the lift. * Toilet often required a couple of flushes, and even blocked once; but was promptly fixed after we asked at reception. But really, these are minor quibbles. None of them produced more than transitory annoyances. For where it was (and compared to the reviews of other Manhattan hotels in the price range), the Comfort Inn Midtown was wonderful. The bottom line: would I stay there again? As I mentioned earlier, better-than-expected public transport would have us looking a little further out next time; but if we stay in Manhattan in future (even when we have a little more to spend) we will be staying at the Comfort Inn Midtown!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Cruiserfish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Comfort Inn, Midtown in New York City from May 16 through May 20, 2005. Although the hotel is very small, it was very neat and clean. The lobby was decorated beautifully, and the staff was very, very nice and accomodating. A short walk to the corner landed us right in the middle of Times Square which was in our opinion the right place to be to catch our tour busses, etc. I would recommend the Comfort Inn, Midtown to travelers who don't want to spend hundreds of dollars per day on a hotel room. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan of the comfort inn midtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends and I went to New York City for a shopping getaway. We wanted to stay close to Times Square and not pay too much, so we chose the comfort inn. Location was good. However, when we arrived, they had booked us with only 2 people, instead of 3, and informed us that there were only single/full size beds available and that they have no roll-away-beds! So, one of us had to sleep on the hard-as-a-rock floor in a tiny little room. We were informed that we would get extra blankets for the person sleeping on the floor, although we only received 2 extra (not enough to make the foor even somewhat comfortable!) Also, there is only one tiny elevator in the whole hotel making it somewhat difficult and long to get up or down, as sometimes you had to wait for several trips before you could get on the elevator. On a good note, the continental breakfast was great. As we were leaving to go back to the airport, we asked the concierge to call us a taxi, as we were waiting in the lobby, they told us our cab was "here" as they literally pushed us out the street and made us walk up to times square with our suit cases to hail a cab ourselves! It was very rude. Not sure I'll be back to the comfort inn on my next stay in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and clean!”
Reviews.Author: madelynium
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in May and was very pleased with the results and am glad that I trusted the reviews on this site. Everything was great... location, cleanliness, staff, continental breakfast and for a great AAA price that you can't beat. If you are not looking for anything fancy and just want a clean, decent place to sleep and shower... this is your place. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ...beware if you are claiming AAA discount”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second I have stayed here - this time for 4 nights. The location is great and the rooms are tidy and clean. Just beware if you are claiming the AAA discount. I am a NRMA member and was entitled to the AAA discount and they refused to honour it despite numerous calls and faxes from NRMA and AAA. In the end we gave up despite having to pay an extra $160 US.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn was comfortable! We were not particularly sure about cleanliness in the lobby when we spotted a cockroach. It may have been a one off having come in from outside. The room felt clean enough but needed a bit of renovation. Also, there were steps up from outside which was really frustrating when arriving tired with threee heavy bags. There was no doorman around to help. Also the hotel is not particularly close to a subway station. We never had breakfast but noticed it was very busy - probably a good sign. Free internet access was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: newmexicolady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days in May and we would definately stay here again. The entrance is very modest, but the lobby was elegant. Our room was tiny, but in the rear of the building, so very quiet. You would never know you were one block from Times Square. Since our window faced a brick wall, we had to call our friends to actually find out what the weather was for the day. But who cares, we weren't in NY to stay in our room. Everything was immaculately clean, nothing was in disrepair, the bathroom had a tub and great shower. Breakfast donuts weighed a pound a piece, delicious and free. Everyone was friendly and the price was just right.We never did figure out the radiator heating system, but it wasn't cold, so it didn't matter. All in all, we were very happy with the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable At Comfort Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: ARKSugarLand
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this hotel was. Excellent location and a staff better than many found at pricier sites. Breakfast buffet was fresh-room was immaculate--and I had a tub-so what more do I need?! A few steps to the right and you are in Times Square-go to the left about a block down and 46th street becomes known as Brasil Row-fabulous restaurants-then walk a little further and you are on 5th avenue. I was never scared and as a female travelling alone in NYC-that is no small thing. The hotel stowed my bags and arranged for my ride to LGA in the late afternoon-effortless and I was able to squeeze in some last minute shopping. Don't pass up this gem whether on business or pleasure-your company will be glad you saved them $$ and if it is on your nickel-you will have more for shopping and EATING!@

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: katy2d2
Reviews.Content: For the money this place can't be beat. It is far from perfect but it is clean and very convenient. The staff is friendly and the breakfast adequate (and free). They provide free internet access (if you can hook up). They have DSL, but it's so slow that in 6 days we were only able to access our email twice! It just times out before connecting, and unless you have a lot of time, it's worthless. The rooms are rather small and the bathroom was really dark - could have used some higher intensity lights. It's hard to do make up in a dark bathroom, believe me, I have stayed in a lot worse for a lot more! Can't complain for the price ($125.00 mid week) we didn't spend much time in the room anyway - I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico Location”
Reviews.Author: karen1979
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 11th Nov for 5 nights, i was in NY for a birthday treat with my mother, and after a lot of consideration we chose this hotel. I could not fault it on anything, the rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and the buffet breakfast was fab. Yes the room did get a bit overcrowded, but when you consider what a rare thing it is to get breakfast included in New York, is it that surprising?? Yes the rooms were smaller than average, but its New York, why would you be in your room for long enough for the size to bother you?? All in all i would stay here again without a doubt, and i would not hesitate to reccommend it to anyone - i thought it was fantastic, and the location could not have been more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked trip advisor before booking this hotel for a week in the city. Really glad I did as the reviews are so honest and accurate. When we arrived we were told we would be in a front room and these rooms were generally quite noisy. We were offered another room straight away if we wanted or we could try it out and change the following day if we prefered. We took the 2nd option and yes, you could hear the noise from the street (even at 4am) but we thought the room itself was such a great size we were reluctant to move. I guess, we must be sound sleepers because the noise didn't bother us at all in the end although I'm sure it could really bother others. Everything else was great. Fantastic location, very clean bedrooms and bathrooms, comfy bed, great breakfasts and free internet. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will hopefully be back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to all the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Tommie69
Reviews.Content: We fully endorse all the positive reviews on this site. A great find - great location near Times Square, clean and bright room, all staff friendly and free Internet access and breakfast. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Non-smoking/Non-smelly”
Reviews.Author: Seattleisus
Reviews.Content: We generally stay at 3 star hotels now. After reading reviews on the more expensive hotels I was not ready to spend extra money on a hotel that I was barely going to stay in. Some of the reviews on the 3 stars were actually scary. I down graded to a two star with excellent ratings. We seemed to spend a little more than most people here at $160. a night. What I really enjoyed about this hotel was that it was a non-smoking hotel. So many times even if you stay in a non-smoking room the lobby and halls of older hotels have an off odor to them. This was not noted at this hotel, I think, because of this policy. We were located in the back on the 7th floor corner room. Did not notice any noise except when it rained one night it came down onto the air condition unit and was kind of loud. Not unbearable. The couch in the lobby was tattered. I think it was an antique. I wasn't sure what I would find in the rooms but found everything said on this forum to be true. Clean rooms. Clean white towels. Maid service everyday. Family used the breakfast room and was satisfied until lunch came. We were out of our rooms by 9 am every morning and back shortly after dinner to get ready to go out again for the evening. Everything was always put back together after our rush of showers. We had a room that had the bathroom tiled. It was a small 3 inch step that all of us tripped over a couple of times. Bathroom was clean, no mold visible and new soap put out everyday. Rooms weren't especially pretty, but location was great. Would stay here again. My sixteen year old could watch all the TV he wanted and they seemed to have the sports channels for games available. I used the down stairs computer to print out our boarding passes the night before we left. Also, the morning of I checked our flight to make sure it was on time. Some hotels will charge for this service at this hotel it was free. Could have checked our email as it never seemed to be occupied. But hey we were on vacation and all could wait for our return.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights the first week of April. Be careful of the prices they charge! When I made my reservation, I was quoted a price and then when I arrived they charged me $15 a night more because they claimed my discount was no good! After taxes, I ended up paying an extra $75 for the three nights. My room was on the 4th floor. It was tiny but clean when I arrived. The second day I was given towels with make-up on them. It was also noisy. I never had a good night's sleep. You can hear doors slamming all over and also personal hygiene noises from other rooms. The doorman was the only friendly staff member I encountered. I never ate the breakfast so I can't comment on that area. Elevators ran fine---I never had an issue with them---and location is nice. I don't need a fancy or upscale hotel, but I do like cleanliness and quiet. All in all----if you don't care about prices, room size and cleaniness---it would be a good place to stay. If you want to know you'll be charged the correct price, and that your towels will actually be clean---stay somewhere else. I will never stay here again, would never recommend the place, and have informed my company to not recommend it to other employees when they come to town.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: G.Wolf
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed here for St. Patricks day just....great stay....nice folks all around and helpful....nice clean rooms, decent continental buffet...Location, Location, Location: we walked to Lion King and Phantom Of The Opera, the parade, St.Patricks, Grand Central Station, most everything...we all agreed we'd stay here next time...even the legendary elevator seemed quite quick enough, thanks!!...And Thanks to Trip Advisor for the tip!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel very much (in NEW YORK) It was very clean and the people were very lovely and warm We enjoyed it very much Thanks a lot

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say a Bad Thing”
Reviews.Author: Maxxwell8
Reviews.Content: Well I feel that I owe this hotel and site a review since it was my main source of info on the hotel before my trip. I booked this hotel 3 months ago for a 3 night stay (march 17-20). I got a rate of $107 a night with AAA. I constantly looked at the site for new reviews to see how this hotel measured up as I thought at $107 a night, how nice could it really be. But after reading consistent good reviews, I decided to give it a shot. And let me say that I am glad that I did. My mother and I went to NYC and just wanted a place that was clean and in a safe neighborhood. We wanted something centrally located and this hotel couldn't have been in a better location. Just yards away from the heart of Times Square and located near theaters and subways, it couldn't have been better. I requested a room with 2 twin beds and on a corner since I heard they were bigger. I was told that they didn't have corner rooms with twin beds, but when we checked in our room seemed significantly bigger than the other rooms on our floor. We were in room 307 which was in the back side of the building. It was a bit hot in the room and we didn't want the heat on or that noisy ac unit, so we opened the window a crack which let in a cool breeze. Let me say that it was like we were in the country. No noise whatsoever...you would never imagine we were only yards from Times Square. The room was kept clean and tidy during our 3 days and everyone was super friendly, especially the breakfast man. (Don't forget to bring some money to tip him). We were lucky and got a table each morning for breakfast, but it seemed to be quite full at the busier times in the morning. There is only one elevator..the only problem I see. But being on the 3rd floor we often walked down the stairs which weren't too bad. All in all this hotel was great and I would definatley recommend it to anyone who is looking to be in the heart of the city, have a clean room, breakfast included and save the money on a room you are never in for the finer things NYC has to offer. Thank you Trip Advisor....may this review help someone else make an informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “Take earplugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cocopops
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the Comfort Inn Midtown - I stayed there from 9th March - 16th March 05. Its a good hotel, clean and comfy beds. Goo breakfast, bagels, doughuts, toast, bananas, yoghurts, OJ etc and the man who looks after the breakfast room is so helpful, so dont forget to tip him! If you are unfortunute enough to get a room at the front, allthough it may be roomy, you will need earplugs.The noise at night is horrendous horrendous horrendous. At times I was woken in the night terrified of this loud thunderous noise! But this is also because the hotel is on Times Square which is a NY version of Leister Sqaure - tacky busy and awful. Avoid at all cost Bubb gump Shrimp on Times Square, the service is the worst, the food is in edible and you cant see out the windows for the dirt. A must however is a drink at the Marriot Marquis. The bar/restaurant "The View" is on the 48th Floor and the views are fantatsic. Do not have dinner here though. Its a buffet with the smallest plates and apalling service. The best restaurant is opposite the comfort inn called Le Tre Veneizie. Its the best Italian with excellent customer service - a very rare thing in NY. Sights: Empire State: A busy gift shop with a view. Huge let down. Sky ride: Dont do it. Statue of Liberty: Worth a look Central Park: Wonderful if sunny, the Zoo is brilliant, avoid the horse drawn ride, you get 20 mins around the front bit of park for $40, disapointing. Pier 17 & South Street Sea Port: Stop and a have some clam chowder. Brooklyn bridge: A walk with a view - brilliant. New York public Library: Good for 10 mins to kill. Grand central: Loved it. A good affordable place for lunch. Macys: Busy and hot but good bargians: Go to the Visitor counter, show a passport and you get a card giving 11% everything in the store including sale items. For dinner get a cab to Greenwich Village or Little Italy. Overall, New York is an okay place to go for a trip but i would not go back. If you want to go somewhere for a romantic break and eat good food Do Not Go Here. Its a lot of money for an American version of London but without the culture.

Reviews.Title: “The Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this motel in Times Square. The value and location are terrific for NYC. The staff was again, very helpful and pleasant. The room, though small, was fine. Clean w/ the amenities of pricier motels. I still give it an Above Average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay, plain and simple! My girlfriend and I just got back from a 5-night vacation in New York City, and we had stayed at this location. We went there because of price and the positive reviews on this site. I knew that I wanted to minimize my costs in NY while staying at a decent hotel, so this place fit the bill. So, let's get on with this review, and I'll try to detail it as well as possible, since I just got back from there today (it's still fresh in my mind). The lobby area is elegant enough. Nice marble floors give way to the concierge and the dining room, which is used for the abundant breakfast items (nothing fancy, but there are bagels, doughnuts, apples, bananas, various cereals, strawberry yoghurt, and coffee... I'm not sure if I'm missing anything, since I ate there 2 of the 5 nights there only...) There is a small exercise room up the hall a bit, with a treadmill, a bicycle machine, and I believe a stairmaster. Overall, good lobby amenities. Nothing out of the ordinary, but what is there, it's done well. We stayed on the second floor in the back. The view was nothing to write home about, simply facing a brick wall. Beware, as very little light comes through the black-out curtains and the brick walls. We wanted to wake up early and go sight-seeing, but since no real amounts of light made it into the room, we had a hard time getting up, since we were so comfortable and lazy in our cozy bed. Of course, that does ensure that you get a good night's rest, as there is very little noise and light that comes into your room! The room ameneties are excellent for what they are. Quite a large, decent TV, with about 35 channels. A comfortable, queen-size bed. A nice chair and table. Drawers. A beautiful painting hung over the bed. Just little things that you can find in every hotel, and done well here as well. The furniture, as far as I can tell however, was not run down or did not seem that it would break in an instant, a good sign. The bathroom was excellent, having a shower stall and a modern-looking basin. There is a hair dryer in there as well. Water from the shower was good, cold and hot, and the pressure was good. The rooms were kept spotless, which I was thankful for. Clean towels every day. Clean sheets every day. Amenities replaced as needed, such as new soap bars. Vacuumed every day. It was wonderful, because I cannot live without cleanliness. I've heard horror stories about some other hotels, and I'm glad this isn't one of them. The cleaning lady was one of the sweetest lady I've ever met. You'll know her when you see her. She is so sweet, in that little accent of hers, telling us when our room would be ready again, and always greeting us warmly whenever she saw us. This was a nice touch, especially when you meet lots of people in the city who are too rushed or care too little for niceties. This warmthness also extended to some of the staff members, but she was definitely the person that stuck out in my head. Oh, and so is the guy who encourages you to eat breakfast heartily. He just keeps encouraging to take food! He was also a nice guy. Staff at the front were friendly and helpful for the one time I asked for help, and that was how to take the subway to get to the airport. So I can't really comment on that. They seemed generally friendly though, always ready to answer questions that you had. Overall, a great value hotel. Clean rooms are important to me, and this had them. Oh yes, and there was plenty of space to move freely around the room. It's not a big room, but it's a big-enough room to be comfortable enough. I loved it here, and will most definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, do not hesitate to book if you're budgeting!”
Reviews.Author: FoolsGold1981
Reviews.Content: I used this website for guidance before booking the hotel, so I feel that it's only fair to post my opinions here! Simple as this: If you're doing New York on a low to mid-size budget, you simply cannot go wrong with this hotel. The location is perfect - a 20 yard stroll and you're in Times Square. It's in a great position for all of the main attractions (Empire State, Guggenheim, Central Park and all the main shopping districts are within 10 minutes walk) and conveniently placed for the subway to other areas. There's an excellent choice of Deli's and restaraunts around the hotel (Check out the Guinness in the Irish bar next door!) As for the hotel....well, It's pretty good, even aside from the location. Yes, the rooms are small. But what do you expect for $99 per night - a butler?! The bed was very comfortable, the shower was hot and it was clean, tidy and pleasant. Internet access was free downstairs and there was a small selection of exercise machines downstairs (No-one mentioned this!!!) The breakfast is a big bonus. There are doughnuts, bagels, rolls, fruit, yogurt, cereals and tea\coffee, apple and orange juice. I don't know what people are complaining about - there's loads, I found the service friendly and it was the perfect way to start the day. Not many New York hotels offer breakfast, it's a real benefit. Staff are friendly, helpful and polite. We were able to check in an hour early, and they kept our bags for us on the day we checked out. Look, there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. If you want the lap of luxury - sure, there's much better hotels. But you will pay for them - and how!!! For the price, this is perfect, you will not go wrong. I scoured every review on here before I booked, and was naturally suspicious of all the praise being heaped on what was a very cheap hotel. There is no need to be. Everything people say is true, and you cannot go wrong with this place if you are budgeting!!!! Save $100 per night and spend it on shopping!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room was superb, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: gbturner1975
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in July and watched the tripadvisor reviews constantly until we arrived. We stayed six nights, Feb 11-16th. This hotel was everything the reviews stated. Room was clean, spacious since we had a corner room. The view outside the window was not so exciting but who cares, we were seldom in our room. The bathroom was spacious for two and always clean towels, fresh soap, etc. Internet worked fine, no problems there. Television was great. The heat was somewhat warm but all you had to do was turn down the radiator. Desk staff were great. Rojo always had a smile and was willing to help. We never ate the continental breakfast, the tables were always full and we didn't want to wait around. So can't comment on that. Talk about close to Times Square, you couldn't ask for anything closer or more convenient. If we ever get the opportunity to go to NYC again, we'll stay at this hotel. We went into the Plaza Suite and didn't feel near as welcome as this hotel. Thanks tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Budget Conscience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for our first trip to New York. Perfect location near Times Square and Subways. Clean rooms and plenty big... although we had a corner room which I read were bigger. Shower had great water pressure, and we never had problems with our heat, like other reviewers had mentioned. The free breakfast was great... bagels, doughnuts, apples, bananas, cereal, coffee, juice... I would definitely stay here again... You can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my daugther stayed here for four nights in February, and I must say this was a perfect choice. Not only for the location, but the hotel itself. I had read some nice reviews here on tripadvisor, so I expected it to be a good place to stay, but even so I was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the hotel is really clean and with nice furniture, colors, nicely decorated etc. Looks very fresh and I believe its renovated not so long ago. We had a corner room which is a bit larger than the others so we we're lucky. The TV was a big one and right in front of the beds. The room was on 7th floor and not facing the street, so the noice was a minimum and sleeping was excellent (nice firm beds too). The room was big enough and also the bathroom. Even in cold february the room was warm, and we just put the (noisy) a/c machine on for a few minutes every morning to get some fresh (New York...) air. The cleaningwomen and the man in the breakfast room were very friendly to us, some of the staff at the desk could be more helpful though (we had to complain a few times about the Internet not working and the reaction was barely visible...) Breakfast was great, with bagels, cereals, donuts and lots of fresh fruit. Free coffee whenever we wanted all day. All in all, I think this hotel gives great value for the money (which for us was 100 dollar per night plus taxes) with of course unbeatable location really close to Times Square. I really can recommend this hotel to anyone coming to New York. I have stayed in other hotels in New York but this was by far the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel, while small, gives an european air upon arrival. We got there at 10 a.m. and just expected to leave our luggage since check in time was not til 3pm. they gave us a room right away. the staff was so friendly. the room was small but clean. the bed and pillows were outstanding. we had to turn on the a/c the room was so warm but it also helped drown out any noise from below. the location was the best. right outside was times square. we forgot our cord for the high speed interntet access and they loaned up one. the breakfast was more than adequate. this hotel is a find in nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value.....great price.....excellent location”
Reviews.Author: drr49
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here based on Trip Advisor reviews, which proved to be quite accurate. The location is outstanding. You can't get any closer to all the great sights in NYC. The rooms are small, which is to be expected, but nicely furnished and extremely clean. I don't normally check for cleanliness if everything looks OK, but I lost the remote for the TV somewhere in the room, so I searched everywhere before finding it under the nightstand....the rooms are very, very clean. As previously posted, there is a sticker on the window saying not to open it. Well, I like fresh air, so I gave it a try, and it would fully open. I asked at the front desk about the sticker, and was told it is because pigeons tend to fly into the rooms with open windows, as there is no screening. About 99% of what has been written in other reviews is accurate...the breakfast, doors closing, etc. I will add that I was on the 7th floor, west side, which is right next to a church. For whatever reason, the church bells would go off during the day at strange times. Not as if it was an hourly event, but I could never understand why the bells were ringing....it was not a function of time. Perhaps church services or something, but never a problem. It is a 15 minute walk to the hotel from the airport express bus drop at Grand Central Station (the best way to get in from LGA or JFK). I would most definitely stay there again. Great price, great location, quality room, free wi-fi, free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A gem I'm glad I found”
Reviews.Author: Peter6
Reviews.Content: My first time at this hotel but it won't be the last. The satff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, comfortable and warm with a great bathroom fitted with a super shower. The noise insulation of the next room's plumbing could be improved and there was no view out of the window - but who goes to New York to sit in the hotel room and look at the view! There is only one lift which meant a short wait sometimes. The complimentary breakfast was first class and plenty of it. The hotel's location on 46th Street location couldn't be better - Times square and subway station at the end of the street, less than a minute's walk away. Restaurants aboud in the area. Value for money, this hotel can't be beaten and I'll certainly be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn, great price...which counts for a lot.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights this week just past. They allowed us an early check-in and the attendent was extrememly pleasant...we even got a smile despite what some other reviewers have written! The room was okay...nothing spectacular, but then what should we have been expecting?! The heating was terrible! Absolutely terrible! We had to get an employee to bring in a space heater for us which helped but was an eyesore and nuisance for the feet given the size of the room. We were at the front on the 3rd floor and were warned that it would be noisy...we had no trouble sleeping at all. The breakfast consisted of some not so fresh bread (may as well have been a brick), donuts and powdery fruit. But hey, it was free! Go elsewhere for breakfast, it's worth the investment. The location was awesome. The hotel is a stones throw from Times Square, the half price ticket booth, subway and Broadway. We probably will invest in a higher grade hotel next time. But if you are on a budget, this is a pretty sizable bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Tonyrich
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel, stayed for 4 nights. We were lucky enough to get a corner room which was bigger than the others. Room was very comfortable, was like being in your own bedroom at home. Bathroom very clean also. Breakfast was more than adequate and we had no fault with any of the staff. But the thing that really sells this hotel is Location Location Location!!! Times Square it virtually on it's door step, with 5th Avenue and Rockerfeller Centre and Radio City a few blocks away. I would not recommend the TFI Fridays on the corner of Times Square but can highly recommend the Europa Cafe (at the door of the hotel, take a left and it's at the end of the street). It does great burritos and juices. The information centre in Times Square also sells reduced price theatre tickets if you don't want to queue at the TKTS booth. All in all can highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but with compromises”
Reviews.Author: steddiaz
Reviews.Content: The location is superb. The rooms are clean, and spacious for NYC standards. I went with a group of 10, and everybody had issues with the temperature control in the rooms. We had a VERY noise a/c unit, that woke us up several times during the night. Others couldn't cool their room enough, another couple could not get any fresh air. Our room on the 7th floor was quiet (except for the a/c); no noise from the street. The breakfast was terrific, with yogurt, bagels,cereal and good coffee. We would stay here again, with some Tylenol PM....

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: stefanovas
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown: Positives: Location (couple blocks from Times Square), clean, nice bathroom, continental breakfast included, excellent value for the price (AAA discount 89 + tax). One computer available for free internet usage on main floor. Negatives: our room’s view was a wall and you couldn’t open the window (there was a sticker on the window that said: “please don’t open the window, if you need assistance call the front desk”).The idea of lack of fresh air was unpleasant. The front desk staff may need a little training in how to smile, a very good exception was the man who helped at the breakfast, always polite and kind. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of great reviews on Tripadvisor. Location of hotel is excellent, just round the corner from Times Square. The quality of accommodation was below average and extremely overpriced for the sub-standard rooms and amenities offered. Was kept awake for 3 nights by a constant noise from the hot water tank which seemed to be shared by everyone on my floor and produced a loud gurgling noise whenever anyone in another room turned on their water supply. Also, it was advertised that there were tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms - my room had an antiquated coffee machine located in the bathroom!. Breakfast was awful and reminded me of a staff canteen with hotel staff watching my every move to check that I didn't take more than my fair share of the food. After trying this for one day, we opted to eat breakfast outside. I feel that this hotel has had over generous reviews on trip advisor and was distinctly average.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a first time”
Reviews.Author: adige
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from Dec 27- Jan 3. Our first room was room # 702 which was very small. We did not stay on New Years eve and returned to room # 704 which was much bigger. Room 702 was very small and the window did not shut. We also could not figure out how to turn on the heat. One of the desk guys came up and helped us. He put a towel in the window. Room 704 was larger but more noisy because it was in the front of the hotel. 702 - the bathroom only had a shower stall and was cleaner than 704 which had a tub. It had a little mold here and there. Nothing shower sandals did not solve. On the 1st, my husband got into a fight with the guy at the front desk about us checking in early. One thing I can say, New Yorkers don't fold easy. He held his ground and they got into a shouting match. How is that for customer service? At any rate my husband was ------ and wanted to stay someplace else but we would have been charged. Plus, the guy had already promised us a larger room. So we stayed. Basicially, we discovered that New Yorkers are a tough bunch of folks. They always seem to be scaming someone or making sure they do not get scammed. Service sucked at most of the restaurants we when to. Most of the time we were treated like they were doing us a favor to serve us. Not much communication. If you can make it there, you'll make it anywhere is true

Reviews.Title: “Go for it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown from Nov.28-Dec.2nd and were very satisfied overall. The location is AMAZING, it is very quiet in the hotel even though it is so close to the action. The breakfast was perfect for a quick start to our day. The rooms were small (max 2 people/room), but the bathroom was a nice size and was renovated nicely. Besides, if you are in NYC, you will not be spending much time in the room besides sleeping and showering. The elevator is slow but not such a big deal, an extra few minutes was nothing for the value being given by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff & Clean and tidy....Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: AndyG34
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews on here and seeing the downloadable brochure picture we were a little worried about what to expect when we got there. First of all, may I just say that the brochure picture doesn't do this hotel justice. The hotel was very clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were adequate in size considering this is New York. And it was in an ideal spot for us as it was in walking distance of Macy's and there were plenty of diners/pubs in walking distance as we fancied more of a fried breakfast as opposed to the free continental breakfast provided. Also nearby to Macy's is a multi-screen cinema called Loews screening all the big named films so we weren't short on things to do at night. As I say, we had an absolutely brilliant stay in NYC and we are hoping to go back again around the same time this year as there is so much more we wanted to see AND we'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean great location good rate”
Reviews.Author: njbnjb
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided more than we expected. The room was about 10 by 15, plenty large enough for sleeping, and was very clean. The shower was great--very hot water, great pressure. The continental breakfast had fresh donuts, bagels, and rolls, with real butter available, as well as cereals, fruit, juice, yogut, and coffee. The breakfast room has only about 8 tables and might get crowded if the hotel is very full--at least it was crowded on our last day. They ask you not to bring food back to your room--a good idea considering the challenge of keeping some creatures out of a Manhattan building. Do not expect great views: only 9 stories high and in the middle of long block, you'll not see much. Most room windows are on the side of the building. But with the money you save you can go to one of the reataurants in a fancier hotel. There was no noise from other rooms and very little from the street. There is even a small exercise room with 3 machines. Parking, at only $20 a night, was a few doors down; again, a very good price for midtown Manhattan. Room temperature was good, although the outside temperature varied from 60 to 25. There is a window air conditioner, if that would bother you in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: weamish
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location (couple blocks from Times Square), clean, nice bathroom, good lighting, continental breakfast included, excellent value for the price ($135 + $20 tax for 2 queen beds) Negatives: Small room, antiquated hot water heat (have to open the enclosure and turn the knob, no thermostat). It was very cold outside (5 degrees F), and it was cold in the room. There's a window A/C unit, and the cold air blew in thru the vents. The bellhop showed us his trick of stuffing the drapes around the window to block off the A/C vents.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference instead of at the expensive conference hotel. Room was smallish, but very clean and well-appointed. I found the staff to be very helpful and responsive. The water pressure in my shower the first morning wasn't very good -- I let them know and by the next morning, it was fixed and strong. Breakfast was more hardy than the normal continental fare. Highly recommend this for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in December. We had stayed at the Park Savoy (read my review) the four previous nights, but switched hotels for the last night (pre-planned, not because we were disappointed). Compaired to the PS, our room was immaculate and gigantic. I'm exaggerating, but the room was a decent size and the bathroom looked as if it was remodeled recently. Our only complaints were: the room was rathner warm and you cannot open the windows. We had the air conditioner on all night, but it wasn't very cool and the room stayed very warm. Our view consisted of a brick wall and other windows with air conditioners, but at least it was quiet. Finally, there is only one elevator and it was TINY. Overall, the Comfort Inn Midtown is in a great location (2 blocks from Times Square), the staff was very friendly, and the room was clean and you were able to actually move around. AAA rate after taxes was $165, which is pretty reasonable for the location. This is a great place if you are looking for a place to sleep, change and shower, not if you're looking to be pampered. I would probably look at trying a different hotel if I came back to NYC, but would definately stay here if I couldn't find something else that interested me.

Reviews.Title: “we'll never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, first let me say that we knew we'd get what we paid for as far as room size. It was extremely small, but at least it was clean. We usually stay at nice hotels but were trying to save money this time. We have learned our lesson though and will always pay more for a quality stay. Don't even think about making a complaint to the manager. Our air conditioner froze over and we had a miserable night's sleep and not only did not care or offer compensation - she made US feel stupid in front of a lobby full of people for not knowing how to "properly use a window unit." She was incredibly rude and we are currently going to the higher-ups to get this resolved. I'd pay more to stay somewhere where people actually care about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel brilliant although the front desk staff may need a little training in how to smile....but hey, that is just a little niggle! We had a room away from the street and we found this great - it was very quiet and the room was big enough and very clean. We stayed 3 nights and our room was serviced to a good standard every day. The complimentary brekkie was a bonus as well - quite basic (cereal, fruit, donuts, bagels) but sufficient. The location is superb!! Literally around the corner from Times Square. I would stay here again and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: STACumbriaEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to New York. We picked this hotel through Tripadvisor and were very pleased with it. The location was perfect The staff couldn't have been more helpful. When we first arrived the room we were offered was very hot so we asked to be moved which they did with no problems at all. The room was comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was good. We felt safe leaving our bags on the last day as a member of staff checked them in and out and they were happy for us to leave them until late afternoon. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would stay again in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: Nomad61877
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect hotel for what we needed it for. The rooms were small, but who spends a lot of time in their room when NYC is right outside?? The rooms were very clean, the bathroom was very clean as well, small, but cute. No complaints there. As far as the location, it could not be more perfect. Walk a 1/2 block and you are in Times Square, and can easily catch a taxi to go uptown or downtown. The staff was very friendly, eager to help in any way. The continental breakfast was a nice suprise, being that it was a small, inexpensive hotel. The price of the room was reasonable, even on a holiday weekend. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family - it is a nice, basic hotel in a good location for a decent price. I plan on staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights last month. Fantastic location, in a quiet street considering that its about 200 yards from Times Square. Clean, spacious rooms. Friendly, helpful staff and a great continental breakfast included. Within walking distance to heaps of major attractions. I highly recommend this hotel. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant room, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Cindysinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Midtown for twelve nights in October. The hotel is pleasant enough, in a perfect location, but I found my front-facing room looking on to 46th Street extremely noisy. At all hours of the day and night, garbage trucks would pull up a few doors down the street and stand there for up to an hour, grinding refuse. Fortunately I'd brought ear plugs, which came in very handy when I was regularly woken at 3 or 4 in the morning. There was also a permanent roaring, whooshing sound coming from outside - possibly from a big airconditioning unit on a building opposite. On the plus side, the room was spacious, and definitely nicer than the quieter but smaller and stuffier rooms at the back of the hotel, which look directly on to a brick wall, so I decided to rather put up with the noise. The breakfast that was included in the price was also a plus, as was the unlimited internet access available in the little computer room off the lobby. I also enjoyed having a coffee-maker and hairdryer in the room. However, on my next visit to NYC, I'll probably go back to the Portland Square Hotel where I've always stayed before. It's round the corner on 47th Street, so the location is just as perfect, and the price is far less - $105 for a standard double ensuite, compared with $162 at the Comfort Inn. I've always asked for a street-facing room there and have never had a probem with noise, and at least you can open the windows and get a breath of fresh air, which you can't do at the Comfort Inn. The rooms might be a bit more worn-looking, but are spotlessly clean with towels and linen being changed daily, and the bathroom pristine, with all the usual toiletries provided. There is also air-conditioning, cable TV and an in-room safe - very handy. No, breakfast is not included, but one can get a cheap, delicious breakfast at the Evergreen Diner right across the street, so that's not a problem. There is also no in-room coffee-maker, but I always carry my own little immersion heater, so once again, not a problem. All in all, I have yet to discover a better deal in New York City, than the Portland Square Hotel, for value for money

Reviews.Title: “Best Time in NYC at Macy's Parade”
Reviews.Author: lsdawson
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor is the best! I started making plans in June for my daughter and I to visit the Macy's parade. I wasn't sure what to expect, but Trip Advisor was right on the money with everything I checked out. Comfort Inn Midtown was great - not too high priced, the people there were so nice and helpful. The rooms are a little small - but who spends much time in the room when you're in New York? The motel is within walking distance to almost everything! We only walked ONE block to the parade at Times Square. Rockefeller Center, theater district, Macy's, Empire State building are all close too. We had a great time and hope to do it again some day!

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: fifer72
Reviews.Content: What can i say? We booked this hotel because off the reviews on here, and we certainly were not disappointed. We had one off the front facing rooms on the top floor 9th, the room was really big,so ask for a tront facing room if possible. VERY CLEAN maid cleaned every day, new towels every day. Staff really helpful with advising us about the area. Really decent price considering you are 20 yards from times square. Breakfast included but we normally went to Evergreen 47th st. Would definetly use again 5 *******

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: leoburk
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered everything we were looking for: 1. Economy rates under 190 per night 2. comfortable queen size bed 3. excellent shower & good sized bathroom 4. good sound proofing 5. location - 1 minute to Times Square, walking distance to Broadway Shows, Macy's, etc. 6. clean rooms 7. everything worked in room (tv, clock, air) 8. reasonable breakfast (however with the choices in Manhattan we ate out ) 9. free local phone calls / free safe box at front desk They allowed us to check in early given the room was available. The only suggestion I could make to management is that a security system be added to the elevator in the evening hours as it seemed nobody looked at us whatever time we came or left our room. The room was small but exactly what I expected. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if I should be so lucky to get back to NYC anytime soon I would not even bother to seach out other accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: char540
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, very close to Time Square! I became a Choice priveleges member right before we left and they allowed us a 2pm checkout and also checked us in right when we arrived, about an hour early. Staff was pleasant, rooms were small but clean. Good free breakfast, but a deli down the street offered a bit more at a reasonable cost. I stayed at the Ameritania a few years ago...and this was soooo much better and more reasonable. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the room was small, it was spotlessly clean. The bathroom appeared to be recently renovated with a shower, no bath, but in excellent condition. Staff were friendly and helpful. And all this a half a block from Times Square, within easy walking distance of all the theatres, Fifth Avenue shops, and excellent restaurants. Would definitely make this my hotel of choice for a week-end getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 3 nights in the Comfort Inn and if we are ever booking a hotel in Manhattan again this will be the place. 1. Excellent location - Just two minutes to the TKTS booth. Get there early Thursday to Sunday - LONG lines even at 2.20. Monday to Wedensday lines are short and better choice of shows. We saw The Producers on one night but being Irish it wasn't really our cup of tea - different humour! Lots of people said they enjoyed it and it has great reviews so maybe it's just us. Went to see Slava's Snow Show on our last night - absolutely brilliant! It's really different and if anyone has seen any of the Cirque du Soliel productions, this show is all about the 'clowns' in those shows. It's a real 'feel good show' and I was smiling for hours afterwards. GO SEE IT. It's off braodway (14th and Broadway Union Sq.) and is every bit as good if not better than some of the Broadway shows. Try to get tickets which are on the ground floor and not under the mezanine (you'll see why when you go!!!) - Subway just a couple of blocks away. Two stops to Macy's (came in EXTREMELY handy) and Toys R us etc. USE THE SUBWAY and buy a day travel ticket for $7 (compared to $2/ride). 2. Great breakfast. - No need to waste time looking for somewhere to eat early in the morning. It DOES get a bit busy just before 9am but it isn't a problem. We always got seats and the guy setting it up is VERY helpful. However, if you do feel like a fry-up or a big breakfast there is a great place on 47th st (It's called Evergreen or something like that). Also GREAT Indian place - Bombay something on 49th st. 3. Clean rooms OK there a bit small but who cares. There not cramped or anything and I have stayed in smaller. If anything it made us keep everything tidy and theres a closet which has shelves where you can put all your purchases. Room was really hot but there is air- conditioning (just turn it to 10 for maximum NOT 1). The fan does make a little noise but it's nothing to really worry about. YES towels are fairly thin and small but they are fine. 4. Other. We didn't ask for a corner room and maybe if we had the room might have been a bit bigger with a view (we were looking at a brick wall). The bonus of the brick wall - no noise! We got to check in at 10.30am with no problems even though official check in isnt until 3pm. They also stored our bags until 8pm no problem. STAY HERE !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in October and really enjoyed our stay. The staff are friendly and helpful and the location of the Hotel is perfect, only half a block from Times Square. We were staying in one of the larger corner rooms (802) and it was a good size. Our room was spotlessly clean. The free continental breakfast was great too, with a good choice of food, not just the usual danish pastries! There was fruit, toast, cereal, bagels, yoghurt, doughnuts and cakes. It can get busy if you are not there early, but we never had a problem getting a seat. We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. A good value hotel for the price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Am I missing something here?”
Reviews.Author: 123456FLY
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to New York City, and I always stay in midtown Manhattan. I must say that the bulk of these reviews is somewhat surprising ... they're bordering on the gushing, which I find rather surprising for a hotel that offers rooms that are rather worn (at least mine was) and somewhat, um, dingy. I found the bathroom in particular to be sub-par. Maybe if you book at a special low rate (like I did), you will get one of the "inferior" rooms. Other than the price and the location, there is nothing particularly special about this hotel. If you are on a tight budget, I would recommend this place. But I find the Red Roof Inn on West 32nd St to be far superior for about the same price. P.S. I remember staying at the other Comfort Inn (Manhattan) on West 35th Street during the month of February -- there was no heat in my room as well as in others. And this hotel won a gold ribbon award -- can you believe it? Pack your sweaters!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! Was I ever surprised. Booking this hotel for a group of 7+1 infant & I was worried about it's location & cleanliness. The reviews on Trip Advisor were right on.
