The hotel was 1/2 block from Times Square and so clean! The rooms are small, but when you are in NYC you are not hanging out in your room as the city is so fabulous. The front desk staff were extremely friendly, allowing us to check our baggage & have something to eat prior to checking in. (It was early in the morning) Great coffee, bagels, yogurt... (all included in the price of the room.) I will definately be staying here on my future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “best budget hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: hotchildinthecity
Reviews.Content: this is my second review and second stay. The last room I had was very big and faced the street. This time I booked last minute and got a fairly small room. Still amenities were there, bathroom was in excellent condition. Very clean and friendly staff. I like this place because they hold your bags after check-out. Breakfast has the essentials but if you walk to 42nd street, there are tons of breakfast places that offer a greater variety. Overall, the best place to stay. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Not easy to cancel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend as the chain of hotels does not have a set policy on cancellations. It varies with the hotel and reservations person. It was impossible to cancel the hotel when not able to travel. When you call hotel they transfer you to another group who handles reservations which is independent from Comfort Inn and Choice (Kapil Care Hotels???) who said absolutely no refund under any circumstance. We called Choice Hotels again for help as we were not able to travel. They (we spoke to two different people) said they called the hotel (or Kapil_ and had no success, then when questioned they said they have a list of hotels which have no refund ever policies (okay, so why not just state that and not pretend to call the hotel to help???). Choice would not let us know how to tell which Choice Hotels did not allow cancellations. They said that is a list only they have so only they know which hotels never give refunds. Nice policy. Note, the airline gave a voucher for future travel with no fee.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, located centrally in Manhattan. The perfect starting point to discover Manhattan. Very cheap for what you get. Whenever we are back in NYC, we will definitely stat at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: UKperson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here sat 9th Oct thru to tues 12th Oct. As others mentioned towels a bit small/thin but otherwise fine. location excellent for Times sq. and transport ( subway etc). Breakfast adequate and included in room rate. No in room safe but deposit boxes at reception (chargeable . Room tidy and clean, for NY a reasonable size. Bit noisy facing street - but then its the Big apple ! Excellent Deli in next street ( 115 W 45th about same position as Comfort Inn but in next street ) called Cranberry Deli . Self selection hot / cold meals and salads ( breakfast / lunch / dinner) , loads of fresh fruit , drinks etc. Upstairs dining as well as take out . Fantastic place .

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Pnemiller
Reviews.Content: We sent an overnight in this midtown Manhattan spot--for NYC it was a great value (especially if one used AAA or AARP discounts)--our room was $125.99 including a pretty good continental breakfast of juice, cereal, bagels, doughnuts, yogurt, etc. The location is great, on 46th St.,between 6 and 7th Aves., about a block from the Times Square area. The hotel has an inviting small lobby area and the rooms, while somewhat small, but adequate, were nicely furnished with new paint, wallpaper, etc. The staff goes out of its way to be helpful--you can check luggage if you arrive early or if you check out and leave later. Towels are somewhat thin, but overall this is a great place to stay in NYC. Do not miss it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Midtown was a great place. Although the room was small, it had everything we needed. The Continental breakfast was great too. The staff was quite friendly and the hotel was clean. Well worth the money. The high speed wireless internet sucked though. Did not function properly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Standard & Location”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: This 79 room hotel provides excellent value. Very clean & secure. Rooms have TV & coffee maker. The complimentary breakfast, available 7 till 10 was a bonus. Ideal for a short visit as its close to Times Sq. for bus & subway.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in NYC - really!”
Reviews.Author: Likes_to_eat
Reviews.Content: Truly the best bargain in NYC at present. We've stayed in several 3-4 star hotels in the upper $200+ range, and this hotel, for under $200 is clean, comfortable and in a terrific location! "The Muse" is right across the street and is $250 a nite! While they may have thicker towels, and plusher carpet, their rooms are no bigger. Re: other concerns: the people we met in the hotel were really nice, the staff friendly, efficient and courteous, the elevator, although only one, came quickly, and the shower had great water pressure. The ac had a timer setting, and the tv had cable. Other things like a coffee maker, ice bucket, etc., were all stock amenities in the room. The ONLY downside was the not-so-thick towels, but I could live with that! Also, parking down the street that the Comfort Inn recommends and stamps for, is a bargain in NYC. Don't forget to ask for your AAA discount!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read about the Comfort Inn Midtown on the Trip Advisor web site. It had received excellent reviews. We were not disappointed. It reminded me of an English Bed and Breakfast Inn. The rooms were spotless, staff friendly and helpful, complimentary breadfast was all one could eat, the room was quiet, location of hotel near Times Square is perfect for theatre goers. The only noise we heard was the morning chiming of church bells next door. The room rate is reasonable. Also appreciated the in-room coffe-maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board. The other guests were congenial. Yes, I will stay there on my next trip to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Beat this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: buckeyephil
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Very clean rooms and public areas. Helpful, courteous staff, great rates and location. Nice complementary breakfast. Have been to NYC several times and I have never been more satisfied with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms with a helpful staff. I didn't expect much for under $100, but this place was perfect for a quick trip to the city when all we would do at the hotel was sleep. It's not fancy with lots of frills -- but is all that you need and in the heart of Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reasonably priced hotel near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Comfort Inn (3 – 9 Aug) on recommendations found on this and other review sites. It was a good hotel at a reasonable price, but as we came from the UK we didn't qualify for any discounts. The check-in was quick and staff were generally friendly and helpful. On check-in we asked for a quiet room and were told that if we wanted a quiet room it would be small. It certainly was small, but as we were only 2 it was bearable. And it was quiet as long as you didn’t switch on the air conditioning. I thought I might get used to it, but after 3 nights I still couldn’t sleep well because of the noise. Luckily it wasn’t too hot after that, so we just left it switched off at night. Otherwise the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was not much of a view, but I wasn’t expecting any at this price. Bathroom was also small and clean. There was no safe in the room, but you can use one at reception at no extra cost. The lift was not fast, but I’d seen slower. I didn’t find it a big problem and we were staying on the 9th floor. The breakfast was o.k. (bagels, toast, donuts), but it was always busy in the tiny breakfast room. So you couldn’t relax, we just ate quickly and got out. Location was great, if you want to stay near Times Square. It was also close to several subway stations, so getting around was no problem. Most restaurants in this area are overpriced and not very good. However, we liked Via Brasil and especially Trattoria Trecolori where we had one of the best Italian meals ever. I recommend this hotel to first time visitors to New York. However, the crowds of tourists in that area got on my nerves a bit after a few days, so I probably would stay in a different neighbourhood next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several weekdays in June, 2004. I was very satisfied with the size of the room, cleanliness, and the friendliness of the staff. It has a wonderful location, close to Times Square, the diamond district and Broadway venues - but far enough not to get a lot of the noise. From my room, I didn't hear any bells ringing from the church next door. The only "problem" is that it has one slow elevator. If you have difficulty walking and you are impatient, this may not be the right hotel for you. I would gladly return here on a future trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, just steps from theaters, restaurants and the subway. Very helpful staff, they found a place to park my full size truck that didn't require refinancing to pay for. Hotel is clean, modern, and while the room sizes were moderate, they weren't cramped by any definition. No problems with the elevator either. I've paid more for less in cities other than NY. I would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - hard as a rock beds”
Reviews.Author: Paul14
Reviews.Content: Our first trip ever to NYC - 10 wonderful days! Just a warning though - yes, the Comfort Inn is all of those things you're reading in the 5 star reviews. It's has a great location, good staff, nice breakfast, and is a great economy choice for a vacation. The only warning is the beds - at least ours - are cheap and hard. They have to cut corners somewhere, right? Sheets are not cotton, some sort of slick feeling, thin, polyester I'd guess. And the bed? Practice with a couple of nights on your garage floor and you'll do fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great Staff, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: ppearce43
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay. Excellent Staff, excellent location. Small rooms and a bit of trouble with the plumbing, but no big deal. Much better than the rooms we had in Venice and Rome. Would definitely stay here again! Very good continental breakfast, comfortable beds, location can't be beat, affordable, clean, GREAT value. Attitude is everything. If you are looking for master bedroom sized rooms, the Marriott Marquis is just 5 minutes away, but will cost you a bunch more. What makes this hotel special is the Staff. They will take care of you. We found the rooms comfortable, the a/c worked great. I'm recommending this property to everyone I know who is going to NY on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to stay and park”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 nights at this hotel. The location is excellent, just steps away from Times Square and everything else mentioned here. Parking is just 5 doors down at a rate of $20. per 24 hours with validation. Front desk staff very helpful and pleasant (Jiovanni) and bellman (Sidibi) treated us like we were at the Plaza Hotel, very friendly and courteous. Bathroom is very spacious and found it and the bedroom to be very clean and well maintained. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking simply for location and a clean safe place to stay while visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good People -Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SteveS60
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a great location. The staff and service was excellent and the continental breakfast adequate. We asked for a quite room and recieved one (albeit a bit small). But, in short walking distance to most theatres and the TKTS booth. For the money I think it was a great value (non-smoking as well).

Reviews.Title: “Small, no-frills hotel--perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed five nights here in last week of June, paying $125/night (U.S.) with AAA discount. The hotel is very small and has few amenities but its location more than makes up for it. It's a perfect launching pad for exploring the city, especially if you’re up for walking and taking buses and trains. It’s a 2-minute walk from Times square, a 10-minute walk from Rockefeller Center and about the same to the 42nd Street subway. (By the way, be prepared for a variety of added NYC taxes on your final hotel bill!) I was on my guard regarding what the hotel would be like, after reading all the various reviews of NYC hotels. But it’s all about expectations. Expect less and you’ll be satisfied with less. Check-in was fine. Hotel lobby was quite nice. Asked about a bigger room at the back and was given 606. Smallish elevator and only one. Room was smaller than most hotels we’ve stayed in North America, but was larger than the discount rooms we had in Rome and Venice. Bathroom was very small, shower quite small, and very limited counter space at sink. View? Brick walls, pigeons, air conditioners and an alley. (Only rooms on floors 7-9 get an actual view of any kind.) Room included TV, nice firm queen bed, desk, side table, small closet with some hangers, iron, ironing board, and bathroom hair dryer. There were a couple of cigarette burns on the bedspread/blanket. Air conditioner worked great for us with temps around 28C every day. No bugs, room was cleaned every morning, room service supplied extra towels when we asked. Room was very quiet at night. One computer available for free internet usage on main floor. Supposedly Wi-Fi was available in room as well as the high-speed line, but I wasn’t able to make it work for my older Mac laptop and the staff weren't able to help. Ice is only available in basement, the biggest inconvenience we faced (which really wasn’t a huge deal). Staff were relatively helpful. If you want to be pampered, this is not the hotel for you. They will help take care of you but they generally make guests feel independent. That part of it made me think of a hostel. The bellmen weren't highly enthusiastic but did their job. Simple but very sufficient free breakfast included bagels, donuts, toast, buns, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, juice. Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it for budget-conscious couples who will spend most of their day away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: senor_nt
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3-nite stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown. Completely satisfied! Hotel is clean, quiet. Staff attentive and responsive (got a bathroom problem fixed in 10 minutes after the call). Excellent location to explore Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Tankiebaby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Comfort Inn for the last half of our honeymoon. We loved the staff. The gentleman who helped with the continental breakfast was very friendly, and even asked my wife where I was on the 2nd morning of our stay. The front desk was extremely helpful, giving us the lowdown on the city and restaurant choices in the area. Only a block from the middle of Times Square, but on a quieter street so it wasn't in the middle of everything, an excellent location! The business center and workout facilities were a nice touch for the room as well. We got the best rate by going straight to Comfort Inn's website. Parking was across the street. We kept our vehicle there for 72 hours, and it only cost a total of $60 with a hotel stamp. The room was small, but clean. And the bathroom was a great size compared to the size of the room. I would recommend anyone to stay there. May not be the fanciest, but it sure was friendly!

Reviews.Title: “All you need!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited in July 2004, Location excellent, rooms clean, staff extremely attentive, hotel quiet. What else do you need? Will stay here again on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: Hab
Reviews.Content: I resided at this property a few weeks ago. for two days. I wanted a room close to Times Square that was reasonably priced and clean. I booked through the hotel website and found a rate of $125.00. This is the max I would have wanted to pay for this room. The room is very small (as most New York hotel rooms are) and very basic. Nothing fancy about the rooms at all. The location was excellent. Couldn't have been any better. Had a small issue with the toilet not being as clean as it should have been which pretty much ruined the confidence I had in the hotel. The disgusting picture never left my mind throughout the whole trip. I do understand that the housekeeping staff can not be PERFECT and I don't expect them to be BUT........... The staff are absolutely wonderful. Front desk and door people tried to be very helpful. Previously I stayed at the Super 8 which I later found out that this hotel is part of the same ACCOR hotel group. I met nice people here and would I stay again???? I'm not quite sure. I think I would say no UNLESS the rate is very low. There is no view as might be expected. I would say that the best part of the the Comfort Inn Midtown is the staff and the what needs improvement is the quality of the furniture, bedding, carpet etc. It would seem to me that because the rooms are small it would be not as expensive to furnish the rooms with some quality items. I think that people would not mind "small" if it was small but classy and decorated with a somewhat quality items. It would give the place a whole different air of quality which regrettfully it does not have. I'll mention housekeeping may need a little improvement but my toilet situation may have been an isolated thing. Hey, I'm not perfect on my job either but constructive criticism does not hurt. Please do NOT let me discourage you from trying this property. It's probably fine for some but I'm telling the experience I had. All in all...two days was enough for me. I was ready to leave. Was it awful - "NO". Could it use improvement..."YES"

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and staff at Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a five night stay at the Comfort Inn Midtown and found the hotel to be clean,comfortable and the staff helpful in every way. While the room was small it was clean and met our needs for two people. Everyone on the staff was friendly and the hotel is in an excellent location to Times Square, Theatres and Shopping. It is in walking distance to Rockefeller Center,NBC studios and David Letterman. Price is reasonable for Manhattan and we would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean!”
Reviews.Author: rodeorobin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Fourth of July weekend and it was wonderful! The location is absolutely perfect if you want to spend time wandering Times Square & doing the Broadway circuit! The rooms were much bigger than I expected, plenty of room for my husband & I and two large suitcases! The bathroom for roomy enough for two people at the same time and was very clean! We made a couple of requests to the staff and they responded quickly & politely! Kenneth & "The Breakfast Gentleman" were wonderful & amazing employees! The free continential breakfast was very appealing (donuts, bagels, toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, beverages). The other reviews are correct in that the elevator is slow, but it never was an inconvience. I am very picky when it comes to hotel cleanliness and it was perfect! The air conditioner was great & the bed was comfy! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “first trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Big Apple. I read all the reviews on this hotel and thanks to you guys, we were very well pleased. The room was small but very neat and clean. The bathroom was a good size and the internet was a plus. The bed was comfty and I asked for extra pillows and the maid brought them right away. There was plenty of room for all the shopping bags in a large closet. The breakfast spread was impressive and more than enough to get us going in the mornings. Everyone working in the hotel was extremely nice and helpful. They gave good directions and cashed travelers cheques for me. The location was wonderful. Close to everything including the subway. I felt safe at all times and we were out at all hours. We paid $125 a night. We will definetely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To add my thoughts to the many others on this little hotel...this was a marvelous find for me the first time I visited NYC in July 2001 with courteous staff, excellent location and rooms that were clean. Yes, they are small, but I don't come to NYC planning to spend much time in the hotel. The continental breakfast is a nice included bonus. I have stayed there on almost every trip since and have never been disappointed. As a female who travels solo to the city from time to time, I can definitely say that I always felt very safe with the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Rates - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is awesome! It was under $110 a night with a continental breakfast included. How could you beat that along with $20 parking for 24 hours and only one safe block away from Times Square. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great! Cheap! Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It stayed there at the end of may and it was great. Paid 120 Dollar per night and excepted not too much but was impressed. Rooms are clean and big enough, towels are changed every day, TV, Phone, Coffeemaker, Iron - all in the room. Great Hotel to stay, great location, just around the corner of Times Square!!! STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BATravelerBA
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this page were helpful in making the decision to stay at this hotel. We booked online through Comfort Inn's web page and got a AAA discount at a great rate from midweek (June3-5). The rooms were tiny, although clean and quiet. The location made up for the small room. Being so close to Times Square and the subway were an added bonus. I would definately recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and want a room close to the action and in a safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis and a real Haven in manhattanin...!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Comfort Inn..23 thru 30th March 04 Fabulous wee smart quiet hotel...staff genuinely friendly..if you make the effort also ! Rooms clean and functional....although you may face a wall !...however because of its superb location you will be out most of the times ..strolling around ! Watch out for your Air con Unit..ours needed 'fixed' as rooms built up quite a heat Some room doors can bang shut..so do think of other guests ! Breakfast room is a treat ..Antony'hovers' and makes sure everybody is serviced (with a genuine smile.. not the "have a nice day" insincere nonsense either) ...good selection of all you might need in a continental breakfast. 46th Street is a very mixed activity area..with a Church next door.Bells calling the faithful are quite pleasant..& not loud We enjoyed our strolls morning and night....with no real worries Would defineatly go back.....saw the large 'lines', at other Hotel check in/outs..you wont get this here !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: BarbDale1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from March 17 - 21. This is a great value for a hotel in NYC. We paid $107 per night, which included a fairly substantial continental breakfast. First - the room was a decent size. We did not feel cramped. Second - the bed was comfortable, as was the temperature of the room. Third - we barely heard any noise from neighboring rooms even though the hotel was sold out. Fourth - breakfast included coffee, capaccino, juice, cereal, good fresh donuts and bagels, apples, bananas, yogurt and jellies, cream cheese, etc. Many days we only snacked in the afternoon and ate our next full meal for dinner. Fifth - room was done beautifully each day, asked for extra pillows and they were there when we returned. Sixth - you could not ask for a better location - 1/2 block off of Times Square. Seventh - we felt safe in the neighborhood and in the hotel. Eighth - staff was very friendly and helpful. Only negative - our room faced 46th street. Needed ear plugs to block out the garbage truck noise each morning around 5 am. Believe me, it was loud. Ask for a room away from the street. We will definitely go back to this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Broadway at Times Square Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 129 West 46th Street, New York City, NY 10036 (Formerly Comfort Inn Times Square)
